Title: Chicken Biryani
Ingredients:
For Marination:
500g chicken (bone-in, cut into pieces)
1 cup thick yogurt
1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
1 tsp turmeric powder
1 tbsp red chili powder
1 tbsp coriander powder
½ tsp garam masala
1 tbsp lemon juice
Salt to taste
For Rice:
2 cups basmati rice (soaked for 30 minutes)
4-5 cups water
2-3 cloves
2-3 green cardamoms
1-inch cinnamon stick
1 bay leaf
1 tsp salt
1 tbsp ghee
For Biryani Masala:
2 large onions (thinly sliced)
2 large tomatoes (chopped)
2 green chilies (slit)
½ cup fresh coriander leaves (chopped)
½ cup mint leaves (chopped)
1 tsp cumin seeds
1 tsp garam masala
1 tsp biryani masala (optional)
¼ cup warm milk with a pinch of saffron strands
2 tbsp ghee
3 tbsp oil
Instructions:
Step 1: Marinate the Chicken
In a bowl, mix chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (overnight for best results).
Step 2: Prepare the Rice
In a pot, bring water to a boil. Add cloves, cardamoms, cinnamon, bay leaf, salt, and ghee.
Add the soaked rice and cook until it is 70% cooked (grains should still be firm).
Drain the rice and set aside.
Step 3: Prepare the Chicken Masala
Heat oil and ghee in a large pan. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add cumin seeds, green chilies, chopped tomatoes, coriander leaves, and mint leaves. Cook until tomatoes turn soft.
Add the marinated chicken and cook on medium heat until the chicken is tender and the oil separates.
Step 4: Layering the Biryani
In a heavy-bottomed pan, layer half of the cooked rice.
Spread the chicken masala evenly over the rice.
Add the remaining rice as the top layer.
Drizzle saffron-infused milk and ghee over the rice.
Cover with a tight lid and cook on low heat (dum) for 20-25 minutes.
Step 5: Serve
Gently fluff the biryani before serving.
Garnish with more fresh coriander and fried onions if desired.
Serve hot with raita or salad.

Title: Dal Tadka
Ingredients:
1 cup toor dal (pigeon peas)
3 cups water
1 onion (chopped)
1 tomato (chopped)
1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
½ tsp turmeric
1 tsp cumin seeds
1 tsp mustard seeds
1-2 dried red chilies
1 tsp red chili powder
1 tsp garam masala
2 tbsp ghee
Coriander leaves for garnish
Instructions:
1.Pressure cook dal with water, turmeric, and salt until soft. Mash it.
2.Heat ghee, add cumin, mustard, red chilies, onion, ginger-garlic paste, and tomatoes. Cook well.
3.Add chili powder, garam masala, and cooked dal. Simmer for 5 mins.
4.Garnish with coriander and serve hot with rice or roti.

Title: Aloo Paratha
Ingredients: Whole Wheat Flour, Potatoes, Green Chilies, Ginger, Coriander, Cumin, Ajwain, Salt, Butter, Ghee
Instructions: 1. Boil and mash potatoes. 2. Mix with spices, chilies, and coriander. 3. Knead dough with wheat flour and water. 4. Stuff potato mixture inside dough and roll into a paratha. 5. Cook on a tawa with ghee until golden brown.

Title: Chole Bhature
Ingredients: Chickpeas, Onion, Tomato, Garlic, Ginger, Spices (Chole Masala, Garam Masala, Turmeric, Cumin, Coriander), Flour, Yogurt, Baking Powder, Ghee
Instructions: 1. Soak chickpeas overnight and boil. 2. Sauté onions, tomatoes, garlic, and ginger with spices. 3. Add chickpeas and simmer. 4. Make dough for bhature and let it rest for 2 hours. 5. Roll into circles and deep fry.

Title: Masala Dosa
Ingredients: Rice, Urad Dal, Potatoes, Onion, Green Chilies, Curry Leaves, Mustard Seeds, Ghee, Coconut Chutney, Sambar
Instructions: 1. Soak rice and dal for 6 hours, then grind into a batter and ferment overnight. 2. Boil potatoes and mash with spices. 3. Heat tawa, spread batter into a thin dosa, add potato filling, and fold. 4. Serve with chutney and sambar.

Title: Pani Puri
Ingredients: Sooji, Flour, Potatoes, Black Chickpeas, Green Chilies, Mint, Tamarind, Spices (Chaat Masala, Cumin Powder, Black Salt), Water
Instructions: 1. Make puris by frying rolled dough. 2. Prepare potato-chickpea filling. 3. Blend mint, tamarind, and spices into pani. 4. Crack puris, fill with stuffing, and add pani.

Title: Rajma Chawal
Ingredients: Rajma (Kidney beans) - 1 cup; Basmati rice - 2 cups; Onion (finely chopped) - 1 large; Tomato (pureed) - 2 large; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Green chilies (chopped) - 2; Cumin seeds - 1 tsp; Bay leaf - 1; Cinnamon stick - 1 inch; Cloves - 3; Black cardamom - 1; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves) - 1/2 tsp; Salt - to taste; Oil - 2 tbsp; Ghee - 1 tbsp; Fresh coriander (chopped) - for garnish; Water - 3 cups
Instructions:
'1. Wash and soak rajma overnight or for at least 8 hours. 
2. Drain and pressure cook with fresh water and a little salt for 15-20 minutes until soft. 
3. In a pan, heat oil and ghee together. Add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves, and black cardamom. 
4. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 
5. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes. 
6. Mix in tomato puree, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates. 
7. Add cooked rajma along with its stock and let it simmer for 10-15 minutes. 
8. Crush kasuri methi and sprinkle it in, then add garam masala. Stir well. 
9. For the chawal, wash basmati rice, cook in 4 cups of boiling water with a little salt until tender. Drain and keep warm. 
10. Garnish rajma with chopped coriander and serve hot with steamed rice.',

Title: Gulab Jamun
Ingredients: Mawa (Khoya), Flour, Baking Powder, Milk, Sugar, Cardamom, Rose Water, Ghee
Instructions:
Mash khoya (mawa) well to remove lumps. You can also grate it first.
Add grated paneer, sooji, maida, baking powder, and cardamom powder.
Mix gently and add milk to form a soft dough (do not knead).
If the dough feels dry, add a few teaspoons of milk.
Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Shape into small balls and keep them covered.
Making Sugar Syrup
Heat sugar and water until the syrup becomes slightly sticky (before one-thread consistency).
Add rose water and mix well.
If the syrup crystallizes on cooling, add 2-3 tbsp water and reheat.

Title: Rasgulla
Ingredients: Milk, Lemon Juice, Sugar, Cardamom, Rose Water
Instructions: 1. Boil milk and curdle with lemon juice. 2. Drain and knead paneer into a smooth dough. 3. Shape into balls and boil in sugar syrup until spongy. 4. Cool and serve chilled.

Title: Misal Pav
Ingredients: Sprouted moth beans, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, ginger, garlic, goda masala, pav (bread rolls)
Instructions: Cook sprouts with masala, serve with chopped onions, lemon, and pav

Title: Rogan Josh
Ingredients: Mutton, yogurt, onions, garlic, ginger, Kashmiri red chili powder, fennel powder, garam masala
Instructions: Marinate mutton with yogurt and spices. Sauté onions, add mutton and slow cook until tender.

Title: Hyderabadi Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice, chicken/mutton, yogurt, fried onions, saffron, garam masala, bay leaves
Instructions: Marinate meat with spices, layer with rice, and cook on dum.

Title: Samosa
Ingredients: All-purpose flour, potatoes, peas, spices, oil, carom seeds, ginger
Instructions: Prepare dough, make filling with spiced potatoes, shape into triangles, and deep-fry.

Title: Vada Pav
Ingredients: Potatoes, chickpea flour, pav bread, mustard seeds, green chilies, garlic
Instructions: Make potato vada, dip in chickpea flour, deep-fry, and serve with pav and chutney.

Title: Dahi Puri
Ingredients: Puris, boiled potatoes, curd, tamarind chutney, mint chutney, sev, chaat masala
Instructions: Stuff puris with potatoes, top with chutneys, curd, and sev.

Title: Pav Bhaji
Ingredients: Potatoes, tomatoes, green peas, capsicum, butter, pav bhaji masala
Instructions: Cook vegetables, mash with masala, serve with buttered pav.

Title: Chettinad Chicken Curry
Ingredients: Chicken, shallots, garlic, peppercorns, coconut, curry leaves, cinnamon, cloves
Instructions: Roast and grind spices, cook chicken with coconut and masala.

Title: Dal Baati Churma
Ingredients: Wheat flour, ghee, dal (lentils), jaggery, cardamom, spices
Instructions: Bake baati in oven, cook dal with spices, serve with churma.

Title: Butter Chicken
Ingredients: Chicken, butter, tomatoes, cream, ginger, garlic, garam masala, kasuri methi
Instructions: Marinate chicken, cook in butter with tomatoes, blend into gravy, and add cream.

Title: Mutton Keema
Ingredients: Mutton mince, onions, tomatoes, green chilies, garam masala, ginger, garlic
Instructions: Cook minced mutton with onions, tomatoes, and spices until well done.

Title: Laal Maas
Ingredients: Mutton, dried red chilies, garlic, yogurt, mustard oil, whole spices
Instructions: Marinate mutton in yogurt and chilies, slow cook in mustard oil.

Title: Goan Prawn Curry
Ingredients: Prawns, coconut milk, tamarind, kokum, mustard seeds, curry leaves
Instructions: Cook prawns in coconut milk with tamarind and spices.

Title: Chicken 65
Ingredients: Chicken, curry leaves, yogurt, red chilies, ginger, garlic, cornstarch
Instructions: Marinate chicken, deep-fry, and toss with curry leaves and spices.

Title: Nadan Kozhi Curry
Ingredients: Chicken, coconut, curry leaves, shallots, green chilies, fennel, cloves
Instructions: Cook chicken with roasted coconut and Kerala spices.

Title: Mutton Kosha
Ingredients: Mutton, mustard oil, onions, ginger, garlic, bay leaves, garam masala
Instructions: Slow cook mutton with onions, mustard oil, and spices until tender.

Title: Tandoori Chicken
Ingredients: Chicken, yogurt, lemon juice, tandoori masala, red chili, garlic, ginger
Instructions: Marinate chicken in spiced yogurt, cook in tandoor or oven.

Title: Kerala Fish Curry
Ingredients: Fish, coconut milk, tamarind, mustard seeds, curry leaves, red chilies
Instructions: Cook fish in coconut milk with tamarind and Kerala spices.

Title: Paya Soup
Ingredients: Goat trotters, onions, ginger, garlic, peppercorns, turmeric, coriander
Instructions: Slow cook trotters with spices and herbs for a rich broth.

Title: Paneer Butter Masala
Ingredients:
• 200g paneer (cubed)
• 2 tbsp butter
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 onion (finely chopped)
• 2 tbsp fresh cream
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp garam masala
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp coriander powder
• 1/2 cup water
• Salt to taste
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander leaves (for garnish)
Instructions:
1. Heat butter in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
4. Add pureed tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt. Cook for 5-7 minutes until oil separates.
5. Add paneer cubes and mix well.
6. Pour in water, stir, and simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Add fresh cream and garam masala, mix, and cook for another 2 minutes.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or rice.

Title: Rajma (Kidney Bean Curry)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup rajma (kidney beans, soaked overnight)
• 2 onions (finely chopped)
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp garam masala
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp coriander powder
• 2 tbsp oil
• 2 cups water
• Salt to taste
• Coriander leaves for garnish
Instructions:
1. Pressure cook soaked rajma with salt and 2 cups water for 6-7 whistles.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 2 minutes.
5. Add tomato puree, red chili powder, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook for 7 minutes.
6. Add cooked rajma with water, mix well, and let simmer for 15 minutes.
7. Stir in garam masala and cook for another 2 minutes.
8. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

Title: Aloo Gobi (Potato & Cauliflower Curry)
Ingredients:
• 2 medium potatoes (peeled and diced)
• 1 small cauliflower (cut into florets)
• 1 onion (finely chopped)
• 1 tomato (chopped)
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1/2 tsp coriander powder
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
• 2 tbsp water
• Chopped coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
4. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
5. Add diced potatoes and cauliflower florets, mix well.
6. Add 2 tbsp water, cover, and cook on low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Sprinkle garam masala, mix well, and cook for another 2 minutes.
8. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti or rice.

Title: Palak Paneer (Spinach & Cottage Cheese)
Ingredients:
• 200g paneer (cubed)
• 2 cups spinach (blanched and pureed)
• 1 onion (chopped)
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp fresh cream
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
4. Add tomato puree, turmeric, and red chili powder. Cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add pureed spinach, mix well, and cook for 5 minutes.
6. Add paneer cubes, garam masala, and salt. Stir well and cook for another 5 minutes.
7. Add fresh cream, mix well, and serve hot with roti or naan.

Title: Baingan Bharta (Smoked Mashed Eggplant)
Ingredients:
• 1 large eggplant (roasted and mashed)
• 1 onion (chopped)
• 1 tomato (chopped)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
• Chopped coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. Roast the eggplant directly on a flame until charred and soft. Peel off the skin and mash it.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
5. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and red chili powder. Cook for 5 minutes.
6. Add mashed eggplant, mix well, and cook for 7-8 minutes.
7. Add garam masala and salt, stir well.
8. Garnish with coriander and serve hot with roti.

Title: Dal Tadka (Lentil Curry)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas)
• 1 onion (chopped)
• 1 tomato (chopped)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1 tbsp ghee
• Salt to taste
• 2 cups water
• Chopped coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. Rinse and pressure cook toor dal with 2 cups water, turmeric, and salt for 3-4 whistles.
2. Heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
5. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and garam masala. Cook for 5 minutes.
6. Pour cooked dal into the pan, mix well, and simmer for 5 minutes.
7. Garnish with coriander and serve hot with rice or roti.

Title: Malai Kofta (Paneer Dumplings in Gravy)
Ingredients:
• 200g paneer (grated)
• 2 boiled potatoes (mashed)
• 2 tbsp cornflour
• 2 onions (chopped)
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1/2 cup fresh cream
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Mix grated paneer, mashed potatoes, cornflour, salt, and form small balls.
2. Deep fry until golden brown, then set aside.
3. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden.
4. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
5. Add tomato puree, turmeric, and red chili powder. Cook for 5 minutes.
6. Add fresh cream, garam masala, and salt. Stir well and cook for 3 minutes.
7. Add koftas to the gravy, cook for 2 minutes, and serve hot.

Title: Bhindi Masala (Spiced Okra)
Ingredients:
• 250g okra (bhindi), chopped
• 1 onion (chopped)
• 1 tomato (chopped)
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and red chili powder. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
4. Add chopped okra, mix well, and cook uncovered for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add garam masala and salt. Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes.
6. Serve hot with roti or rice.

Title: Matar Paneer (Peas & Cottage Cheese Curry)
Ingredients:
• 200g paneer (cubed)
• 1 cup green peas
• 2 onions (chopped)
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
• 1/2 cup fresh cream
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
4. Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add green peas, paneer cubes, and 1/4 cup water. Cover and cook for 7-8 minutes.
6. Add garam masala, salt, and fresh cream. Stir well and simmer for 2 minutes.
7. Serve hot with roti or rice.

Title: Veg Pulao (Vegetable Rice)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup basmati rice
• 2 cups water
• 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, peas)
• 1 onion (sliced)
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 bay leaf
• 2 cloves
• 1-inch cinnamon stick
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1 tbsp ghee
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Rinse and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes.
2. Heat ghee in a pan, add cumin seeds, bay leaf, cloves, and cinnamon.
3. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.
4. Add chopped vegetables, turmeric, and garam masala. Sauté for 2 minutes.
5. Add drained rice and mix well.
6. Add 2 cups of water and salt. Cover and cook on low heat for 12-15 minutes.
7. Fluff the rice gently and serve hot.

Title: Dum Aloo (Spicy Baby Potato Curry)
Ingredients:
• 10-12 baby potatoes (boiled & peeled)
• 1 onion (chopped)
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1/2 cup yogurt
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Prick boiled potatoes with a fork and shallow fry them until golden. Set aside.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until golden.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
4. Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Add yogurt, mix well, and simmer for 2 minutes.
6. Add fried potatoes, garam masala, and salt. Cover and cook for 5 minutes.
7. Serve hot with roti or naan.

Title: Sambar (South Indian Lentil Soup)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup toor dal (split pigeon peas)
• 3 cups water
• 1/2 cup mixed vegetables (carrots, beans, drumstick)
• 1 small tomato (chopped)
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp sambar powder
• 1/4 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tbsp tamarind pulp
• 1 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
• Curry leaves for garnish
Instructions:
1. Pressure cook toor dal with 3 cups water, turmeric, and salt for 3-4 whistles.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds.
3. Add chopped tomatoes, mixed vegetables, and sauté for 5 minutes.
4. Add cooked dal, sambar powder, and tamarind pulp. Mix well.
5. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Garnish with curry leaves and serve hot with rice or dosa.

Title: Kadai Paneer (Spicy Cottage Cheese Curry)
Ingredients:
• 200g paneer (cubed)
• 1 onion (sliced)
• 1 bell pepper (sliced)
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add sliced onions and bell pepper, sauté for 2 minutes.
3. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, turmeric, and red chili powder. Cook for 5 minutes.
4. Add paneer, garam masala, and salt. Stir well and cook for another 2 minutes.
5. Serve hot with naan or roti.

Title: Dhokla (Steamed Chickpea Cake)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup besan (chickpea flour)
• 1/2 cup yogurt
• 1/2 cup water
• 1 tsp lemon juice
• 1 tsp sugar
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp Eno fruit salt
• Salt to taste
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 2 green chilies (slit)
• 10 curry leaves
• 1 tbsp oil
• 1/4 cup water (for tempering)
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander (for garnish)
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix besan, yogurt, water, lemon juice, sugar, turmeric, and salt to form a smooth batter. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
2. Just before steaming, add Eno fruit salt, mix gently, and pour into a greased steaming tray.
3. Steam for 15-20 minutes until a knife inserted comes out clean.
4. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, green chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a few seconds.
5. Add 1/4 cup water, mix well, and pour over the steamed dhokla.
6. Garnish with chopped coriander and serve with green chutney.

Title: Thepla (Spiced Flatbread)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
• 1/4 cup gram flour (besan)
• 1/2 cup finely chopped fenugreek leaves (methi)
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp cumin powder
• 1/2 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
• 2 tbsp yogurt
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
• Water as needed (for kneading)
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine wheat flour, besan, methi, spices, yogurt, oil, and salt.
2. Knead into a soft dough using water as needed. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
3. Divide into small balls, roll each into a thin circle.
4. Heat a tawa (griddle), cook each thepla on medium heat, flipping until golden brown on both sides.
5. Serve hot with curd or pickle.

Title: Undhiyu (Mixed Vegetable Curry)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup surti papdi (flat beans)
• 1 small brinjal (cubed)
• 1 small potato (cubed)
• 1/2 cup sweet potato (cubed)
• 1/4 cup green peas
• 2 tbsp oil
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp coriander powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1 tbsp green garlic (chopped)
• 2 tbsp grated coconut
• 1 tbsp jaggery
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
2. Add all vegetables, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.
3. Add 1/2 cup water, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes on low heat.
4. Add coriander powder, green garlic, grated coconut, and jaggery.
5. Simmer for another 5 minutes and serve hot with puris or rotis.

Title: Khandvi (Gram Flour Rolls)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup besan (chickpea flour)
• 2 cups buttermilk
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp ginger-green chili paste
• Salt to taste
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 2 tbsp grated coconut
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander
Instructions:
1. Mix besan, buttermilk, turmeric, ginger-green chili paste, and salt into a smooth batter.
2. Cook on medium heat, stirring continuously until thickened.
3. Quickly spread the batter thinly on a greased surface.
4. Let it cool, then cut into strips and roll them tightly.
5. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, and pour over the khandvi.
6. Garnish with coconut and coriander. Serve chilled.

Title: Sev Tameta Nu Shaak (Tomato Curry with Sev)
Ingredients:
• 3 ripe tomatoes (chopped)
• 1 onion (chopped)
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
• 1/2 cup sev (fried gram flour noodles)
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until soft.
2. Add tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften.
3. Add 1/4 cup water, mix well, and simmer for 5 minutes.
4. Just before serving, add sev on top and mix lightly.
5. Serve hot with rotis or parathas.

Title: Gujarati Kadhi (Sweet & Tangy Yogurt Curry)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup yogurt
• 2 tbsp besan (gram flour)
• 2 cups water
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp mustard seeds
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 green chili (slit)
• 1 tbsp sugar
• 1 tbsp ghee
• Salt to taste
• 5 curry leaves
Instructions:
1. Whisk together yogurt, besan, turmeric, and water until smooth.
2. Heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, green chili, and curry leaves.
3. Add yogurt mixture, sugar, and salt. Cook on low heat, stirring continuously.
4. Simmer for 10 minutes until slightly thickened.
5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Title: Handvo (Savory Lentil Cake)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup rice
• 1/2 cup chana dal (split chickpea)
• 1/4 cup urad dal (split black gram)
• 1/2 cup yogurt
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp green chili paste
• 1/2 tsp baking soda
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1/2 tsp sesame seeds
• 1 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Soak rice, chana dal, and urad dal for 4-5 hours. Grind into a smooth batter.
2. Add yogurt, turmeric, green chili paste, and salt. Let it ferment for 8 hours.
3. Add baking soda and mix well.
4. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard and sesame seeds. Pour in the batter.
5. Cover and cook on low heat until golden brown. Flip and cook the other side.
6. Serve hot with chutney or yogurt.

Title: Mohanthal (Sweet Gram Flour Fudge)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups besan (gram flour)
• 1 cup ghee
• 1 cup sugar
• 1/2 cup milk
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder
• 2 tbsp chopped almonds
• 2 tbsp chopped pistachios
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, add besan, and roast until golden brown.
2. Add milk and stir continuously to form a thick paste.
3. In another pan, heat sugar with 1/4 cup water to make a syrup.
4. Mix the sugar syrup into the roasted besan mixture.
5. Add cardamom powder and mix well.
6. Pour into a greased tray, garnish with nuts, and let it set.
7. Cut into squares and serve.

Title: Lilva Kachori (Stuffed Peas Pastry)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 2 tbsp oil
• 1/2 tsp salt
• 1 cup green peas (crushed)
• 1 tsp ginger-green chili paste
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp garam masala
• 1/2 tsp fennel seeds
• 1 tbsp lemon juice
• Oil for frying
Instructions:
1. Mix flour, salt, and oil. Knead into a stiff dough and set aside.
2. Heat oil, add fennel seeds, crushed peas, ginger-chili paste, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and lemon juice.
3. Cook for 5 minutes, let the mixture cool.
4. Divide dough into small balls, flatten, and stuff with the filling.
5. Seal and deep-fry until golden brown.
6. Serve hot with chutney.

Title: Fafda (Crispy Chickpea Snack)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups besan (chickpea flour)
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp ajwain (carom seeds)
• 2 tbsp oil
• Water as needed
• Salt to taste
• Oil for frying
Instructions:
1. Mix besan, turmeric, ajwain, salt, and oil. Add water to make a stiff dough.
2. Take a small portion, roll it thin using your hands.
3. Heat oil and deep-fry until crispy and golden.
4. Serve hot with chutney or jalebi.

Title: Bhakarwadi (Spicy Roll Snack)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour
• 1/2 cup gram flour (besan)
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp fennel seeds
• 1/2 cup coconut (grated)
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1 tbsp sugar
• Oil for frying
• Water as needed
Instructions:
1. Mix flour, besan, turmeric, salt, and oil. Knead into a stiff dough.
2. In another bowl, mix coconut, red chili powder, fennel seeds, garam masala, sugar.
3. Roll dough into a thin sheet, spread the filling, roll tightly, and cut into slices.
4. Deep-fry until crispy and golden brown.
5. Serve as a tea-time snack.

Title: Dal Dhokli (Lentil & Wheat Dumplings)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup toor dal (pigeon peas)
• 2 cups water
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
• 1/2 tsp ajwain (carom seeds)
• 1 tbsp oil
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Cook toor dal with water, turmeric, and salt until soft.
2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and spices.
3. Prepare a dough with wheat flour, ajwain, salt, and water.
4. Roll into thin sheets, cut into diamond shapes.
5. Add pieces into simmering dal and cook for 10 minutes.
6. Serve hot with ghee.

Title: Dabeli (Spiced Potato Burger)
Ingredients:
• 4 pav buns
• 2 boiled potatoes (mashed)
• 1 tbsp dabeli masala
• 1/2 cup tamarind chutney
• 1/4 cup roasted peanuts
• 1/4 cup pomegranate seeds
• 1 tbsp butter
• Sev for garnish
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Mix mashed potatoes with dabeli masala, salt, and tamarind chutney.
2. Toast pav buns with butter.
3. Spread the potato mixture inside the bun.
4. Add peanuts, pomegranate seeds, and sev on top.
5. Serve hot with more chutney.

Title: Locho (Steamed Gram Flour Snack)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup gram flour (besan)
• 1/4 cup semolina (rava)
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp baking soda
• 1 tbsp oil
• 1 tsp ginger-green chili paste
• 1 cup water
• 1 tbsp lemon juice
• Salt to taste
• Fresh coriander for garnish
• Sev and butter for topping
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, semolina, turmeric, red chili powder, cumin seeds, salt, and ginger-green chili paste.
2. Add water gradually and mix to form a smooth batter.
3. Let the batter rest for 20 minutes.
4. Just before steaming, add lemon juice and baking soda, mix well.
5. Pour the batter into a greased steaming tray.
6. Steam for 12-15 minutes until firm.
7. Scrape the steamed mixture to get a soft, uneven texture.
8. Serve hot with butter, sev, and fresh coriander on top.

Title: Khaman (Soft Steamed Chickpea Cake)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup gram flour (besan)
• 1/2 cup yogurt
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp sugar
• 1 tsp lemon juice
• 1 tsp eno fruit salt
• Salt to taste
• 1 cup water
• 1 tbsp oil
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1 tsp sesame seeds
• 2 green chilies (slit)
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix gram flour, yogurt, turmeric, sugar, salt, and water into a smooth batter.
2. Let it rest for 15 minutes.
3. Just before steaming, add lemon juice and eno fruit salt, mix gently.
4. Pour into a greased steaming tray and steam for 15 minutes.
5. Let it cool slightly and cut into squares.
6. Heat oil, add mustard seeds, sesame seeds, and green chilies.
7. Pour the tempering over the khaman.
8. Garnish with coriander and serve with chutney.

Title: Khamani (Crumbled Khaman with Spices)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups leftover khaman (crumbled)
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 2 green chilies (chopped)
• 1 tbsp sugar
• 1 tbsp lemon juice
• 2 tbsp water
• 1 tbsp oil
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander
• 2 tbsp sev (for garnish)
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and chopped green chilies.
2. Add crumbled khaman, sugar, lemon juice, and 2 tbsp water.
3. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes until soft.
4. Remove from heat, garnish with chopped coriander and sev.
5. Serve warm with green chutney.

Title: Sweet Chana Dal Samosa
Ingredients:
**For the Dough:**
• 2 cups all-purpose flour
• 3 tbsp oil
• 1/2 tsp salt
• Water as needed
**For the Filling:**
• 1 cup chana dal (split chickpeas), soaked and boiled
• 1/2 cup jaggery (grated)
• 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
• 1 tbsp ghee
• Oil for deep frying
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix flour, salt, and oil. Add water gradually and knead into a firm dough. Let it rest for 30 minutes.
2. Heat ghee in a pan, add boiled chana dal, grated jaggery, and cardamom powder. Cook until thick and set aside to cool.
3. Roll out small dough circles, place filling inside, and fold into a samosa shape.
4. Seal edges and deep fry until golden brown.
5. Serve warm with tea.

Title: Surti Pattice (Stuffed Potato Patties)
Ingredients:
• 4 large potatoes (boiled and mashed)
• 1/2 cup coconut (grated)
• 2 tbsp chopped cashews
• 2 tbsp chopped raisins
• 1 tsp sugar
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 2 tbsp coriander leaves (chopped)
• Salt to taste
• Oil for frying
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes with salt and turmeric.
2. In another bowl, mix coconut, cashews, raisins, sugar, garam masala, and coriander.
3. Take a portion of potato mix, flatten it, place stuffing inside, and seal into a patty.
4. Shallow fry in oil until golden brown.
5. Serve hot with chutney.

Title: Aloo Puri (Potato-Stuffed Fried Bread)
Ingredients:
**For the Dough:**
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 1/2 tsp salt
• 1 tbsp oil
• Water as needed  
**For the Filling:**
• 2 large potatoes (boiled and mashed)
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp cumin powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander
• Salt to taste
• Oil for deep frying
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, salt, and oil. Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for 20 minutes.
2. In another bowl, combine mashed potatoes with turmeric, red chili powder, cumin powder, garam masala, coriander, and salt.
3. Divide the dough into equal portions and roll each into a small disc.
4. Place some potato filling in the center, seal, and roll again into a flat puri.
5. Heat oil in a pan and deep fry puris until golden brown.
6. Serve hot with yogurt or chutney.

Title: Khawsa (Surti Burmese Noodle Curry)
Ingredients:
**For the Noodles:**
• 2 cups boiled noodles  
**For the Curry Base:**
• 1 cup coconut milk
• 1 tbsp chickpea flour (besan)
• 1 tbsp oil
• 1 tsp turmeric powder
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste
• 1/2 cup boiled vegetables (carrot, beans, peas)
• 1 tsp soy sauce
• Salt to taste  
**For the Toppings:**
• 1/2 cup fried onions
• 1/4 cup chopped coriander
• 1/2 cup crushed crispy sev
• Lemon wedges
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, and garam masala.
2. Add chickpea flour and stir continuously.
3. Pour in coconut milk and whisk well to avoid lumps.
4. Add boiled vegetables, soy sauce, and salt.
5. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until thick.
6. To serve, place boiled noodles in a bowl, pour the curry over it, and garnish with fried onions, coriander, sev, and lemon wedges.
7. Serve hot.

Title: Basundi (Sweetened Thickened Milk)
Ingredients:
• 1 liter full cream milk
• 1/2 cup sugar
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder
• 10 almonds (chopped)
• 10 pistachios (chopped)
• 1/2 tsp saffron strands
Instructions:
1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan, stirring continuously.
2. Simmer until milk reduces to half.
3. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron strands.
4. Simmer for 5 more minutes.
5. Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios.
6. Chill before serving.

Title: Shrikhand (Sweet Yogurt Dessert)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups hung curd
• 1/2 cup powdered sugar
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder
• 1 tsp saffron strands (soaked in milk)
• 10 almonds (chopped)
• 10 pistachios (chopped)
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, whisk hung curd until smooth.
2. Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron milk.
3. Mix until well combined.
4. Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios.
5. Chill before serving.

Title: Ghari (Surti Sweet Pastry)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup maida (all-purpose flour)
• 2 tbsp ghee
• Water as needed  
**For Filling:**
• 1 cup khoya (mawa)
• 1/2 cup sugar
• 2 tbsp chopped almonds
• 2 tbsp chopped pistachios
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder
• Ghee for frying
Instructions:
1. Mix flour, ghee, and water into a stiff dough.
2. Roast khoya until golden brown.
3. Add sugar, cardamom, and nuts. Let it cool.
4. Roll out dough, fill with khoya mixture, and seal.
5. Deep fry until golden brown.
6. Serve warm.

Title: Sukhdi / Gur Papdi  (Wheat & Jaggery Sweet)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup whole wheat flour
• 1/2 cup jaggery (grated)
• 1/2 cup ghee
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, add wheat flour, and roast until golden brown.
2. Add grated jaggery and cardamom powder.
3. Stir until jaggery melts and combines.
4. Pour into a greased tray, let it set, and cut into squares.

Title: Malpua with Rabdi(Sweet Pancakes)
Ingredients: 1 cup maida, 1/4 cup sooji, 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup sugar syrup, 1/4 tsp fennel seeds, 1 liter milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp cardamom, 1 tbsp nuts, saffron
Instructions:
1. Prepare rabdi by reducing milk.  
  2. Make malpua batter.  
  3. Fry malpua in ghee, dip in sugar syrup.  
  4. Serve with rabdi.

Title: Kesar Peda (Saffron Milk Fudge)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup khoya
• 1/2 cup sugar
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder
• 1 tsp saffron strands (soaked in milk)
• Chopped pistachios for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat khoya in a pan until soft.
2. Add sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron milk.
3. Stir continuously until thickened.
4. Shape into small balls and garnish with pistachios.
5. Serve once cooled.

Title: Nankhatai (Gujarati Shortbread Cookies)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour  
• 1/4 cup gram flour (besan)  
• 1/4 cup semolina  
• 1/2 cup powdered sugar  
• 1/2 cup ghee  
• 1/2 tsp cardamom powder  
• 1/4 tsp baking soda  
• 2 tbsp chopped pistachios
Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 180°C.  
2. In a bowl, mix flour, besan, semolina, sugar, cardamom powder, and baking soda.  
3. Add ghee and knead into a soft dough.  
4. Shape into small balls, flatten, and place on a baking tray.  
5. Garnish with chopped pistachios.  
6. Bake for 15-18 minutes until golden brown.  
7. Cool completely before serving.

Title: Lapsi (Broken Wheat Sweet)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup broken wheat (dalia)  
• 3 tbsp ghee  
• 3/4 cup sugar  
• 2 cups water  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 2 tbsp chopped almonds  
• 2 tbsp raisins
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast broken wheat until golden.  
2. Add water and cook until the wheat softens.  
3. Stir in sugar, cardamom, almonds, and raisins.  
4. Cook until sugar dissolves completely.  
5. Serve warm with ghee on top.

Title: Puran Poli (Sweet Flatbread)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour  
• 1 cup chana dal  
• 1 cup jaggery  
• 1 tsp cardamom powder  
• Ghee for roasting
Instructions:
1. Boil chana dal until soft, drain, and mash.  
2. Mix mashed dal with jaggery and cardamom powder.  
3. Knead wheat flour with water into a soft dough.  
4. Roll out small discs, place filling inside, and seal.  
5. Roll again and roast on a tawa with ghee until golden.  
6. Serve warm with ghee.

Title: Jalebi (Crispy Sugar-Soaked Swirls)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour (maida)  
• 2 tbsp gram flour (besan)  
• 1/2 tsp baking powder  
• 1/2 cup yogurt  
• 3/4 cup water (as needed)  
• 1/4 tsp turmeric (for color)  
• Oil for deep frying  
• 1 cup sugar  
• 1/2 cup water  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 1/4 tsp saffron strands  
• 1/2 tsp lemon juice
Instructions:
1. Prepare Batter: In a bowl, mix flour, gram flour, baking powder, and turmeric. Add yogurt and water to make a thick batter.  
2. Cover and let it ferment for 8-10 hours or overnight.  
3. Make Sugar Syrup: Boil sugar and water until it reaches one-string consistency. Add cardamom, saffron, and lemon juice. Keep warm.  
4. Fry Jalebis: Heat oil in a flat pan. Fill the batter in a piping bag or squeeze bottle and pipe spiral shapes into the hot oil.  
5. Fry until crisp and golden. Remove and immediately dip in warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds.  
6. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Title: Rasmalai (Soft Cottage Cheese in Saffron Milk)
Ingredients:
1 liter full-fat milk, 2 tbsp lemon juice, 3 cups water, 1 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder,  1/2 liter full-fat milk (for Ras), 1/4 cup sugar, 10-12 saffron strands, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder,  
8-10 almonds & pistachios (sliced), 1/2 tsp rose water.
Instructions:
1. Curdle milk with lemon juice, strain, and knead chhena for 5-7 mins.  
  2. Shape into discs and boil in sugar syrup for 10-12 mins.  
  3. Boil milk with saffron, sugar, and cardamom to make Ras.  
  4. Squeeze rasgullas, soak in Ras, and chill before serving.'

Title: Mysore Pak (Rich Ghee-Filled Fudge)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup gram flour (besan)  
• 1 cup ghee  
• 1 cup sugar  
• 1/2 cup water
Instructions:
1. Heat sugar and water to make a thick syrup.  
2. Add gram flour and stir continuously.  
3. Gradually add ghee, stirring until the mixture thickens and leaves the pan.  
4. Pour into a greased tray, let cool, and cut into squares.

Title: Ukadiche Modak  (Steamed Coconut Dumplings)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup rice flour  
• 1 cup water  
• 1/4 tsp salt  
• 1 tsp ghee  
• 1 cup grated coconut  
• 1/2 cup jaggery  
• 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
Instructions:
1. Heat water with salt and ghee. Add rice flour and mix to form a dough.  
2. In another pan, cook coconut, jaggery, and cardamom.  
3. Shape dough into small cups, fill with coconut mixture, and close into a modak shape.  
4. Steam for 15 minutes.

Title: Ghewar (Honeycomb Dessert)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour  
• 1/2 cup cold milk  
• 1/2 cup water  
• 1/4 tsp baking powder  
• Ghee for frying  
• 1 cup sugar  
• 1/2 cup water  
• 1/4 tsp saffron  
• 1 tbsp chopped nuts
Instructions:
1. Mix flour, milk, water, and baking powder into a smooth batter.  
2. Pour batter into hot ghee in a deep pan, making a lace-like pattern. Fry until crisp.  
3. Make sugar syrup and drizzle over ghewar. Garnish with nuts.

Title: Sandesh (Soft Bengali Sweet)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups paneer (cottage cheese)  
• 1/2 cup powdered sugar  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 2 tbsp milk  
• 1 tsp rose water
Instructions:
1. Mash paneer until smooth.  
2. Add powdered sugar and cardamom.  
3. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes while stirring.  
4. Remove, shape into small rounds, and garnish with rose water.  
5. Refrigerate and serve.

Title: Peda (Milk Fudge)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups khoya (reduced milk)  
• 1/2 cup sugar  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 2 tbsp chopped pistachios
Instructions:
1. Cook khoya on low heat for 5 minutes.  
2. Add sugar and stir until thick.  
3. Mix in cardamom and shape into small rounds.  
4. Garnish with pistachios and let cool.

Title: Patishapta (Bengali Crepes with Coconut Filling)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup flour  
• 1/2 cup semolina  
• 1/2 cup sugar  
• 1 1/2 cups milk  
• 1 cup grated coconut  
• 1/2 cup jaggery  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• Ghee for cooking
Instructions:
1. Mix flour, semolina, sugar, and milk into a batter.  
2. Cook coconut, jaggery, and cardamom in a pan to make the filling.  
3. Heat a pan and make thin crepes with the batter.  
4. Fill each crepe with the coconut mixture and roll.  
5. Serve warm or chilled.

Title: Kaju katli (Cashew Barfi)
Ingredients: 2 cups cashews, 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 1 tbsp ghee, 1 tsp rose water, silver varak.
Instructions:
1. Grind cashews into a fine powder.  
  2. Make sugar syrup with sugar and water.  
  3. Mix cashew powder, cook until dough forms.  
  4. Roll and cut into diamonds, garnish with silver varak.

Title: Kharwas (Colostrum Milk Pudding)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups cow/buffalo colostrum milk  
• 1/2 cup sugar  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 1/4 tsp saffron  
• 1/2 cup milk
Instructions:
1. Mix all ingredients and pour into a greased bowl.  
2. Steam for 30 minutes until set.  
3. Let cool, slice, and serve.

Title: Chhena Poda (Baked Paneer Dessert)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups paneer  
• 1/2 cup sugar  
• 1/4 cup semolina  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 1/4 cup chopped nuts
Instructions:
1. Mash paneer and mix with sugar, semolina, and cardamom.  
2. Pour into a greased tray and bake at 180°C for 30 minutes.  
3. Let cool and slice before serving.

Title: Chhena Cham Cham
Ingredients:
• 2 liters full-fat milk  
• 2 tbsp lemon juice  
• 1 cup sugar  
• 4 cups water  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 1/2 tsp rose water  
• 2 tbsp chopped pistachios  
• 1/4 cup grated coconut (optional)
Instructions:
1. Prepare Chhena: Boil milk and add lemon juice. Stir until curdled. Strain using a muslin cloth and rinse with cold water. Squeeze out excess water.  
2. Knead Chhena: Knead until smooth and form oval-shaped pieces.  
3. Prepare Sugar Syrup: Boil water and sugar. Add cardamom powder and gently place cham cham pieces in boiling syrup.  
4. Cook Cham Cham:Cover and cook for 15 minutes on medium heat.  
5. Cool & Flavor:Remove from syrup, let cool, and sprinkle rose water.  
6. Garnish & Serve:Coat with grated coconut and chopped pistachios. Serve chilled.

Title: Amritsari Chole
Ingredients:
• 1 cup dried chickpeas (soaked overnight)  
• 2 tbsp oil  
• 1 large onion (finely chopped)  
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)  
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste  
• 1 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1 tsp red chili powder  
• 1 tbsp chole masala  
• 1 tsp garam masala  
• 1/2 tsp dried fenugreek leaves (kasuri methi)  
• 1 tea bag or 1 black tea leaf pouch  
• Salt to taste  
• Fresh coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. **Boil Chickpeas:** Drain soaked chickpeas and pressure cook for 5 whistles with tea bag and salt.  
2. **Prepare Masala:** Heat oil, add cumin, then onions, and sauté until golden.  
3. **Cook Gravy:** Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and all spices. Cook for 5 minutes until oil separates.  
4. **Combine:** Add boiled chickpeas with some water and simmer for 10 minutes.  
5. **Finish & Serve:** Sprinkle kasuri methi and garam masala. Garnish with coriander and serve hot.

Title: Makki di Roti & Sarson da Saag
Ingredients:
• 2 cups mustard greens (sarson)  
• 1 cup spinach  
• 1 small turnip (chopped)  
• 1 onion (chopped)  
• 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste  
• 2 green chilies (chopped)  
• 1 tbsp maize flour  
• 1 tsp cumin  
• 1 tbsp butter  
• Salt to taste  

**For Makki di Roti:**  
• 2 cups maize flour  
• 1/2 cup warm water  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• Butter for serving
Instructions:
1. Prepare Sarson da Saag: Boil mustard greens, spinach, and turnip with little water until soft. Mash and keep aside.  
2. Cook Saag: Heat butter, add cumin, onion, green chilies, and ginger-garlic paste. Add maize flour and cook for 2 minutes.  
3. Simmer: Mix in mashed greens and cook for 10 minutes.  

**For Makki di Roti:**  
4. **Make Dough:** Knead maize flour with warm water and salt.  
5. **Cook Rotis:** Flatten small balls into thick rotis and cook on a hot griddle with butter.  
6. **Serve:** Enjoy roti with saag and butter.

Title: Pindi Chana Sabji
Ingredients:
• 1 cup dried chickpeas (soaked overnight)  
• 1 tbsp ghee  
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1 tsp coriander powder  
• 1 tsp cumin powder  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/2 tsp amchur (dry mango powder)  
• 1/2 tsp garam masala  
• 1/4 tsp black salt  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
• Salt to taste  
• Lemon wedges and coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. Boil Chickpeas: Drain soaked chickpeas and pressure cook for 5 whistles with salt.  
2. Prepare Masala: Heat ghee, add cumin, and dry spices. Stir for 1 minute.  
3. Mix Chickpeas: Toss boiled chickpeas in the masala and cook on low heat for 5 minutes.  
4. Serve: Garnish with lemon and coriander.

Title: Punjabi Lassi
Ingredients:
• 2 cups chilled yogurt  
• 1/2 cup cold water  
• 2 tbsp sugar (for sweet lassi)  
• 1/4 tsp cardamom powder  
• 2 tbsp fresh cream  
• 2 tbsp chopped nuts (for garnish)  
• Pinch of salt (for salted lassi)
Instructions:
1. Blend: Mix yogurt, water, sugar/salt in a blender until frothy.  
2. Serve: Pour into glasses and top with cream and nuts.  
3. Chill & Enjoy!

Title: Dal Makhani
Ingredients:
• 1 cup whole black lentils (urad dal)  
• 1/4 cup kidney beans (rajma)  
• 3 cups water  
• 2 tbsp butter  
• 1 tbsp oil  
• 1 onion (finely chopped)  
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)  
• 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste  
• 1 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1 tsp coriander powder  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/4 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1 tsp garam masala  
• 1/2 cup fresh cream  
• 1 tsp kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves)  
• Salt to taste  
• Fresh coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. Soak & Cook Dal: Soak urad dal and rajma overnight. Drain and pressure cook with water for 5-6 whistles.  
2. Prepare Masala:Heat oil and butter in a pan. Add cumin, chopped onions, and sauté until golden.  
3. Cook Gravy: Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, and spices. Cook until oil separates.  
4. Simmer: Add cooked dal and some water. Simmer on low heat for 30 minutes.  
5. Finish & Serve: Stir in cream and kasuri methi. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with naan or rice.

Title: Kadhi Pakora
Ingredients:
**For Kadhi:**  
• 2 cups yogurt  
• 1/2 cup gram flour (besan)  
• 4 cups water  
• 1 tsp turmeric  
• 1 tsp red chili powder  
• 1 tsp salt  
• 1 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds  
• 2 dried red chilies  
• 10 curry leaves  
• 1 tbsp ghee  

**For Pakoras:**  
• 1 cup gram flour  
• 1/2 cup water  
• 1/2 tsp carom seeds  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric  
• Oil for frying
Instructions:
1. **Make Pakoras:** Mix gram flour, water, salt, turmeric, and carom seeds into a thick batter. Deep fry small portions until golden. Set aside.  
2. **Prepare Kadhi:** Whisk yogurt, gram flour, turmeric, chili powder, and salt with water until smooth.  
3. **Cook Kadhi:** Heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin, fenugreek, dried chilies, and curry leaves.  
4. **Simmer:** Pour the yogurt mixture and cook on low heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.  
5. **Add Pakoras:** Drop fried pakoras into kadhi and simmer for another 10 minutes.  
6. **Serve:** Enjoy with steamed rice or chapati.

Title: Shahi Paneer
Ingredients:
• 250g paneer (cubed)  
• 1 onion (chopped)  
• 1 tomato (pureed)  
• 1/4 cup cashew paste  
• 1/2 cup fresh cream  
• 1 tbsp butter  
• 1 tbsp oil  
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste  
• 1 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric  
• 1 tsp garam masala  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• Salt to taste  
• 1/2 tsp sugar  
• Saffron strands (optional)
Instructions:
1. Prepare Gravy: Heat butter and oil. Add cumin and onions. Sauté until golden.  
2. Cook Masala:Add ginger-garlic paste, tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates.  
3. Blend Cashew Paste: Stir in cashew paste and cook for 2 minutes.  
4. Simmer: Add cream, sugar, and paneer. Cook on low heat for 5 minutes.  
5. Serve: Garnish with saffron strands and enjoy with naan or pulao.

Title: Chettinad Mushroom Curry
Ingredients:
• 200g mushrooms (sliced)  
• 1 onion (chopped)  
• 2 tomatoes (pureed)  
• 2 tbsp coconut (grated)  
• 1 tbsp oil  
• 1 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1 tsp fennel seeds  
• 2 dried red chilies  
• 1 tsp garam masala  
• 1 tsp coriander powder  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric  
• 1 tsp black pepper  
• Salt to taste  
• Fresh curry leaves for garnish
Instructions:
1. Prepare Masala: Dry roast coconut and fennel seeds. Grind into a smooth paste.  
2. Cook Base: Heat oil, add mustard seeds, red chilies, and onions. Sauté until golden.  
3. Add Spices: Stir in tomato puree, garam masala, coriander, turmeric, and black pepper. Cook until oil separates.  
4. Add Mushrooms:Toss in mushrooms, salt, and cook for 10 minutes.  
5. Finish & Serve: Garnish with curry leaves and serve with rice or paratha.

Title: Bengali Shukto
Ingredients:
• 1 bitter gourd (sliced)  
• 1 potato (chopped)  
• 1 drumstick (cut into pieces)  
• 1/2 cup green beans  
• 1 carrot (sliced)  
• 1 tbsp mustard oil  
• 1/2 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1 tsp poppy seed paste  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric  
• 1/2 cup milk  
• 1/2 tsp sugar  
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Fry Bitter Gourd: Heat oil, fry bitter gourd slices until golden. Set aside.  
2. Cook Vegetables:In the same pan, add mustard seeds, turmeric, and remaining vegetables. Sauté for 5 minutes.  
3. Simmer: Add milk, poppy seed paste, sugar, and salt. Cover and cook until vegetables are soft.  
4. Finish & Serve: Add fried bitter gourd, mix well, and serve with rice.

Title: Kolhapuri Tambda Rassa
Ingredients:
• 500g mutton  
• 2 tbsp oil  
• 1 large onion (chopped)  
• 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste  
• 2 tsp Kolhapuri masala  
• 1 tsp red chili powder  
• 1 tsp turmeric  
• 1 cup coconut (grated)  
• 1/2 cup yogurt  
• Salt to taste  
• Fresh coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. Prepare Spice Mix: Dry roast coconut until golden and grind into a paste.  
2. Sauté Onion: Heat oil, fry onions until golden, then add ginger-garlic paste.  
3. Cook Mutton: Add mutton, red chili powder, turmeric, salt, and cook for 10 minutes.  
4. Simmer:  Add coconut paste and yogurt, mix well, and simmer for 40 minutes.  
5. Finish & Serve: Garnish with coriander and serve with roti or rice.

Title: Poha
Ingredients:
• 2 cups flattened rice (poha)  
• 1 tbsp oil  
• 1/2 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
• 8-10 curry leaves  
• 1 green chili (chopped)  
• 1/2 cup onion (finely chopped)  
• 1/4 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1/2 cup boiled potatoes (cubed)  
• 1/4 cup peanuts (roasted)  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1/2 lemon (juiced)  
• Fresh coriander (chopped)  
• Sev (for garnish)
Instructions:
1. Rinse Poha: Wash poha under running water for 10 seconds, drain, and set aside.  
2. Temper Spices: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and green chili.  
3. Cook Vegetables : Add onions and sauté until translucent. Stir in turmeric, salt, and potatoes.  
4. Mix Poha: Add washed poha, peanuts, and mix gently.  
5. Finish & Serve : Squeeze lemon juice, garnish with coriander and sev.  Serve hot.

Title: Kanda Bhajiya
Ingredients:
2 large onions (thinly sliced),  
     1 cup gram flour (besan),  
     2 tbsp rice flour (for extra crispiness),  
     1-2 green chilies (finely chopped),  
     1/2 tsp red chili powder,  
     1/2 tsp turmeric powder,  
     1/2 tsp carom seeds (ajwain),  
     1/2 tsp cumin seeds,  
     1/2 tsp garam masala,  
     1/2 tsp chaat masala,  
     1 tbsp fresh coriander leaves (chopped),  
     1 tbsp hot oil (for crispiness),  
     Salt to taste,  
     Water (as needed),  
     Oil (for deep frying)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the onions:**  
        - Thinly slice the onions and place them in a mixing bowl.  
        - Add salt and mix well. Let it rest for 5-10 minutes to release moisture.  

     2. **Prepare the batter:**  
        - Add gram flour, rice flour, green chilies, red chili powder, turmeric, carom seeds, cumin seeds, garam masala, and chaat masala to the onions.  
        - Mix everything well, allowing the released moisture to help bind the flour with onions.  
        - Add hot oil to the mixture (this enhances crispiness).  
        - Gradually add small amounts of water, only if needed, to make a thick batter. The batter should just coat the onions without being too runny.  

     3. **Frying the bhajiyas:**  
        - Heat oil in a deep pan on medium-high heat.  
        - Drop small portions of the onion mixture into the hot oil. Avoid overcrowding the pan.  
        - Fry on medium flame until golden brown and crispy. Stir occasionally for even cooking.  
        - Remove and place them on a paper towel to drain excess oil.  

     4. **Serving:**  
        - Serve hot with green chutney or tomato ketchup and enjoy with masala chai.

Title: Medu Vada
Ingredients:
• 1 cup urad dal (black gram lentils)  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1/2 tsp black pepper  
• 1 green chili (chopped)  
• 1/2 inch ginger (grated)  
• 8-10 curry leaves (chopped)  
• 2 tbsp coriander leaves (chopped)  
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1/4 tsp baking soda  
• Oil (for deep frying)  
• Water (as needed)
Instructions:
1. Soak & Grind: Soak urad dal for 6 hours, then grind to a smooth batter using minimal water.  
2. Prepare Batter: Add salt, black pepper, green chili, ginger, curry leaves, coriander, cumin, and baking soda. Mix well.  
3. Shape Vada's :   Wet your hands, take a small portion of batter, shape into a donut with a hole in the center.  
4. Fry Until Crispy: Heat oil, deep-fry Vada's on medium flame until golden brown and crisp.  
5. Serve Hot: Drain excess oil and serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

Title: Aloo Tikki
Ingredients: Boiled potatoes (mashed) - 4 large; Bread crumbs - 1/2 cup; Corn flour - 2 tbsp; Green chilies (finely chopped) - 2; Ginger (grated) - 1 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Cumin powder - 1 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1/2 tsp; Chaat masala - 1 tsp; Salt - to taste; Fresh coriander (chopped) - 2 tbsp; Oil - for shallow frying
Instructions:
For Filling (optional):
Boiled chana dal (split Bengal gram) - 1/2 cup; Salt - to taste; Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp; Chaat masala - 1/2 tsp; Green chili (chopped) - 1; Fresh coriander (chopped) - 1 tbsp',
1. Prepare the Filling (Optional):
   - In a bowl, mix boiled chana dal with salt, cumin powder, chaat masala, chopped green chili, and coriander.\n
   - Keep aside for stuffing the tikki.
2. Prepare Aloo Mixture:
   - In a mixing bowl, combine mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, corn flour, green chilies, ginger, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, chaat masala, salt, and fresh coriander.
   - Mix well until it forms a smooth dough.
3. Shape & Fill Tikki:
   - Take a small portion of the potato mixture and flatten it into a disc.
   - If using filling, place a small spoonful of the chana dal mixture in the center and seal the edges.
   - Shape into round, flat tikki.
4. Cooking Aloo Tikki:
   - Heat oil in a pan or tawa over medium flame.
   - Shallow-fry the tikki  until golden brown and crispy on both sides.
   - Remove from heat and drain excess oil on paper towels.
5. Serving Suggestions:
   - Serve hot with green chutney, tamarind chutney, and yogurt.
   - Garnish with chopped onions, sev, and extra chaat masala for an authentic Delhi street food taste.',

Title: Moong Dal Chilla
Ingredients: Yellow Moong Dal - 1 cup, Water - for soaking, Green Chili - 1 (finely chopped), Ginger - 1/2 inch (grated), Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing (Asafoetida) - 1/4 tsp, Salt - 1/2 tsp (or as per taste), Turmeric Powder - 1/4 tsp, Coriander Leaves - 2 tbsp (chopped), Onion - 1/4 cup (finely chopped, optional), Carrot - 1/4 cup (grated, optional), Capsicum - 1/4 cup (finely chopped, optional), Water - 1/4 to 1/2 cup (for batter), Oil - for cooking
Instructions:
1. Rinse the yellow moong dal thoroughly and soak it in water for 3-4 hours or overnight. 
    2. Drain the water and blend the soaked dal with green chili, ginger, cumin seeds, hing, salt, and turmeric powder, adding 1/4 to 1/2 cup water gradually to make a smooth batter. The consistency should be similar to dosa batter. 
    3. Transfer the batter to a bowl and mix in chopped coriander leaves, onions, grated carrots, and capsicum if using. 
    4. Heat a non-stick pan or tawa on medium heat and lightly grease it with oil. 
    5. Pour a ladleful of batter onto the pan and spread it in a circular motion to form a thin chilla. 
    6. Drizzle some oil around the edges and cook for 2-3 minutes until the bottom turns golden brown. 
    7. Flip the chilla and cook the other side for another 2 minutes until crisp. 
    8. Remove from the pan and repeat the process with the remaining batter. 
    9. Serve hot with green chutney or yogurt.

Title: Sabudana Khichdi (Fasting Recipe)
Ingredients:
Sabudana (tapioca pearls) - 1 cup
 Water - 1/2 cup (for soaking) 
 Peanuts - 1/4 cup (roasted & coarsely ground),
 Green chilies - 2 (finely chopped),  
Potatoes - 1 medium (boiled & diced), 
Ghee - 2 tbsp
Cumin seeds - 1 tsp, 
Curry leaves - 6-8,
 Rock salt (sendha namak) - as per taste,  
Lemon juice - 1 tbsp,
Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (chopped)
Instructions:
1. Wash the sabudana under running water until the water runs clear.  
2. Soak the sabudana in just enough water to cover them (about 1/2 cup) for 4-6 hours or overnight.  
3. After soaking, fluff the sabudana with a fork to separate the pearls.  
4. Heat ghee in a pan and add cumin seeds. Let them splutter.  
5. Add chopped green chilies and curry leaves, sauté for a few seconds.  
6. Add boiled diced potatoes and cook for 2 minutes.  
7. Add soaked sabudana and mix gently.  
8. Stir in the roasted peanut powder and sendha namak.  
9. Cook on low flame, stirring occasionally, until sabudana becomes translucent (about 5-7 minutes).  
10. Turn off the heat and add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves.  
11. Serve hot with yogurt or coconut chutney.

Title: Bedmi Puri with Aloo Sabzi
Ingredients:
For Bedmi Puri:  
    - 1 cup split urad dal (soaked for 4-5 hours)  
    - 2 cups whole wheat flour  
    - 2 tbsp semolina (sooji)  
    - 1 tsp fennel seeds  
    - 1 tsp cumin seeds  
    - 1/2 inch ginger (grated)  
    - 1-2 green chilies (chopped)  
    - 1/2 tsp turmeric powder  
    - 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
    - 1/2 tsp coriander powder  
    - 1/2 tsp garam masala  
    - 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)  
    - 1 tbsp oil  
    - Salt to taste  
    - Water as required  
    - Oil for deep frying  

    For Aloo Sabzi:  
    - 4 medium potatoes (boiled & mashed)  
    - 2 tbsp oil  
    - 1 tsp mustard seeds  
    - 1 tsp cumin seeds  
    - 1 green chili (chopped)  
    - 1/2 inch ginger (grated)  
    - 1/2 tsp turmeric powder  
    - 1 tsp red chili powder  
    - 1 tsp coriander powder  
    - 1 tsp garam masala  
    - 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)  
    - 2 tomatoes (chopped)  
    - 1/2 tsp dry mango powder (amchur)  
    - 1/2 tsp kasuri methi (optional)  
    - 2 cups water  
    - Salt to taste  
    - Fresh coriander leaves for garnishing
Instructions:
1. Prepare the Urad Dal Paste:  
    - Drain the soaked urad dal and grind it into a coarse paste with ginger, green chilies, fennel seeds, and cumin seeds.  
    - Do not add too much water while grinding.  

    2. Make the Puri Dough:  
    - In a mixing bowl, add whole wheat flour, semolina, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, hing, and salt.  
    - Add the urad dal paste and 1 tbsp oil. Knead into a firm dough by adding water as needed.  
    - Cover and rest for 15-20 minutes.  

    3. Shape and Fry the Puris:  
    - Heat oil in a deep pan for frying.  
    - Divide the dough into small equal portions and roll each into a small disc.  
    - Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown and puffed. Drain on paper towels.  

    4. Prepare Aloo Sabzi:  
    - Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds; let them splutter.  
    - Add green chilies, ginger, and hing. Sauté for a few seconds.  
    - Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.  
    - Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and garam masala.  
    - Add mashed potatoes, salt, and water. Mix well and let it simmer for 5-7 minutes.  
    - Add amchur powder and kasuri methi (if using). Simmer for 2 more minutes.  
    - Garnish with fresh coriander.  

    5. Serve:  
    - Serve hot Bedmi Puris with flavorful Aloo Sabzi and enjoy!

Title: Mirchi Bhajji with Potato Stuffing
Ingredients:
Large green chilies (Banana peppers) - 6,  
    Boiled potatoes - 2 medium (mashed),  
    Green chilies - 1 (finely chopped),  
    Ginger - 1/2 inch (grated),  
    Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (chopped),  
    Salt - 1/2 tsp (or as per taste),  
    Chaat masala - 1/2 tsp,  
    Amchur (dry mango powder) - 1/2 tsp,  
    Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp,  
    Cumin powder - 1/2 tsp,  
    Besan (gram flour) - 1 cup,  
    Rice flour - 2 tbsp,  
    Baking soda - 1/8 tsp,  
    Ajwain (carom seeds) - 1/2 tsp,  
    Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp,  
    Water - as needed,  
    Oil - for deep frying,  
    Lemon juice - 1 tsp
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Chilies:** Wash the large green chilies and pat them dry. Slit them lengthwise, keeping the stem intact. Remove the seeds if you want a milder taste.  
     2. **Make the Stuffing:** In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, chopped green chilies, grated ginger, coriander leaves, salt, chaat masala, amchur powder, red chili powder, and cumin powder.  
     3. **Stuff the Chilies:** Fill each slit chili with the prepared potato stuffing and press gently to secure it inside.  
     4. **Prepare the Batter:** In another bowl, mix besan, rice flour, baking soda, ajwain, turmeric powder, and salt. Add water gradually to make a thick, smooth batter.  
     5. **Heat Oil:** In a deep frying pan, heat oil over medium heat.  
     6. **Coat the Chilies:** Dip each stuffed chili into the batter, ensuring it's fully coated. Let excess batter drip off.  
     7. **Fry Until Golden:** Carefully drop the coated chilies into hot oil and fry until golden brown and crispy. Fry in batches if needed.  
     8. **Drain Excess Oil:** Remove the fried bajjis and place them on paper towels to absorb excess oil.  
     9. **Serve Hot:** Sprinkle with chaat masala and lemon juice. Serve hot with green chutney or tomato sauce.

Title: Pesarattu (Andra Style Green Moong Dosa)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup green moong dal (soaked) , 
• 1 green chili  ,
• 1/2 inch ginger,  
• 1/2 tsp salt  ,
• 1/4 tsp cumin seeds,  
• Water as needed  ,
• Oil for cooking  ,


**For Topping:**  
• 2 tbsp chopped onions,  
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Batter:** Grind soaked moong dal, chili, ginger, salt, and cumin into a smooth batter.  
2. **Make Dosa:** Spread batter on a hot pan, sprinkle onions and coriander.  
3. **Cook Crispy:** Drizzle oil and cook until golden brown.  
4. **Serve Hot:** Serve with coconut chutney or sambar.

Title: Paneer Chilli  Dry
Ingredients:
• 200g paneer (cubed)  ,
• 2 tbsp cornflour  ,
• 1 tbsp all-purpose flour,  
• 1/2 tsp salt  ,
• 1/2 tsp black pepper,  
• 1 tbsp oil  ,


**For Sauce:**  
• 1 tbsp garlic (chopped)  ,
• 1/2 cup onions (cubed)  ,
• 1/2 cup capsicum (cubed),  
• 1 tbsp soy sauce  ,
• 1 tbsp red chili sauce,  
• 1 tbsp tomato ketchup,  
• 1 tsp vinegar  ,
• 1/2 tsp black pepper,  
• 1/2 tsp sugar.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Paneer:**  
     • In a bowl, mix cornflour, all-purpose flour, salt, and black pepper.  
     • Add 2-3 tbsp water to make a smooth batter.  
     • Coat the paneer cubes evenly with the batter.  
     • Heat oil in a pan and shallow-fry or deep-fry paneer cubes until golden brown.  
     • Remove and place them on a paper towel to absorb excess oil.  
     
   2. **Prepare the Sauce:**  
     • Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan or wok.  
     • Add chopped garlic and sauté for a few seconds until aromatic.  
     • Add cubed onions and capsicum. Sauté for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened but still crunchy.  
     • Add soy sauce, red chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, black pepper, and sugar. Mix well.  
     
   3. **Combine Everything:**  
     • Add the fried paneer to the pan and toss well in the sauce.  
     • Stir-fry for 2 minutes on high flame until the sauce coats the paneer well.  
     
   4. **Garnish and Serve:**  
     • Sprinkle chopped spring onions and sesame seeds (if using).  
     • Serve hot as a starter or side dish

Title: Gobi Manchurian Dry
Ingredients:
• 2 cups cauliflower florets  ,
• 1/2 cup all-purpose flour  ,
• 1/4 cup cornflour , 
• 1/2 tsp salt  ,
• 1/2 tsp black pepper  ,
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste  ,
• Oil for frying  ,


**For Sauce:**  
• 1 tbsp oil  ,
• 1 tbsp garlic (chopped)  ,
• 1/2 cup onions (cubed)  ,
• 1/2 cup capsicum (cubed)  ,
• 1 tbsp soy sauce  ,
• 1 tbsp red chili sauce  ,
• 1 tsp vinegar  ,
• 1/2 tsp black pepper  ,
• 1/2 tsp sugar.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Batter:** Mix all-purpose flour, cornflour, salt, pepper, and ginger-garlic paste with water to form a thick batter.  
2. **Fry Cauliflower:** Dip florets in batter and deep-fry until crispy.  
3. **Prepare Sauce:** Heat oil, add garlic, onions, capsicum, and stir-fry for a minute.  
4. **Add Sauces:** Add soy sauce, chili sauce, vinegar, black pepper, and sugar. Stir well.  
5. **Mix & Serve:** Toss fried cauliflower in the sauce, coat well, and serve hot.

Title: Chilli Garlic Dosa
Ingredients:
• 2 cups dosa batter  ,
   • 2 tbsp oil or ghee  ,
   • ½ tsp mustard seeds  ,
   • 1 tbsp butter (optional)  ,
   • Salt to taste  ,

   **For Chilli Garlic Chutney:**  

   • 10 dried red chilies (soaked in warm water for 10 mins)  ,
   • 5 garlic cloves  ,
   • 1 tbsp sesame seeds  ,
   • 1 tbsp tamarind paste  ,
   • ½ tsp cumin seeds  ,
   • 1 tbsp oil  ,
   • Salt to taste  ,
   • Water as needed.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Chilli Garlic Chutney:**  
      - Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, dried red chilies, and garlic. Sauté for 2 minutes.  
      - Add sesame seeds and tamarind paste. Stir well.  
      - Let it cool, then grind to a smooth paste using a little water. Add salt to taste.  

   2. **Heat the Pan:**  
      - Heat a dosa tawa on medium flame and grease it lightly with oil or butter.  

   3. **Spread the Dosa Batter:**  
      - Pour a ladleful of dosa batter onto the tawa and spread it in a circular motion to make a thin dosa.  

   4. **Apply Chilli Garlic Chutney:**  
      - Once the dosa starts cooking, spread 1-2 tsp of the prepared chutney evenly over the dosa.  

   5. **Crisp the Dosa:**  
      - Drizzle a few drops of oil around the edges and cook until the dosa turns golden brown and crispy.  

   6. **Serve Hot:**  
      - Fold the dosa and serve immediately with coconut chutney or sambar.

Title: Veg Momos
Ingredients:
• 1 cup all-purpose flour  ,
• 1/4 tsp salt  ,
• 1/4 cup water  ,
• 1 tsp oil  ,


**For Filling:**  
• 1 cup cabbage (grated)  ,
• 1/2 cup carrots (grated)  ,
• 1/2 cup onions (chopped)  ,
• 1 tbsp garlic (chopped)  ,
• 1 tbsp soy sauce  ,
• 1/2 tsp black pepper  ,
• 1/2 tsp salt  ,
• 1 tsp oil.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Dough:** Mix flour, salt, oil, and water to form a soft dough. Cover and rest for 20 minutes.  
2. **Prepare Filling:** Heat oil, sauté garlic, onions, cabbage, and carrots for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, black pepper, and salt. Stir well and cool.  
3. **Shape Momos:** Roll small dough balls into thin circles, place filling in the center, and fold into pleated dumplings.  
4. **Steam Momos:** Steam momos in a steamer for 10–12 minutes until translucent.  
5. **Serve Hot:** Serve with spicy red chutney or soy sauce.

Title: Paneer Frankie Roll
Ingredients:
• 2 whole wheat rotis  ,
• 1/2 cup paneer (cubed)  ,
• 1/2 cup onions (sliced)  ,
• 1/4 cup capsicum sliced)  ,
• 1 tbsp oil  ,
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  ,
• 1/2 tsp garam masala  ,
• 1/4 tsp salt  ,
• 1 tbsp ketchup  ,
• 1 tbsp mayonnaise  ,
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala,
Instructions:
1. **Cook Paneer:** Heat oil, sauté onions and capsicum. Add paneer, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.  
2. **Prepare Wrap:** Warm rotis, spread ketchup and mayonnaise.  
3. **Add Filling:** Place the paneer mixture inside, sprinkle chaat masala, and roll tightly.  
4. **Toast & Serve:** Lightly toast the roll on a pan for a crispy texture. Serve hot.

Title: Crispy Spring Rolls
Ingredients:
• 200g Cabbage (finely shredded)  ,
    • 100g Carrot (julienned)  ,
    • 100g Capsicum (thinly sliced)  ,
    • 100g Mushrooms (thinly sliced)  ,
    • 100g Paneer/Tofu (cubed, optional)  ,
    • 2 cloves Garlic (minced)  ,
    • 1 tbsp Ginger (grated)  ,
    • 1/2 tsp Black Pepper (ground)  ,
    • 1 tbsp Soy Sauce  ,
    • 1 tbsp Vinegar  ,
    • 1 tbsp Cornstarch (for binding)  ,
    • 1 tsp Salt (adjust to taste)  ,
    • 1 tbsp Oil (for stir-frying)  ,
    • 10 Spring Roll Wrappers  ,
    • 2 tbsp Cornstarch Slurry (for sealing the rolls)  ,
    • Oil for deep frying.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Filling**:  
       • Heat a pan over medium heat and add 1 tbsp oil.  
       • Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Sauté until aromatic.  
       • Add shredded cabbage, carrots, capsicum, and mushrooms. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes.  
       • Add soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper, and salt. Mix well.  
       • Add crumbled paneer or tofu (if using) and stir-fry for another 2 minutes.  
       • Mix 1 tbsp cornstarch with 2 tbsp water and add it to the mixture. Stir well to bind.  
       • Turn off the heat and let the filling cool completely.  

    2. **Prepare the Spring Rolls**:  
       • Lay a spring roll wrapper on a clean surface with one corner facing you.  
       • Place 2 tbsp of the filling near the corner closest to you.  
       • Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold the sides inwards.  
       • Roll tightly towards the top, sealing the edge with cornstarch slurry.  
       • Repeat with the remaining wrappers and filling.  

    3. **Frying the Spring Rolls**:  
       • Heat oil in a deep pan to 180°C (356°F).  
       • Fry the rolls in batches until golden brown and crispy (about 3-4 minutes).  
       • Remove and drain excess oil on a paper towel.  

    4. **Serving**:  
       • Serve hot with chili sauce, sweet and sour sauce, or ketchup.

Title: Chilli Garlic Fried Rice
Ingredients:
• 2 cups cooked rice  ,
• 1 tbsp oil  ,
• 1 tbsp garlic (chopped)  ,
• 1/2 cup spring onions (chopped)  ,
• 1/2 cup capsicum (chopped)  ,
• 1/4 cup carrots (grated)  ,
• 1 tbsp soy sauce  ,
• 1 tsp vinegar  ,
• 1/2 tsp red chili flakes  ,
• 1/2 tsp black pepper  ,
• 1/2 tsp salt  ,
• 1 tbsp schezwan sauce,
Instructions:
1. **Heat Oil:** In a wok, heat oil and sauté garlic until golden brown.

3. **Mix Rice & Sauce:** Add cooked rice, soy sauce, vinegar, chili flakes, black pepper, salt, and schezwan sauce. Stir-fry for 3 minutes.  
4. **Garnish & Serve:** Garnish with spring onions and serve hot.

Title: Egg Kathi Roll
Ingredients:
• 2 whole wheat parathas  ,
• 2 eggs  ,
• 1/2 cup sliced onions  ,
• 1/2 cup capsicum (sliced)  ,
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  ,
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  ,

Title: Bhel Puri
Ingredients:
• 200g Puffed Rice (Murmura)  ,
   • 100g Sev (thin crispy chickpea noodles)  ,
   • 1 Medium Potato (boiled, peeled, and chopped)  ,
   • 1 Medium Onion (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1 Medium Tomato (finely chopped)  ,
   • 50g Roasted Peanuts  ,
   • 2 tbsp Coriander Leaves (finely chopped)  ,
   • 2 tbsp Raw Mango (finely chopped, optional)  ,

   • 1/2 tsp Red Chili Powder  ,

Title: Chicken Shawarma
Ingredients:

   • 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste  ,
   • 1 tsp red chili powder  ,
   • ½ tsp turmeric powder  ,
   • 1 tsp cumin powder  ,
   • 1 tsp coriander powder  ,
   • ½ tsp garam masala  ,
   • ½ tsp black pepper powder  ,
   • 1 tbsp oil (for marinade)  ,
   • Salt to taste  ,
   • 1 tbsp butter (for grilling)  ,
   • 2 pita breads or naan  ,
   • ½ cup shredded cabbage  ,
   • ½ cup sliced onions  ,
   • ½ cup chopped tomatoes  ,
   • ¼ cup sliced cucumbers  ,
   • ¼ cup fresh coriander (chopped)  ,
   • ¼ cup fresh mint leaves (chopped)  ,
   • ½ cup garlic mayonnaise or hung curd sauce  ,
   • ¼ cup green chutney (optional)  ,
   • ½ tsp chaat masala (for garnish)  ,
   • ½ tsp sesame seeds (optional, for garnish).
Instructions:
1. **Marinate the Chicken**: In a bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, cumin, coriander powder, garam masala, black pepper, oil, and salt. Add cubed chicken and coat well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (preferably overnight for better flavor).  
   2. **Grill the Chicken**: Heat a pan/grill with butter. Cook the marinated chicken on medium heat for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally until golden brown and fully cooked. Set aside.

Title: Mexican Tacos
Ingredients:

  • 150g Onion (sliced)  ,

Title: Paneer Burger
Ingredients:
200g paneer (cut into patty shape) ,2 burger buns ,1/4 cup onions (sliced) ,1/4 cup tomatoes (sliced),1/4 cup lettuce , 2 tbsp mayonnaise  , 2 tbsp green chutney  , 2 tbsp cheese (grated)

Title: Thai Basil Fried Rice
Ingredients:

Title: Falafel Wrap
Ingredients:
• 200g Chickpeas (soaked overnight)  ,
    • 1 Small Onion (finely chopped)  ,
    • 2 Cloves Garlic (minced) , 
    • 1/2 Cup Fresh Parsley (chopped)  ,
    • 1/2 Cup Fresh Cilantro (chopped)  ,
    • 1 tsp Cumin Powder  ,
    • 1 tsp Coriander Powder  ,
    • 1/2 tsp Paprika  ,
    • 1/2 tsp Baking Soda  ,
    • 2 tbsp All-purpose Flour  ,
    • 1/2 tsp Salt  ,
    • 1/4 tsp Black Pepper  ,
    • 1 tbsp Lemon Juice  ,
    • 2 tbsp Olive Oil  ,
    • Oil (for frying)  ,

    **For the Wrap:**  
    • 4 Large Tortilla Wraps  ,
    • 1 Cup Lettuce (shredded)  ,
    • 1 Small Tomato (sliced)  ,
    • 1 Small Cucumber (sliced)  ,
    • 1/2 Cup Pickled Jalapeños (optional)  ,
    • 1/2 Cup Hummus  ,
    • 1/2 Cup Garlic Sauce or Tahini Sauce.
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Falafel Mix**  
       - Drain the soaked chickpeas completely.  
       - In a food processor, add chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cilantro, cumin, coriander, paprika, baking soda, flour, salt, black pepper, and lemon juice.  
       - Pulse until a coarse mixture forms. Do not over-blend; the mixture should be grainy.  
       - Transfer to a bowl, cover, and refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up.  

    2. **Shape the Falafel**  
       - Take small portions of the mixture and shape them into small patties or balls.  
       - If the mixture is too wet, add a little more flour to bind.  

    3. **Fry the Falafel**  
       - Heat oil in a deep pan to 180°C (350°F).  
       - Fry the falafel in batches until golden brown and crispy (about 3-4 minutes per side).  
       - Remove and drain on paper towels.  

    4. **Prepare the Wraps**  
       - Warm the tortilla wraps on a pan or directly over a flame for a few seconds.  
       - Spread a generous amount of hummus or garlic sauce on each wrap.  
       - Add lettuce, sliced tomatoes, cucumbers, and pickled jalapeños.  
       - Place 3-4 falafel pieces on top.  
       - Drizzle with extra sauce if desired.  

    5. **Wrap and Serve**  
       - Fold the bottom of the tortilla and roll tightly from the sides to form a wrap.  
       - Serve immediately or grill lightly for a crispy finish.

Title: Mushroom Risotto

5. **Finish with Cheese:** Stir in Parmesan cheese, mix well, and serve warm.

Title: Thai Green Curry

Title: Moong Dal Halwa
Ingredients:
• 1 cup yellow moong dal (soaked for 4 hours)  
• 3/4 cup ghee  
• 1 cup sugar  
• 2 1/2 cups milk  
• 1/2 tsp cardamom powder  
• 2 tbsp chopped almonds  
• 2 tbsp chopped cashews  
• 2 tbsp raisins  
• 1/4 cup khoya (optional, for richness)  
• 2 tbsp saffron milk (soaked saffron in warm milk)
Instructions:
1. **Grind Moong Dal:** Drain soaked dal and grind it into a coarse paste.  
2. **Roast in Ghee:** Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan, add the moong dal paste, and cook on low flame for 30-40 minutes, stirring continuously until golden brown.  
3. **Prepare Sweet Mixture:** In a separate pan, warm milk, add sugar, and stir until dissolved.  
4. **Combine & Cook:** Slowly add the sweetened milk to the roasted dal and cook while stirring until the ghee separates.  
5. **Enhance Flavor:** Add cardamom powder, khoya, saffron milk, almonds, cashews, and raisins. Mix well.  
6. **Serve Hot:** Garnish with more nuts and serve warm.

Title: Shahi Tukda

• 2 tbsp chopped pistachios  
• 2 tbsp ghee (for frying)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Sugar Syrup:** Heat water and sugar in a pan until it forms a one-string consistency syrup. Add cardamom powder.  
2. **Prepare Rabri:** Boil milk until it thickens, add condensed milk, khoya, saffron, and nuts. Cook until creamy.  
3. **Fry Bread Slices:** Heat ghee in a pan and deep-fry bread pieces until golden brown.  
4. **Soak Bread in Syrup:** Dip fried bread in sugar syrup for a few seconds and remove.  
5. **Assemble & Serve:** Pour rabri over sugar-coated bread slices and garnish with almonds and pistachios.  
6. **Serve Chilled or Warm.**

Title: Bombay Sandwich

Title: Bun Maska & Irani Chai

• 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
