4. **Strain & Serve:** Strain tea into cups and serve hot with bun maska.  
5. **Enjoy Classic Irani Café Style.**

Title: Filter Coffee
Ingredients:
• 2 tbsp South Indian filter coffee powder  
• 1 cup water  
• 1/2 cup full-fat milk  
• 1-2 tsp sugar (adjust to taste)  
• 1 tsp boiling water (for pre-wetting coffee powder)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Coffee Decoction:**  
   - Place 2 tbsp of filter coffee powder into the upper chamber of a traditional South Indian coffee filter.  
   - Sprinkle 1 tsp of boiling water over the coffee powder to pre-wet it.  
   - Pour 1 cup of hot water over it and close the lid. Let the decoction slowly drip into the lower chamber (this takes about 10-15 minutes).  

2. **Heat the Milk:**  
   - In a saucepan, heat 1/2 cup of full-fat milk until it comes to a boil.  

3. **Mix the Coffee:**  
   - Pour 1/4 cup of the strong coffee decoction into a serving cup.  
   - Add hot milk according to your preference for strength.  
   - Stir in 1-2 tsp of sugar.  

4. **Aerate & Serve:**  
   - Pour the coffee back and forth between two cups from a height to create froth (this is a classic South Indian style).  
   - Serve hot in a traditional steel tumbler with a dabarah (small bowl).  

5. **Enjoy Authentic South Indian Filter Coffee!**
Equipment: South Indian Coffee Filter, Saucepan, Tumbler

Title: Bombay Masala Toast

Title: Ragda Pattice

**For Ragda (White Peas Curry):**  
• 1 cup dried white peas (soaked overnight)  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/2 tsp cumin powder  
• 1/2 tsp coriander powder  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala

• 2 cups water  

**For Pattice (Potato Patties):**

• 1/2 tsp cumin powder

**For Toppings:**

Title: Masala Grilled Cheese Sandwich

Title: Aloo Masala Sandwich

2. **Assemble the Sandwich:**  
   - Spread butter on one side of each bread slice.  
   - On the unbuttered side, spread green chutney.  
   - Spread the aloo masala filling evenly.  
   - Cover with another slice of bread.  

3. **Grill the Sandwich:**  
   - Heat a sandwich griller or tawa.  
   - Spread butter on the outer sides of the sandwich.  
   - Grill until golden brown and crispy.  

4. **Serve:**  
   - Cut into halves and serve hot with ketchup & chutney!

Title: Pakora
Ingredients:
• 1 cup gram flour (besan)  
• 1/2 cup water  
• 1 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1 small onion (sliced)  
• 1/2 cup spinach leaves (chopped)  
• 1 small potato (thinly sliced)  
• Oil (for deep frying)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Batter:**  
   - Mix gram flour, water, cumin, turmeric, red chili powder, chaat masala, and salt.  
   - Add sliced onions, potatoes, and spinach.  

2. **Fry the Pakoras:**  
   - Heat oil and drop spoonfuls of batter.  
   - Fry until golden brown and crispy.  

3. **Serve:**  
   - Enjoy with mint or tamarind chutney!

Title: Frankie
Ingredients:
• 4 rotis  
• 2 medium potatoes (boiled & mashed)  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1/2 tsp garam masala  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/2 cup onion (chopped)  
• 1/2 cup cabbage (shredded)  
• 1 tbsp green chutney  
• 1 tbsp ketchup  
• 2 tbsp butter
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Filling:**  
   - Mix mashed potatoes with salt, garam masala, chaat masala, and red chili powder.  

2. **Assemble the Wraps:**  
   - Spread green chutney and ketchup on rotis.  
   - Place potato filling, onions, and cabbage.  
   - Roll tightly.  

3. **Toast & Serve:**  
   - Toast on a tawa with butter and serve warm!

Title: Jhalmuri
Ingredients:
• 2 cups puffed rice (murmura)  
• 1/2 cup sev  
• 1/4 cup roasted peanuts  
• 1/4 cup boiled potatoes (chopped)  
• 1/4 cup cucumber (chopped)  
• 1/4 cup tomato (chopped)  
• 1/4 cup onion (finely chopped)  
• 1 green chili (finely chopped)  
• 2 tbsp mustard oil  
• 1/2 tsp black salt  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1 tbsp tamarind chutney (optional)  
• 1 tbsp lemon juice  
• Fresh coriander (chopped) for garnish
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Ingredients:**  
   - Chop potatoes, onions, cucumber, tomatoes, and green chili.  

2. **Mix the Ingredients:**  
   - In a large bowl, combine puffed rice, sev, peanuts, boiled potatoes, cucumber, tomatoes, onions, and green chili.  

3. **Add Seasoning & Flavoring:**  
   - Pour mustard oil over the mixture.  
   - Add black salt, chaat masala, and red chili powder.  
   - Mix everything well.  

4. **Add Final Touches & Serve:**  
   - Drizzle with tamarind chutney (if using) and lemon juice.  
   - Garnish with fresh coriander.  
   - Serve immediately for the best crunch!

Title: Bread Pakora
Ingredients:
• 4 slices of bread (white or brown)  
• 2 medium potatoes (boiled & mashed)  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/2 tsp garam masala  
• 1 green chili (finely chopped)  
• 1 tbsp fresh coriander (chopped)  
• 1 cup gram flour (besan)  
• 1/4 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1/4 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)  
• 1/2 tsp salt (for batter)  
• 1/2 cup water  
• Oil for deep frying  
• Green chutney or tamarind chutney for serving
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Filling:**  
   - Mash boiled potatoes and mix with salt, chaat masala, red chili powder, garam masala, green chili, and coriander.  

2. **Prepare the Batter:**  
   - In a bowl, mix gram flour, turmeric powder, carom seeds, and salt.  
   - Gradually add water to form a smooth, thick batter.  

3. **Assemble the Pakoras:**  
   - Spread potato filling on one bread slice and cover with another slice.  
   - Cut diagonally to form two triangles.  

4. **Fry the Pakoras:**  
   - Heat oil in a deep pan.  
   - Dip each stuffed bread triangle into the batter, coating it evenly.  
   - Deep-fry until golden brown and crispy.  

5. **Serve:**  
   - Drain excess oil on paper towels.  
   - Serve hot with green chutney or tamarind chutney!

Title: Gatte Ki Sabzi
Ingredients:
For Gatte (Gram Flour Dumplings):  
• 1 cup besan (gram flour)  
• 1/2 tsp ajwain (carom seeds)  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• 2 tbsp yogurt  
• 1 tbsp oil  
• Water as needed  

For Gravy:  
• 1/2 cup yogurt  
• 1 tbsp besan  
• 1/2 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric  
• 1/2 tsp coriander powder  
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder  
• Salt to taste  
• 2 tbsp oil  
• 1 cup water  
• Chopped coriander for garnish
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Gatte:**  
   - Mix besan, ajwain, chili powder, salt, yogurt, and oil to make a stiff dough.  
   - Roll into logs and boil in water for 10 minutes. Slice into pieces.  

2. **Prepare Gravy:**  
   - Heat oil, add mustard, cumin, turmeric, coriander, and chili powder.  
   - Add yogurt mixed with besan and cook until thick.  

3. **Add Gatte:**  
   - Add sliced gatte to the gravy and simmer for 5 minutes.  
   - Garnish with coriander and serve with roti or rice.

Title: Pithla Bhakri
Ingredients:
For Pithla (Gram Flour Curry):  
• 1 cup besan (gram flour)  
• 1/2 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
• 1 green chili (chopped)  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric  
• 2 cups water  
• Salt to taste  
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander  

For Bhakri (Flatbread):  
• 1 cup jowar flour  
• Salt to taste  
• Water as needed
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Pithla:**  
   - Heat oil, add mustard, cumin, and green chili.  
   - Mix besan with water and add to pan.  
   - Stir continuously and cook until thick.  

2. **Prepare Bhakri:**  
   - Mix jowar flour, salt, and water into a dough.  
   - Roll into flatbreads and cook on tawa.  

3. **Serve:**  
   - Enjoy pithla with hot bhakri!

Title: Pesarattu Upma
Ingredients:
For Pesarattu (Green Gram Dosa):  
• 1 cup whole green gram (moong dal, soaked)  
• 1 tbsp rice  
• 1 green chili  
• 1 inch ginger  
• 1/2 tsp salt  
• Water as needed  

For Upma Filling:  
• 1/2 cup semolina (rava)  
• 1 cup water  
• 1/4 cup chopped onions  
• 1/4 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1/2 tsp chana dal  
• 1/2 tsp urad dal  
• 1 green chili (chopped)  
• 1 tsp ghee  
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Pesarattu Batter:**  
   - Blend soaked moong dal, rice, chili, ginger & salt into a smooth batter.  

2. **Prepare Upma:**  
   - Heat ghee, sauté mustard seeds, dals & onions.  
   - Add water & semolina, cook until thick.  

3. **Cook Pesarattu:**  
   - Spread batter on a hot tawa like a dosa.  

4. **Fill & Serve:**  
   - Place upma in the center, fold & serve with chutney!

Title: Soya Chaap Tikka
Ingredients:
• 4 soya chaap sticks  
• 1/2 cup yogurt  
• 1 tbsp gram flour (besan)  
• 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste  
• 1 tsp red chili powder  
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1/2 tsp garam masala  
• 1 tbsp lemon juice  
• 1 tbsp mustard oil  
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Marinade:**  
   - Mix yogurt, besan, spices, lemon juice & mustard oil.  

2. **Marinate Soya Chaap:**  
   - Cut chaap into pieces, coat in marinade & rest for 2 hours.  

3. **Grill or Tandoor:**  
   - Grill on skewers over a tandoor or in an oven until golden.  

4. **Serve Hot:**  
   - Sprinkle chaat masala & serve with mint chutney!

Title: Patra (Alu Vadi)
Ingredients:
• 10 large colocasia (arbi/taro) leaves  
• 1 cup gram flour (besan)  
• 2 tbsp rice flour  
• 1 tbsp tamarind paste  
• 1 tbsp jaggery (grated)  
• 1 tsp turmeric powder  
• 1 tsp red chili powder  
• 1 tsp coriander powder  
• 1/2 tsp garam masala  
• 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing)  
• 1 tsp sesame seeds  
• 1 tsp mustard seeds  
• 1 tbsp grated coconut (for garnish)  
• 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves  
• Salt to taste  
• Water as needed  
• 2 tbsp oil (for tempering)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Colocasia Leaves:**  
   - Wash and pat dry colocasia leaves.  
   - Trim the thick veins using a knife without tearing the leaf.  

2. **Make the Spiced Gram Flour Paste:**  
   - Mix gram flour, rice flour, tamarind paste, jaggery, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, hing, and salt.  
   - Add water gradually to form a thick, spreadable paste.  

3. **Coat and Roll:**  
   - Take one leaf, place it vein-side up, and spread a thin layer of the gram flour paste.  
   - Place another leaf on top and repeat until 3-4 layers are formed.  
   - Fold the sides inward and roll tightly like a cylinder.  

4. **Steam the Rolls:**  
   - Place rolls in a steamer and steam for **20-25 minutes** until firm.  
   - Allow them to cool before slicing into thick round pieces.  

5. **Temper or Fry:**  
   - Heat oil, add mustard seeds and sesame seeds.  
   - Sauté sliced Patra pieces until crispy. (Optional: Deep fry for extra crispiness.)  

6. **Garnish & Serve:**  
   - Sprinkle with grated coconut and chopped coriander.  
   - Serve with green chutney or ketchup!

Title: Masala Chaas
Ingredients:
• 2 cups yogurt  
• 1 cup water  
• 1/2 tsp roasted cumin powder  
• 1/2 tsp black salt  
• 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
• 1 tbsp chopped mint leaves  
• 1 tbsp chopped coriander leaves  
• 1/2 tsp grated ginger  
• Salt to taste  
• Ice cubes (optional)
Instructions:
1. **Blend Chaas:**  
   - Mix yogurt and water in a blender.  
   - Add cumin powder, black salt, chaat masala, mint, coriander, ginger, and salt.  
   - Blend until frothy.  

2. **Chill & Serve:**  
   - Pour into glasses over ice cubes.  
   - Garnish with a pinch of cumin powder and mint leaves.  
   - Serve chilled.

Title: Ghughra (Matar Karanji)
Ingredients:
For Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp ghee, Water as needed, Salt to taste. 
     For Filling: 1 cup green peas (crushed), 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp fennel seeds, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp ginger-green chili paste, 
     1 tbsp coriander leaves (chopped), Salt to taste, Oil for frying.
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, ghee, and salt. Add water gradually and knead into a firm dough. Let it rest for 30 minutes.
     2. Heat a pan, add cumin and fennel seeds, then add crushed green peas, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and ginger-chili paste. Cook for 5 minutes.
     3. Roll out small puris, add filling in the center, fold, and seal the edges.
     4. Deep-fry in medium-hot oil until golden brown. Serve hot with chutney.

Title: Methi Na Gota
Ingredients:
2 cups gram flour (besan), 1 cup fenugreek leaves (chopped), 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp carom seeds, 1/2 tsp crushed coriander seeds, 
     1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1 tbsp yogurt, Water as needed, Salt to taste, Oil for frying.
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, add besan, baking soda, turmeric, carom seeds, coriander seeds, chili powder, and salt.
     2. Add chopped fenugreek leaves and yogurt, mix well.
     3. Add water gradually to form a thick batter.
     4. Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry spoonfuls of batter until golden brown.
     5. Serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

Title: Ratalu Puris
Ingredients:
2 cups purple yam (grated), 1.5 cups whole wheat flour, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1/2 tsp carom seeds, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, Salt to taste, 
     Water as needed, Oil for frying.
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix grated purple yam, wheat flour, turmeric, cumin powder, carom seeds, chili powder, and salt.
     2. Add water gradually to knead a semi-soft dough.
     3. Divide into small portions, roll into puris.
     4. Heat oil in a pan and deep-fry the puris until crispy.
     5. Serve hot with chutney or curd.

Title: Dakor Na Gota
Ingredients:
2 cups chickpea flour (besan), 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp ajwain, 1/2 tsp coriander seeds, 1/2 tsp crushed pepper, 
     1 tbsp chopped coriander leaves, Salt to taste, Water as needed, Oil for frying.
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix besan, baking soda, turmeric, ajwain, coriander seeds, crushed pepper, salt, and sugar.
     2. Add water gradually to form a thick batter.
     3. Heat oil in a kadai, drop spoonfuls of batter, and deep-fry until golden brown.
     4. Serve hot with sweet chutney and tea.

Title: Khichu
Ingredients: 1 cup rice flour, 2 cups water, 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp ajwain, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tbsp sesame oil, Salt to taste.
Instructions:
1. In a pot, boil water with cumin, ajwain, salt, and turmeric.
     2. Lower the flame and gradually add rice flour, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
     3. Cook for 5 minutes until it forms a soft dough-like consistency.
     4. Drizzle with sesame oil and serve warm with chili powder sprinkled on top.

Title: Makai No Chevdo
Ingredients: 2 cups cornflakes, 1/2 cup peanuts, 1/2 cup cashews, 1/4 cup raisins, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp sugar, Salt to taste, 2 tbsp oil.
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, fry peanuts, cashews, and raisins separately.
     2. In the same pan, add cornflakes, turmeric, chili powder, sugar, and salt.
     3. Toss everything together and store in an airtight container.

Title: Classic Spaghetti Aglio e Olio
Ingredients: 200g spaghetti, 4 garlic cloves (thinly sliced), 1/2 tsp red chili flakes, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, 1 tbsp fresh parsley (chopped), Salt to taste, Black pepper to taste, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese (optional).
Instructions:
1. Boil spaghetti in salted water until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain the rest.
     2. Heat olive oil in a pan, add garlic, and sauté until golden brown.
     3. Add red chili flakes, stir for a few seconds.
     4. Toss in the cooked spaghetti and mix well.
     5. Add reserved pasta water to create a light sauce.
     6. Season with salt, black pepper, and chopped parsley.
     7. Garnish with Parmesan (if using) and serve warm.

Title: Creamy Alfredo Fettuccine
Ingredients: 200g fettuccine, 2 tbsp butter, 2 garlic cloves (minced), 1 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese (grated), 1/2 tsp black pepper, Salt to taste, 1/4 tsp nutmeg (optional), 1 tbsp parsley (chopped).
Instructions:
1. Cook fettuccine in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
     2. In a pan, melt butter over medium heat, then add garlic and sauté for a minute.
     3. Pour in heavy cream, stir well, and let it simmer for 2 minutes.
     4. Add Parmesan cheese, black pepper, salt, and nutmeg, stirring until the sauce thickens.
     5. Toss in the cooked fettuccine and coat evenly.
     6. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Title: Pesto Penne Pasta
Ingredients: 200g penne pasta, 1 cup fresh basil leaves, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, 2 tbsp pine nuts, 2 garlic cloves, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, Salt to taste, Black pepper to taste, 1 tbsp lemon juice.
Instructions:
1. Cook penne pasta in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve some pasta water and drain the rest.
     2. In a food processor, blend basil, Parmesan, pine nuts, garlic, olive oil, salt, black pepper, and lemon juice until smooth.
     3. Toss the cooked penne with the pesto sauce, adding reserved pasta water if needed to loosen the sauce.
     4. Serve warm with extra Parmesan on top.

Title: Spicy Arrabbiata Pasta
Ingredients: 200g penne pasta, 2 tbsp olive oil, 4 garlic cloves (minced), 1 can (400g) crushed tomatoes, 1 tsp red chili flakes, 1/2 tsp black pepper, Salt to taste, 1 tsp dried oregano, 1 tbsp fresh basil (chopped).
Instructions:
1. Cook penne pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
     2. Heat olive oil in a pan, add minced garlic, and sauté for a minute.
     3. Add red chili flakes, followed by crushed tomatoes. Cook for 10 minutes.
     4. Season with salt, black pepper, and oregano.
     5. Toss in the cooked pasta and mix well.
     6. Garnish with fresh basil and serve hot.

Title: Mushroom Truffle Pasta
Ingredients: 200g linguine, 1 tbsp truffle oil, 1 tbsp butter, 200g mushrooms (sliced), 2 garlic cloves (minced), 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese, Salt to taste, Black pepper to taste, 1 tbsp parsley (chopped).
Instructions:
1. Cook linguine pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
     2. Heat butter in a pan, add mushrooms and garlic, and sauté until soft.
     3. Pour in heavy cream, then add Parmesan, salt, and black pepper.
     4. Toss in the cooked linguine, mix well, and drizzle with truffle oil.
     5. Garnish with parsley and serve warm.

Title: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
Ingredients: 200g fettuccine, 1 chicken breast (sliced), 2 tbsp butter, 2 garlic cloves (minced), 1 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, 1/2 tsp black pepper, Salt to taste, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1 tbsp parsley (chopped).
Instructions:
1. Cook fettuccine pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
     2. In a pan, heat butter, add chicken slices, and cook until golden brown.
     3. Add garlic, then pour in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese.
     4. Season with black pepper, salt, and oregano.
     5. Toss in the cooked fettuccine and mix well.
     6. Garnish with parsley and serve hot.

Title: Masala Pasta (Indian Street Style)
Ingredients: 200g penne pasta, 2 tbsp oil, 1 onion (chopped), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1 green chili (chopped), 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp chaat masala, 1/2 tsp coriander powder, 1/4 cup capsicum (chopped), 1/4 cup carrots (chopped), Salt to taste, 1/4 cup coriander leaves (chopped), 1 tbsp tomato ketchup, 1/2 cup cheese (optional).
Instructions:
1. Boil pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside.
     2. Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, and let them splutter.
     3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
     4. Add pureed tomatoes, green chili, and cook until oil separates.
     5. Mix in turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, and salt.
     6. Add capsicum, carrots, and cook for 3-4 minutes.
     7. Toss in the cooked pasta and mix well.
     8. Stir in tomato ketchup and cheese (if using).
     9. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

Title: Masala Chai (Indian Spiced Tea)
Ingredients: 2 cups water, 1 cup milk, 2 tsp loose tea leaves or 2 tea bags, 2 tbsp sugar (or to taste), 1/2 inch ginger (grated), 2-3 cardamom pods (crushed), 1 small cinnamon stick, 2-3 cloves, 1/2 tsp black peppercorns.
Instructions:
1. Boil water in a saucepan and add grated ginger, crushed cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, and peppercorns.
     2. Simmer for 2 minutes until fragrant.
     3. Add tea leaves and sugar, and boil for another 2 minutes.
     4. Pour in milk and let it come to a boil.
     5. Strain the tea into cups and serve hot.

Title: Mango Lassi
Ingredients: 1 cup ripe mango pulp, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1/4 cup milk, 2 tbsp sugar (or honey), 1/4 tsp cardamom powder, Ice cubes, Chopped pistachios for garnish.
Instructions:
1. Blend mango pulp, yogurt, milk, sugar, and cardamom powder until smooth.
     2. Add ice cubes and blend again.
     3. Pour into glasses, garnish with chopped pistachios, and serve chilled.

Title: Jaljeera
Ingredients: 2 cups cold water, 1 tsp roasted cumin powder, 1/2 tsp black salt, 1/2 tsp chaat masala, 1/2 inch ginger (grated), 1/2 cup fresh mint leaves, 1 tbsp lemon juice, Ice cubes.
Instructions:
1. Blend mint leaves, ginger, cumin powder, black salt, and chaat masala into a fine paste.
     2. Mix the paste with cold water and lemon juice.
     3. Stir well, add ice cubes, and serve chilled.

Title: Thandai
Ingredients: 2 cups milk, 10 almonds (soaked & peeled), 1 tbsp poppy seeds, 1 tbsp fennel seeds, 5 black peppercorns, 2 green cardamom pods, 2 tbsp sugar, 5-6 saffron strands, Rose petals for garnish.
Instructions:
1. Blend almonds, poppy seeds, fennel seeds, black pepper, and cardamom into a fine paste.
     2. Boil milk and add sugar, saffron, and the prepared paste.
     3. Simmer for 5 minutes, then chill in the refrigerator.
     4. Serve cold, garnished with rose petals.

Title: Badam Milk
Ingredients: 2 cups milk, 10 almonds (soaked & peeled), 2 tbsp sugar, 1/4 tsp cardamom powder, 4-5 saffron strands, Chopped pistachios for garnish.
Instructions:
1. Blend almonds with a little milk to make a fine paste.
     2. Boil the remaining milk, then add sugar, cardamom, and saffron.
     3. Stir in the almond paste and simmer for 5 minutes.
     4. Garnish with pistachios and serve hot or chilled.

Title: Aam Panna
Ingredients: 2 raw mangoes, 3 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp black salt, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1 tbsp mint leaves, 2 cups cold water, Ice cubes.
Instructions:
1. Boil or roast the raw mangoes until soft.
     2. Peel and blend with sugar, black salt, cumin, and mint.
     3. Mix with cold water and serve chilled with ice cubes.

Title: Nimbu Pani (Indian Lemonade)
Ingredients: 2 cups cold water, 2 tbsp lemon juice, 2 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp black salt, 1/4 tsp cumin powder, Ice cubes, Mint leaves for garnish.
Instructions:
1. Mix lemon juice, sugar, black salt, and cumin powder in water.
     2. Stir well until sugar dissolves.
     3. Add ice cubes, garnish with mint leaves, and serve chilled.

Title: Aam Ras Puri
Ingredients:
For Aam Ras: 2 ripe mangoes (Alphonso/Kesar), 2 tbsp sugar (adjust as per sweetness), 1/4 tsp cardamom powder, 1/4 cup milk (optional), 1 tsp saffron strands (optional).
    For Puri: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1/4 tsp salt, 1 tbsp ghee, Water (as needed), Oil (for deep frying).
Instructions:
1. **Prepare Aam Ras**:
        a. Peel and chop the ripe mangoes.
        b. Blend mango pieces with sugar, cardamom powder, and milk (if using) until smooth.
        c. Add saffron strands for extra flavor.
        d. Chill the aam ras in the refrigerator before serving.
        
    2. **Prepare Puri**:
        a. In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, salt, and ghee.
        b. Gradually add water and knead into a stiff dough.
        c. Cover and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.
        d. Divide the dough into small portions and roll them into small circles.
        e. Heat oil in a deep frying pan and fry the puris until golden brown and puffed up.
        f. Drain excess oil using paper towels.

    3. **Serving**:
        a. Serve hot puris with chilled aam ras.
        b. Optionally, garnish aam ras with chopped nuts or a drizzle of ghee.
ServingSize: 1 bowl aam ras + 2 puris per serving
Allergens: Gluten, Dairy (if using milk in aam ras)
Equipment: Blender, Mixing Bowl, Rolling Pin, Deep Fryer

Title: Tandoori Roti
Ingredients: 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/4 cup warm water, 1 tbsp butter
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix wheat flour, yogurt, salt, and baking soda.  
  2. Gradually add warm water and knead into a soft dough.  
  3. Let it rest for 20 minutes.  
  4. Divide into equal portions, roll out into discs, and cook on a tandoor or skillet until golden brown.  
  5. Brush with butter before serving.

Title: Makhmali Kebab
Ingredients: 250g minced chicken, 2 tbsp cashew paste, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 2 tbsp cream, salt to taste, 1 tbsp ghee
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix minced chicken with cashew paste, ginger-garlic paste, and spices.  
  2. Add cream and mix well.  
  3. Shape into kebabs and grill until golden brown.  
  4. Serve with mint chutney.

Title: Amritsari Kulcha with Chole
Ingredients:
For Kulcha: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup yogurt, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 2 tbsp butter  
 For Filling: 1 boiled potato, 1 tbsp chopped coriander, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt to taste  
 For Chole: 1 cup chickpeas, 1 onion (chopped), 2 tomatoes (pureed), 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala
Instructions:
1. Knead a soft dough using flour, yogurt, baking soda, and salt. Let it rest for 30 minutes.  
  2. Mash boiled potatoes and mix with spices for the filling.  
  3. Stuff the dough with filling, roll out into a kulcha, and cook on a skillet with butter.  
  4. For Chole, heat oil, sauté onions, add tomato puree, and spices.  
  5. Add boiled chickpeas, cook for 10 minutes, and serve with kulcha.

Title: Kokum Sharbat
Ingredients: 1/2 cup dried kokum, 2 tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp black salt, 1/2 tsp roasted cumin powder, 2 cups water, Ice cubes',
Instructions:
1. Soak kokum in 1/2 cup warm water for 15 minutes.  
  2. Blend soaked kokum with sugar, salt, and cumin powder.  
  3. Strain and mix with chilled water and ice cubes. Serve cold.

Title: Pineapple Halwa
Ingredients: 1 cup pineapple (chopped), 1/2 cup semolina (sooji), 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 2 tbsp ghee, 1/2 cup milk, 10 cashews
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast semolina until golden brown.  
  2. Add pineapple, sugar, cardamom, and milk.  
  3. Cook on low heat until thickened. Garnish with cashews and serve.

Title: Indian-Style Burger
Ingredients: 1 burger bun, 1 boiled potato, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp chaat masala, 1 tbsp green chutney, 1 onion (sliced), 1 tomato (sliced), 1 lettuce leaf, 1 cheese slice',
Instructions:
1. Mash boiled potato, mix with breadcrumbs and spices, and shape into a patty.  
  2. Cook patty in a pan until golden brown.  
  3. Assemble burger with lettuce, tomato, onion, patty, cheese, and chutney.

Title: Aloo Tikki Burger
Ingredients: 1 burger bun, 1 boiled potato, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1 tbsp mayonnaise, 1 onion (sliced), 1 tomato (sliced), 1 lettuce leaf
Instructions:
1. Mash boiled potato, mix with breadcrumbs and spices, and shape into a patty.  
  2. Shallow fry until crispy.  
  3. Assemble burger with lettuce, tomato, onion, patty, and mayonnaise.

Title: Tandoori Chicken Burger
Ingredients: 1 chicken breast, 1/4 cup yogurt, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp lemon juice, 1 burger bun, 1 lettuce leaf, 1 onion (sliced), 1 tbsp mayonnaise'
Instructions:
1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, spices, and lemon juice for 30 minutes.  
  2. Grill until fully cooked.  
  3. Assemble burger with lettuce, onion, grilled chicken, and mayonnaise.

Title: Spicy Mushroom Burger
Ingredients: 1 cup mushrooms (chopped), 1/2 onion (chopped), 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp garlic paste, 1 burger bun, 1 lettuce leaf, 1 cheese slice
Instructions:
1. Sauté mushrooms with garlic, onion, and black pepper.  
  2. Cook until golden brown and slightly crispy.  
  3. Assemble burger with lettuce, cheese, and sautéed mushrooms.

Title: Mumbai Vada Pav Burger
Ingredients:
For Vada: 2 boiled potatoes, 1/2 tsp mustard seeds, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garlic paste, 1/2 cup gram flour (besan), 1/4 tsp baking soda, salt to taste, oil for frying  
 For Assembling: 1 burger bun, 1 tbsp green chutney, 1 tbsp garlic chutney, 1 onion (sliced), 1 green chili
Instructions:
1. Mash boiled potatoes and mix with mustard seeds, turmeric, chili powder, and garlic paste.  
  2. Make small balls, dip in gram flour batter, and deep fry until golden.  
  3. Slice burger bun, spread green chutney and garlic chutney.  
  4. Place fried vada inside the bun with sliced onions and green chili.

Title: Fish Tikki Burger
Ingredients:
For Tikki: 200g fish fillet (boneless), 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp garlic paste, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1 egg, oil for shallow frying  
 For Assembling: 1 burger bun, 1 tbsp tartar sauce, 1 lettuce leaf, 1 tomato (sliced), 1 cheese slice
Instructions:
1. Blend fish with garlic paste, black pepper, and salt into a paste.  
  2. Shape into patties, dip in egg, coat with breadcrumbs, and shallow fry until golden brown.  
  3. Slice burger bun, spread tartar sauce, and add lettuce.  
  4. Place the fish patty, cheese, and tomato slices inside.

Title: Chole Tikki Burger
Ingredients:
For Tikki: 1 cup boiled chickpeas, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, 1 tbsp cornflour, salt to taste, oil for shallow frying  
 For Assembling: 1 burger bun, 1 tbsp mint chutney, 1 onion (sliced), 1 tomato (sliced), 1 cheese slice
Instructions:
1. Mash boiled chickpeas and mix with spices, breadcrumbs, and cornflour.  
  2. Shape into patties and shallow fry until crispy.  
  3. Slice burger bun, spread mint chutney, and add onion rings.  
  4. Place chickpea tikki, cheese, and tomato slices inside.

Title: Masala Egg Burger
Ingredients:
For Egg Patty:  
2 eggs, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt to taste, 1 tbsp oil, 1 tbsp chopped coriander, 1 tbsp chopped onions.  
For Assembling:  
1 burger bun, 1 tbsp mayonnaise, 1 tbsp tomato ketchup, 1 onion (sliced), 1 tomato (sliced), 1 cheese slice, 1 lettuce leaf.
Instructions:
1. Beat eggs with turmeric, chili powder, black pepper, garam masala, salt, coriander, and onions.  
  2. Heat a pan, add oil, and pour the egg mixture to make an omelet. Fold it into a patty shape.  
  3. Slice the burger bun, spread mayonnaise and tomato ketchup.  
  4. Place the egg patty, followed by cheese, tomato, onion slices, and lettuce.  
  5. Close the bun and serve warm.

Title: Paneer Tikka Burger
Ingredients:
For Paneer Tikka:  
200g paneer (cottage cheese), 1/2 cup thick yogurt, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1/2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1 tbsp lemon juice, salt to taste, 1 tbsp oil, 1 tbsp gram flour (besan).  
For Assembling:  
1 burger bun, 1 tbsp mint chutney, 1 onion (sliced), 1 tomato (sliced), 1 cheese slice, 1 lettuce leaf.
Instructions:
1. Mix yogurt, red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, cumin powder, lemon juice, salt, and gram flour.  
  2. Coat paneer slices in this marinade and let it rest for 15 minutes.  
  3. Heat a pan, add oil, and grill paneer slices until golden brown.  
  4. Slice burger bun, spread mint chutney.  
  5. Place grilled paneer tikka, followed by onion rings, tomato slices, and cheese.  
  6. Close the bun and serve hot.

Title: Gajar Halwa
Ingredients: 2 cups grated carrots, 1.5 cups full-fat milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup ghee, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 10 cashews, 10 almonds, 10 raisins.
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, add grated carrots, and sauté for 5 minutes.  
  2. Pour milk and simmer until the milk evaporates.  
  3. Add sugar and mix well.  
  4. Stir in cardamom powder, chopped nuts, and raisins.  
  5. Cook for another 5 minutes until thickened. Serve warm.

Title: Suji Halwa
Ingredients: 1 cup semolina (suji), 1/2 cup ghee, 3/4 cup sugar, 2 cups water, 1/4 tsp cardamom powder, 10 cashews, 10 raisins.
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, roast semolina on low flame until golden brown.  
  2. Add water while stirring continuously.  
  3. Once absorbed, mix in sugar and cardamom powder.  
  4. Cook until thickened, then add nuts and raisins.  
  5. Serve warm.

Title: Beetroot Halwa
Ingredients: 2 cups grated beetroot, 1.5 cups full-fat milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup ghee, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 10 cashews, 10 almonds.
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, add grated beetroot, and sauté for 5 minutes.  
  2. Pour milk and simmer until the milk evaporates.  
  3. Add sugar and mix well.  
  4. Stir in cardamom powder, chopped nuts.  
  5. Cook until thickened. Serve warm.

Title: Pumpkin Halwa
Ingredients: 2 cups grated pumpkin, 1.5 cups full-fat milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup ghee, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 10 cashews, 10 almonds.
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, add grated pumpkin, and sauté for 5 minutes.  
  2. Pour milk and simmer until the milk evaporates.  
  3. Add sugar and mix well.  
  4. Stir in cardamom powder, chopped nuts.  
  5. Cook until thickened. Serve warm.

Title: Badam Halwa
Ingredients: 1 cup almonds (badam), 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup ghee, 1/4 tsp cardamom powder, 5-6 saffron strands, 1/4 cup water.
Instructions:
1. Soak almonds in hot water for 30 minutes and peel the skin.  
  2. Blend almonds with milk into a smooth paste.  
  3. Heat ghee in a pan, add the almond paste, and cook on low flame for 10 minutes.  
  4. Add sugar, saffron, and cardamom powder, stirring continuously.  
  5. Cook until the halwa thickens and leaves the sides of the pan.  
  6. Serve warm, garnished with chopped nuts.

Title: Classic Rabdi
Ingredients: 1 liter full-fat milk, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, 5-6 saffron strands, 1 tbsp chopped almonds & pistachios.
Instructions:
1. Heat milk in a wide pan and bring it to a boil.  
  2. Simmer on low flame, stirring occasionally to form a thick consistency.  
  3. Add sugar, saffron, and cardamom powder, cooking for another 10 minutes.  
  4. Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios.  
  5. Serve warm or chilled.

Title: Kheer(Rice Pudding)
Ingredients: 1/2 cup basmati rice, 1 liter full-fat milk, 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 tsp cardamom powder, 10-12 almonds (chopped), 10-12 cashews (chopped), 10-15 raisins, 8-10 saffron strands, 1 tbsp ghee, 1/2 tsp rose water.
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee and sauté soaked rice for 2 mins.  
  2. Boil milk, add rice, and simmer for 30-40 mins until thick.  
  3. Add sugar, cardamom, saffron, and mix well.  
  4. Add nuts and serve warm or chilled.

Title: Idli (South Indian)
Ingredients:
**For Idli Batter**:  
    - 2 cups idli rice ,
    - 1 cup urad dal (split black gram),  
    - 1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds , 
    - 1/2 tsp salt,  
    - Water as needed , 

  **  For Sambar**:  
    - 1/2 cup toor dal (pigeon pea lentils) , 
    - 1/2 tsp turmeric powder,  
    - 1 small onion, chopped,  
    - 1 small tomato, chopped,  
    - 1/2 cup mixed vegetables ( drumstick etc.) , 
    - 1/2 tsp mustard seeds , 
    - 1/2 tsp cumin seeds , 
    - 1 dried red chili,  
    - 1/2 tsp asafoetida (hing),  
    - 1 sprig curry leaves , 
    - 2 tbsp tamarind extract,  
    - 1 tbsp sambar powder , 
    - 1 tbsp oil , 
    - Salt to taste  ,
    - 2 cups water  ,
    - Fresh coriander leaves for garnish  ,

    **For Coconut Chutney**:  
    - 1/2 cup grated coconut , 
    - 2 tbsp roasted chana dal (Bengal gram)  ,
    - 1 small green chili  ,
    - 1/2 inch ginger  ,
    - 2 tbsp water  ,
    - Salt to taste  ,
    - 1 tsp mustard seeds , 
    - 1 sprig curry leaves  ,
    - 1 tsp oil.
Instructions:
**Preparation of Idli Batter:**  
    1. Rinse the idli rice and urad dal separately. Soak the idli rice with fenugreek seeds in water for 6 hours. Soak urad dal separately for 4 hours.  
    2. Drain and grind urad dal with water into a smooth and fluffy batter. Similarly, grind the idli rice with a little water to a smooth consistency.  
    3. Mix both batters, add salt, and ferment overnight or for 8–12 hours in a warm place until it doubles in volume.  
    4. Grease the idli plates and pour the batter into each mold. Steam for 10-12 minutes in an idli steamer. Let it cool slightly before removing.  

    **Preparation of Sambar:**  
    1. Wash and pressure cook toor dal with 2 cups of water and turmeric powder for 3 whistles. Mash it well.  
    2. In a pan, heat oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chili, curry leaves, and asafoetida. Sauté for a few seconds.  
    3. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent. Add tomatoes and cook until soft.  
    4. Add chopped vegetables, salt, sambar powder, tamarind extract, and 2 cups of water. Simmer for 10 minutes until vegetables are tender.  
    5. Add the mashed dal, mix well, and simmer for another 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.  

     **Preparation of Coconut Chutney:**  
    1. Grind coconut, roasted chana dal, green chili, ginger, water, and salt into a smooth paste.  
    2. Heat oil in a small pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves. Let them splutter.  
    3. Pour this tempering over the chutney and mix well.  

     **Serving:**  
    - Serve hot idlis with sambar and coconut chutney. Enjoy!

Title: Idra/White Dhokla(Gujarati)
Ingredients: Rice - 1 cup, Urad Dal - 1/2 cup, Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Ginger - 1 inch (grated), Eno - 1 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - as needed, Oil - 1 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1 tsp, Curry Leaves - 5-6, Sesame Seeds - 1 tsp
Instructions:
1. Soak rice and urad dal separately for 4-6 hours, then grind into a smooth batter.
    2. Mix in yogurt, salt, ginger, and green chilies. Let it ferment overnight.
    3. Just before steaming, add Eno and mix gently.
    4. Pour batter into greased trays and steam for 15-20 minutes.
    5. For tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and sesame seeds.
    6. Pour tempering over dhokla, cut into pieces, and serve.

Title: Dudhi/Lauki/Bottlegourd Halwa (Gujarati)
Ingredients: Bottlegourd (Lauki) - 2 cups (grated), Milk - 2 cups, Sugar - 1/2 cup, Ghee - 2 tbsp, Cardamom Powder - 1/2 tsp, Cashews - 8-10 (chopped), Almonds - 8-10 (sliced), Saffron - few strands
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan, add grated bottlegourd, and sauté for 5-7 minutes until soft.
    2. Add milk and cook on medium heat, stirring occasionally, until milk reduces.
    3. Add sugar and mix well; continue cooking until the halwa thickens.
    4. Add cardamom powder, saffron strands, and chopped nuts.
    5. Cook for another 2 minutes, then serve warm or chilled.

Title: Muthiya (Gujarati Steamed Dumplings)
Ingredients: Wheat Flour - 1 cup, Besan (Gram Flour) - 1/2 cup, Grated Bottle Gourd (Lauki) - 1 cup, Methi Leaves (chopped) - 1/2 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 2, Ginger (grated) - 1 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Baking Soda - 1/4 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Sugar - 1 tsp, Oil - 1 tbsp (for dough), Water - as needed
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix wheat flour, besan, grated bottle gourd, chopped methi leaves, green chilies, ginger, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin seeds, baking soda, lemon juice, salt, sugar, and oil.
    2. Add a little water and knead into a soft dough.
    3. Grease your hands and shape the dough into cylindrical logs.
    4. Steam the muthiya in a steamer for about 20-25 minutes until firm.
    5. Let them cool, then slice into bite-sized pieces.
    6. Serve as a snack with green chutney or use in curries.

Title: Muthiya Nu Shaak (Gujarati Muthiya Curry)
Ingredients: Plain Muthiya (steamed) - 10-12 pieces, Oil - 2 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing (Asafoetida) - a pinch, Curry Leaves - 6-8, Tomatoes (chopped) - 2, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 1 cup, Fresh Coriander Leaves - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and hing. Let them splutter.
    2. Add curry leaves and chopped tomatoes. Cook until soft.
    3. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
    4. Add 1 cup of water and bring the curry to a boil.
    5. Add the sliced muthiya and mix gently.
    6. Simmer for 5-7 minutes until the muthiya absorbs the flavors.
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti or rice.

Title: Sweet Rice (Meetha Chawal)
Ingredients: Basmati Rice - 1 cup, Water - 2 cups, Sugar - 1/2 cup, Ghee - 2 tbsp, Saffron - a few strands, Cardamom Powder - 1/2 tsp, Cloves - 2, Cinnamon Stick - 1 inch, Cashews - 8-10 (chopped), Almonds - 8-10 (sliced), Raisins - 1 tbsp, Grated Coconut - 2 tbsp (optional)
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
    2. Heat ghee in a pan, add cloves and cinnamon, and sauté for a few seconds.
    3. Add drained rice and sauté for 2-3 minutes until slightly aromatic.
    4. Add 2 cups of water and let the rice cook until almost done.
    5. Stir in sugar, saffron, cardamom powder, and grated coconut.
    6. Cook on low heat until sugar melts and the rice absorbs the flavors.
    7. In another pan, heat ghee and roast cashews, almonds, and raisins.
    8. Add roasted nuts to the rice, mix gently, and serve warm.

Title: Magaj (Gujarati Besan Fudge)
Ingredients: Besan (Gram Flour) - 2 cups, Ghee - 1 cup, Powdered Sugar - 1 cup, Cardamom Powder - 1/2 tsp, Nutmeg Powder - 1/4 tsp, Almonds - 8-10 (chopped), Pistachios - 8-10 (chopped), Khoya (Mawa) - 1/2 cup (optional)
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan. Add besan and roast on low heat, stirring continuously.
    2. Keep roasting for 15-20 minutes until the besan turns golden brown and releases a nutty aroma.
    3. If using khoya (mawa), add it now and mix well.
    4. Turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.
    5. Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, nutmeg powder, and mix well.
    6. Transfer the mixture into a greased tray and spread evenly.
    7. Sprinkle chopped almonds and pistachios on top, pressing gently.
    8. Let it set for 2-3 hours, then cut into squares and serve.

Title: Goor Amli Bataka Nu Shaak (Sweet & Tangy Potato Curry)
Ingredients: Potatoes (boiled & cubed) - 3 medium, Tamarind Pulp - 2 tbsp, Jaggery (Goor) - 2 tbsp, Oil - 2 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing (Asafoetida) - a pinch, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 1 cup, Fresh Coriander Leaves - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.
    2. Add hing, turmeric powder, and the boiled, cubed potatoes. Mix well.
    3. Stir in red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt.
    4. Add tamarind pulp and jaggery, then mix well.
    5. Pour 1 cup of water and let the curry simmer for 5-7 minutes, allowing the flavors to blend.
    6. Adjust the consistency by adding more water if needed.
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or puri.

Title: Sekatani Sing Nu Shaak (Drumstick Curry)
Ingredients: Drumsticks (cut into 2-inch pieces) - 4, Oil - 2 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing (Asafoetida) - a pinch, Tomatoes (chopped) - 2, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Jaggery - 1 tbsp, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Water - 1 cup, Fresh Coriander Leaves - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and hing. Let them splutter.
    2. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
    3. Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
    4. Add the drumstick pieces and sauté for 2 minutes.
    5. Pour 1 cup of water, cover, and cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes until the drumsticks are tender.
    6. Add tamarind pulp and jaggery, then mix well.
    7. Simmer for another 5 minutes to blend the flavors.
    8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with roti or rice.

Title: Sev Usal (Maharashtrian Style)
Ingredients: Dried White Peas - 1 cup, Onion (chopped) - 1, Tomato (chopped) - 1, Garlic Cloves - 4, Ginger - 1/2 inch, Green Chilies - 2, Oil - 2 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing (Asafoetida) - a pinch, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Goda Masala - 1 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 2 cups, Fresh Coriander Leaves - for garnish, Lemon Wedges - for serving, Farsan (Sev) - 1 cup, Pav (Indian Bread Rolls) - 4
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak white peas overnight. Drain and pressure cook for 3 whistles until soft.
    2. Grind ginger, garlic, and green chilies into a paste.
    3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and hing. Let them splutter.
    4. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
    5. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
    6. Add the ginger-garlic-chili paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, goda masala, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
    7. Add the boiled peas along with water and let the curry simmer for 10 minutes.
    8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
    9. Serve hot by topping the usal with sev and pairing it with pav and lemon wedges.

Title: Malvani Fish Curry (Maharashtrian Style)
Ingredients: Pomfret/King Fish - 500g (cleaned and sliced), Coconut (grated) - 1/2 cup, Onion (chopped) - 1 large, Tomato (chopped) - 1, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Green Chilies - 2, Malvani Masala - 2 tbsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Kokum - 2 pieces, Salt - to taste, Oil - 2 tbsp, Water - 2 cups, Fresh Coriander Leaves - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Marinate fish with salt and turmeric powder. Set aside for 10 minutes.
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
    3. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, then sauté for a minute.
    4. Stir in chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
    5. Add Malvani masala, red chili powder, coriander powder, and mix well.
    6. Grind grated coconut with some water into a fine paste and add it to the curry.
    7. Pour water, add kokum and tamarind pulp, then let the curry simmer for 5 minutes.
    8. Gently add the fish pieces and cook for another 5-7 minutes until the fish is done.
    9. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or bhakri.

Title: Kombdi Rassa (Maharashtrian Chicken Curry)
Ingredients: Chicken (bone-in) - 500g, Onion (chopped) - 2, Tomato (chopped) - 1, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Green Chilies - 2, Oil - 3 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing (Asafoetida) - a pinch, Malvani Masala - 2 tbsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 2 cups, Fresh Coriander Leaves - for garnish, Coconut (grated) - 1/2 cup, Poppy Seeds - 1 tbsp, Cashews - 6-8
Instructions:
1. Marinate chicken with salt, turmeric powder, and 1 tbsp Malvani masala. Set aside for 30 minutes.
    2. Dry roast poppy seeds, cashews, and coconut. Grind them into a fine paste.
    3. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and hing. Let them splutter.
    4. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
    5. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, then cook for a minute.
    6. Add chopped tomatoes and cook until soft.
    7. Add Malvani masala, red chili powder, coriander powder, and mix well.
    8. Add marinated chicken and sauté for 5 minutes.
    9. Pour water, cover, and cook for 20-25 minutes until the chicken is tender.
    10. Add the coconut-poppy seed paste and simmer for another 5 minutes.
    11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with bhakri or steamed rice.

Title: Classic Onion Uttapam
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Onion (finely chopped) - 1/2 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Fresh Coriander Leaves (chopped) - 2 tbsp, Oil - 2 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Water - as needed
Instructions:
1. Heat a tawa (griddle) on medium flame and lightly grease it with oil.
    2. Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it gently into a thick pancake shape.
    3. Sprinkle chopped onions, green chilies, and coriander leaves evenly on top.
    4. Drizzle some oil around the edges and let it cook for 2-3 minutes until golden brown.
    5. Flip carefully and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
    6. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

Title: Mixed Vegetable Uttapam
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Onion (finely chopped) - 1/4 cup, Tomato (finely chopped) - 1/4 cup, Carrot (grated) - 1/4 cup, Capsicum (finely chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Fresh Coriander Leaves (chopped) - 2 tbsp, Oil - 2 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Water - as needed
Instructions:
1. Heat a tawa (griddle) on medium flame and grease with oil.
    2. Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread into a thick circle.
    3. Evenly sprinkle onions, tomatoes, carrots, capsicum, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
    4. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook for 3 minutes until golden brown.
    5. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
    6. Serve hot with coconut chutney or tomato chutney.

Title: Cheese Uttapam
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Onion (finely chopped) - 1/4 cup, Tomato (finely chopped) - 1/4 cup, Capsicum (finely chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Fresh Coriander Leaves (chopped) - 2 tbsp, Grated Cheese (cheddar or mozzarella) - 1/2 cup, Oil - 2 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Water - as needed
Instructions:
1. Heat a tawa (griddle) on medium flame and grease with oil.
    2. Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it into a thick round shape.
    3. Sprinkle onions, tomatoes, capsicum, green chilies, and coriander leaves.
    4. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook for 2 minutes.
    5. Sprinkle grated cheese generously on top and let it melt.
    6. Flip carefully and cook for another minute.
    7. Serve hot with tomato ketchup or green chutney.

Title: Rava Uttapam (Instant Semolina Uttapam)
Ingredients: Semolina (Rava/Sooji) - 1 cup, Curd - 1/2 cup, Water - as needed, Baking Soda - 1/2 tsp, Onion (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Tomato (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Capsicum (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Fresh Coriander - 2 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Mix semolina, curd, and water to make a smooth batter. Let it rest for 10 minutes.
    2. Add salt and baking soda, mix well.
    3. Heat a tawa and spread a ladleful of batter into a thick pancake shape.
    4. Sprinkle onions, tomatoes, capsicum, green chilies, and coriander on top.
    5. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook until golden brown.
    6. Flip and cook for another 1-2 minutes.
    7. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

Title: Masala Uttapam (Spicy Potato Uttapam)
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Potato (boiled & mashed) - 1, Onion (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 5-6, Fresh Coriander - 2 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves.
    2. Add chopped onions, green chilies, and turmeric powder.
    3. Mix in the boiled mashed potatoes and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
    4. Heat a tawa, pour a ladleful of dosa batter, and spread it into a thick circle.
    5. Place the prepared potato masala evenly over the batter.
    6. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook for 3 minutes.
    7. Flip carefully and cook for another 2 minutes.
    8. Serve hot with chutney or sambar.

Title: Paneer Uttapam (High-Protein)
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Paneer (crumbled) - 1/2 cup, Onion (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Capsicum (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Fresh Coriander - 2 tbsp, Oil - 2 tbsp, Salt - as needed
Instructions:
1. Heat a tawa and grease it with oil.
    2. Pour a ladleful of dosa batter and spread it into a thick round.
    3. Sprinkle crumbled paneer, onions, capsicum, green chilies, and coriander on top.
    4. Drizzle oil around the edges and cook for 2-3 minutes until golden brown.
    5. Flip carefully and cook for another minute.
    6. Serve hot with green chutney or coconut chutney.

Title: Egg Uttapam
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Eggs - 2, Onion (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Beat the eggs with salt and black pepper.
    2. Heat a tawa and pour a ladleful of dosa batter.
    3. Spread it slightly thick and pour the beaten egg mixture over it.
    4. Sprinkle chopped onions and green chilies.
    5. Drizzle oil and cook for 3 minutes until the egg sets.
    6. Flip carefully and cook for another 2 minutes.
    7. Serve hot with chutney.

Title: Chicken Keema Uttapam
Ingredients: Dosa Batter - 2 cups, Chicken Keema (minced) - 1/2 cup, Onion (chopped) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies (chopped) - 1, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Fresh Coriander - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Cook chicken keema with garam masala and salt until done.
    2. Heat a tawa and pour a ladleful of dosa batter.
    3. Spread it thick and top with cooked chicken keema, onions, and green chilies.
    4. Drizzle oil and cook until golden brown.
    5. Flip carefully and cook for another 2 minutes.
    6. Serve hot with chutney.

Title: Gujarati Chakli (Murukku)
Ingredients: Rice Flour - 2 cups, Besan (Gram Flour) - 1/2 cup, Sesame Seeds - 1 tbsp, Carom Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Salt - as needed, Butter - 2 tbsp, Water - as needed, Oil - for deep frying
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, add rice flour, besan, sesame seeds, carom seeds, red chili powder, turmeric, hing, and salt.
    2. Add melted butter and mix well.
    3. Slowly add water and knead a soft dough.
    4. Fill the dough into a chakli press.
    5. Heat oil in a pan, and pipe chaklis in circular shapes directly into the oil.
    6. Fry until golden brown and crispy.
    7. Drain on a paper towel and store in an airtight container.

Title: Gujarati Poha Chevdo (Spicy Mixture)
Ingredients: Thin Poha (Flattened Rice) - 2 cups, Peanuts - 1/2 cup, Cashews - 1/4 cup, Curry Leaves - 10-12, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Salt - as needed, Sugar - 1 tsp, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, peanuts, and cashews.
    2. Add turmeric, red chili powder, hing, and mix well.
    3. Add thin poha and stir continuously on low flame.
    4. Add salt and sugar, mix well, and roast for 5-7 minutes until crisp.
    5. Let it cool and store in an airtight container.

Title: Methi Gathiya(Gujarati Style)
Ingredients: Besan (Gram Flour) - 2 cups, Methi (Fenugreek) Leaves (finely chopped) - 1/2 cup, Carom Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Water - as needed, Oil - for deep frying
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix besan, methi leaves, carom seeds, hing, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt.
    2. Add 2 tbsp oil and mix well.
    3. Slowly add water to make a soft dough.
    4. Fill the dough into a gathiya press or sev maker.
    5. Heat oil and press the dough directly into the oil.
    6. Fry until crispy and golden brown.
    7. Drain excess oil and store in an airtight container.

Title: Nylon Sev(Gujarati Style)
Ingredients: Besan (Gram Flour) - 2 cups, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Water - as needed, Oil - for deep frying
Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix besan, turmeric, salt, and hing.
    2. Add water gradually to form a smooth, thick batter.
    3. Fill the batter into a sev press.
    4. Heat oil in a deep pan and press the sev directly into the hot oil.
    5. Fry until crisp and golden brown.
    6. Drain excess oil and store in an airtight container.

Title: Cornflakes Chevdo
Ingredients: Cornflakes - 2 cups, Peanuts - 1/2 cup, Almonds - 1/4 cup, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Green Chilies (chopped) - 2, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Sugar - 1 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, and hing.
    2. Add peanuts and almonds, fry until golden.
    3. Add cornflakes and toss well.
    4. Sprinkle salt and sugar, mix well.
    5. Let it cool and store in an airtight container.

Title: Sabudana Chakli (Gujarati Style)
Ingredients: Sabudana (Sago) - 1 cup, Rice Flour - 2 cups, Green Chilies (chopped) - 2, Sesame Seeds - 1 tbsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Salt - as needed, Water - as needed, Oil - for frying
Instructions:
1. Soak sabudana in water for 4-5 hours, then drain and grind into a coarse paste.
    2. Mix sabudana paste with rice flour, green chilies, sesame seeds, cumin seeds, hing, and salt.
    3. Knead into a soft dough using water.
    4. Fill the dough into a chakli press and shape spirals on a greased plate.
    5. Heat oil and fry until golden brown.
    6. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Title: Batka ni Wafers (Gujarati Style Potato Wafers)
Ingredients: Potatoes (large) - 3, Salt - as needed, Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 tsp, Oil - for frying
Instructions:
1. Peel and slice the potatoes thinly using a mandoline slicer.
    2. Soak the slices in salted water for 15 minutes.
    3. Drain and pat dry the slices completely.
    4. Heat oil in a kadai and fry the slices on medium flame until crispy and golden.
    5. Drain excess oil and sprinkle black pepper powder.
    6. Store in an airtight container after cooling.

Title: Sabudana Wafers (Gujarati Style)
Ingredients: Sabudana (Sago) - 1 cup, Water - 3 cups, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Green Chilies (paste) - 1 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - for frying
Instructions:
1. Soak sabudana overnight in water.
    2. Boil water in a pan, add soaked sabudana, cumin seeds, green chili paste, and salt.
    3. Stir continuously until the mixture thickens.
    4. Spread the mixture on a greased plastic sheet into thin round wafers.
    5. Dry under sunlight for 1-2 days.
    6. Store the dried wafers and deep-fry as needed.

Title: Gujarati Tamatar Shorba (Tomato Soup)
Ingredients: Tomatoes - 5 (chopped), Jaggery - 1 tbsp, Ginger - 1 inch (grated), Black Pepper - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Salt - as needed, Butter - 1 tbsp, Water - 2 cups, Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger for a few seconds.
    2. Add chopped tomatoes, salt, jaggery, and cumin powder.
    3. Cook until tomatoes soften, then blend into a smooth puree.
    4. Strain the puree, return to heat, and simmer for 5 minutes.
    5. Add black pepper and serve hot with coriander garnish.

Title: Moong Dal Soup-Gujarati Style
Ingredients: Yellow Moong Dal - 1/2 cup, Ginger - 1 inch, Green Chili - 1, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Ghee - 1 tbsp, Cumin Seeds - 1 tsp, Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Wash moong dal and pressure cook with turmeric, ginger, and green chili.
    2. Blend the cooked dal into a smooth puree.
    3. Heat ghee, add cumin seeds, and sauté for a few seconds.
    4. Pour the dal puree into the pan, add salt and black pepper.
    5. Simmer for 5 minutes, then add lemon juice.
    6. Garnish with coriander and serve warm.

Title: Palak Soup (Spinach Soup)
Ingredients: Spinach Leaves - 2 cups, Onion - 1 (chopped), Garlic - 2 cloves, Black Pepper - 1 tsp, Milk - 1/2 cup, Butter - 1 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Water - 2 cups
Instructions:
1. Heat butter and sauté onions and garlic until soft.
    2. Add washed spinach leaves and cook for 2 minutes.
    3. Blend the mixture into a smooth puree.
    4. Return to heat, add salt, black pepper, and milk.
    5. Simmer for 5 minutes and serve warm.

Title: Sweet Corn Soup(Indo-Chinese Style)
Ingredients: Sweet Corn Kernels - 1 cup, Carrot - 1/2 cup (chopped), Cornflour - 1 tbsp, Water - 2 cups, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Butter - 1 tbsp, Spring Onion - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat butter in a pan and sauté carrots for a minute.
    2. Add sweet corn and water, then simmer for 5 minutes.
    3. Blend half of the mixture and return it to the pan.
    4. Mix cornflour with water and add to the soup.
    5. Season with salt and black pepper.
    6. Garnish with spring onions and serve warm.

Title: Manchow Soup-(Indo-Chinese Style)
Ingredients: Cabbage - 1/2 cup (shredded), Carrot - 1/2 cup (chopped), Capsicum - 1/4 cup (chopped), Garlic - 3 cloves, Ginger - 1 inch, Soy Sauce - 1 tbsp, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Cornflour - 1 tbsp, Water - 2 cups, Crispy Noodles - 1/2 cup
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, sauté garlic and ginger until fragrant.
    2. Add cabbage, carrot, and capsicum. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.
    3. Add soy sauce, salt, black pepper, and water. Bring to a boil.
    4. Mix cornflour with water and add to the soup.
    5. Simmer until slightly thick, then serve with crispy noodles on top.

Title: Dal Shorba(Lentil Soup) – North Indian style
Ingredients: Yellow Moong Dal - 1/2 cup, Water - 3 cups, Ginger - 1 inch (grated), Garlic - 2 cloves, Cumin Seeds - 1 tsp, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak dal for 15 minutes.  
    2. In a pan, heat oil, add cumin seeds, garlic, and ginger.  
    3. Add dal, turmeric, salt, and water. Pressure cook for 2 whistles.  
    4. Blend into a smooth soup and simmer for 5 minutes.  
    5. Stir in lemon juice and garnish with fresh coriander before serving.

Title: Tomato Saar(Maharashtrian Tomato Soup)
Ingredients: Tomatoes - 4 (chopped), Water - 2 cups, Coconut - 2 tbsp (grated), Jaggery - 1 tsp, Green Chilies - 2 (slit), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 5, Salt - as needed
Instructions:
1. Boil tomatoes with water until soft. Blend into a smooth puree.  
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.  
    3. Pour in tomato puree, add salt and jaggery, and simmer for 5 minutes.  
    4. Stir in grated coconut and serve warm.

Title: Palak Shorba-Punjabi Style
Ingredients: Spinach - 2 cups, Garlic - 2 cloves, Ginger - 1 inch, Black Pepper - 1 tsp, Butter - 1 tbsp, Milk - 1/2 cup, Salt - as needed, Water - 2 cups
Instructions:
1. Blanch spinach in boiling water for 2 minutes and drain.  
    2. Blend spinach with ginger, garlic, and black pepper.  
    3. Heat butter in a pan, add spinach puree and cook for 5 minutes.  
    4. Add milk and simmer for another 2 minutes before serving.

Title: Chicken Rasam-South Indian STyle
Ingredients: Chicken - 200g (bone-in), Tamarind Pulp - 2 tbsp, Water - 3 cups, Black Pepper - 1 tsp, Curry Leaves - 5, Garlic - 2 cloves, Coriander Leaves - for garnish, Salt - as needed
Instructions:
1. Boil chicken in water until cooked. Remove and shred the meat.  
    2. In a pan, heat oil, add garlic, black pepper, and curry leaves.  
    3. Pour in tamarind pulp and chicken broth, then simmer for 10 minutes.  
    4. Add shredded chicken, stir, and garnish with coriander.

Title: Goan Prawn Curry Soup-Goan Style
Ingredients: Prawns - 200g, Coconut Milk - 1 cup, Tamarind - 1 tbsp, Water - 2 cups, Onion - 1 (chopped), Garlic - 2 cloves, Green Chili - 1, Curry Leaves - 5, Salt - as needed
Instructions:
1. Clean and devein prawns.  
    2. Heat oil, add onions, garlic, and curry leaves.  
    3. Add prawns, tamarind, and water, then simmer for 10 minutes.  
    4. Stir in coconut milk and cook for 5 more minutes.  
    5. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Title: Afghani Soya Chaap (Creamy And Mild)
Ingredients: Soya Chaap Sticks - 6, Hung Curd - 1/2 cup, Fresh Cream - 1/4 cup, Cashew Paste - 2 tbsp, Green Chili - 2 (chopped), Ginger Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Butter - 1 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Cut soya chaap into pieces and marinate with curd, cream, cashew paste, green chili, ginger garlic paste, pepper, and salt.  
    2. Let it rest for 1-2 hours.  
    3. Heat butter in a pan and grill the chaap until golden brown.  
    4. Serve hot with mint chutney.

Title: Tandoori Soya Chaap(Spicy and Smoke)
Ingredients: Soya Chaap Sticks - 6, Hung Curd - 1/2 cup, Mustard Oil - 2 tbsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Ginger Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Butter - 1 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Cut soya chaap into pieces and marinate with curd, mustard oil, red chili powder, garam masala, ginger garlic paste, lemon juice, and salt.  
    2. Let it rest for 1 hour.  
    3. Grill or bake in an oven at 200°C for 15-20 minutes.  
    4. Brush with butter and serve with chutney.

Title: Mutton Chaap (Mughlai Style)
Ingredients: Mutton Ribs (Chaap) - 500g, Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Fried Onion Paste - 1/2 cup, Cashew Paste - 2 tbsp, Ginger Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Garam Masala - 1 tsp, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Ghee - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Marinate mutton chaap with yogurt, fried onion paste, cashew paste, ginger garlic paste, garam masala, turmeric, and salt for 4-6 hours.  
    2. Heat ghee in a pan, add marinated mutton and slow cook for 45 minutes on low flame.  
    3. Once tender, serve with paratha or biryani.

Title: Chicken Chaap (Bengali Style)
Ingredients: Chicken Leg Quarters - 4, Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Poppy Seed Paste - 2 tbsp, Cashew Paste - 2 tbsp, Fried Onion Paste - 1/4 cup, Garam Masala - 1 tsp, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Ghee - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, poppy seed paste, cashew paste, fried onion paste, garam masala, turmeric, and salt for 3-4 hours.  
    2. Heat ghee in a pan, add marinated chicken, and slow cook on low flame for 30-40 minutes until tender.  
    3. Serve hot with naan or paratha.

Title: Beda Vali Chaap (Surti Style Mutton Chaap)
Ingredients: Mutton Chaap (Ribs) - 500g, Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Ghee - 2 tbsp, Onion (sliced) - 1 large, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Tomato Puree - 1/2 cup, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Wash and clean the mutton chaap properly.  
    2. In a bowl, marinate the mutton with yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, black pepper, salt, and lemon juice. Let it rest for at least 3 hours (preferably overnight).  
    3. Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan or pressure cooker. Add sliced onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    4. Add green chilies and marinated mutton. Cook on medium heat for 10-15 minutes until the spices coat the mutton well.  
    5. Add tomato puree and cook for another 5 minutes.  
    6. Add water as required and pressure cook for 3-4 whistles until the mutton is soft and tender.  
    7. Open the lid and cook on high flame to thicken the gravy.  
    8. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or tandoori roti.

Title: Surti Locha Boti
Ingredients: Mutton Boti (small pieces) - 500g, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 tsp, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Onion (chopped) - 1, Tomato (pureed) - 1/2 cup, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Clean the mutton boti pieces and marinate with turmeric, red chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.  
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, and sauté until golden brown.  
    3. Add ginger-garlic paste and chopped green chilies; sauté for 2 minutes.  
    4. Add marinated mutton boti and cook for 10-15 minutes.  
    5. Add tomato puree, coriander powder, cumin powder, and black pepper powder. Mix well and cook for another 5 minutes.  
    6. Let it cook on low heat until the mutton is tender and the masala thickens.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or pav.

Title: Surti Keema Pav
Ingredients: Mutton Keema (minced meat) - 500g, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Onion (chopped) - 1 large, Tomato (pureed) - 1/2 cup, Green Chili - 2 (chopped), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Butter - for pav
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    2. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies; sauté for 2 minutes.  
    3. Add minced mutton (keema) and cook on high flame for 5 minutes.  
    4. Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, coriander powder, and cumin powder. Mix well and cook for 15-20 minutes until keema is fully cooked.  
    5. Toast pav with butter on a tawa.  
    6. Garnish keema with fresh coriander and serve hot with buttered pav.

Title: Surti Chicken Angara
Ingredients: Chicken (cut into pieces) - 500g, Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Onion (chopped) - 1 large, Tomato (pureed) - 1/2 cup, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Charcoal - for smoke
Instructions:
1. Marinate chicken with yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt for 2 hours.  
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, and sauté until golden brown.  
    3. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies; sauté for 2 minutes.  
    4. Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.  
    5. Add marinated chicken and cook until tender.  
    6. Heat charcoal, place in a bowl, add ghee, and cover the pot to infuse smoky flavor.  
    7. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Title: Surti Tawa Fry Paplet (Masala Pomfret Fry )
Ingredients: 'Pomfret Fish (cleaned) - 2, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Gram Flour - 1 tbsp (optional), Fresh Coriander - for garnish',
Instructions:
1. Clean the pomfret fish and make deep slits on both sides.  
    2. Mix ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.  
    3. Apply the masala evenly on the fish, making sure it enters the slits.  
    4. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes.  
    5. Heat oil in a tawa and fry the fish on medium heat for 4-5 minutes per side until golden and crispy.  
    6. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with lemon slices.

Title: Surti Kolmi No Patio (Spicy Prawn Curry)
Ingredients: Prawns (cleaned and deveined) - 500g, Onion (chopped) - 1 large, Tomato (pureed) - 1/2 cup, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Vinegar - 1 tsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Clean the prawns and pat dry.  
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add chopped onions, and sauté until golden brown.  
    3. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies; sauté for 2 minutes.  
    4. Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder.  
    5. Cook until the masala thickens.  
    6. Add prawns and mix well. Cook for 5-7 minutes until prawns turn pink.  
    7. Add vinegar and mix well. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

Title: Surti Surmai Fry
Ingredients: Surmai (Kingfish) Steaks - 4, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Gram Flour - 1 tbsp (optional)
Instructions:
1. Clean and pat dry the surmai fish steaks.  
    2. Mix ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt.  
    3. Coat the fish steaks evenly with the masala and let them marinate for 30 minutes.  
    4. Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish on medium heat for 4-5 minutes per side until golden and crispy.  
    5. Garnish with lemon slices and serve hot.

Title: Surti Bangda Masala(Mackerel Curry)
Ingredients: Mackerel Fish - 2 (cleaned), Onion (chopped) - 1 large, Tomato (pureed) - 1/2 cup, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Coconut (grated) - 1/4 cup, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - as needed, Oil - 2 tbsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Clean the mackerel fish and make deep slits.  
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add onions, and sauté until golden brown.  
    3. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and grated coconut; sauté for 2 minutes.  
    4. Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder.  
    5. Cook until the masala thickens.  
    6. Add mackerel fish, coat with masala, and cook for 10 minutes until tender.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

Title: Safed Maas (White Maas)
Ingredients: Mutton - 500g (bone-in), Yogurt - 1 cup, Fresh Cream - 1/2 cup, Cashew Paste - 2 tbsp, Poppy Seeds Paste - 1 tbsp, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Green Chilies - 3 (slit), Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 tsp, Cardamom Powder - 1/2 tsp, Cloves - 3, Cinnamon Stick - 1 inch, Bay Leaf - 1, Onion Paste - 1/2 cup, Ghee - 3 tbsp, Salt - as needed, Water - 1 cup, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan and add bay leaf, cloves, cinnamon, and cardamom.  
    2. Add onion paste and sauté until it turns light golden.  
    3. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1-2 minutes.  
    4. Add mutton pieces and sear on high heat for 4-5 minutes.  
    5. Lower the heat and add yogurt, cashew paste, poppy seeds paste, and fresh cream.  
    6. Stir well and let it cook on low flame for 30-40 minutes, adding water as needed.  
    7. Add green chilies, black pepper powder, and salt.  
    8. Cook until the mutton becomes tender and the gravy turns rich and creamy.  
    9. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot.

Title: Suran Samosa
Ingredients:
For Filling: Suran (Elephant Foot Yam) - 1 cup (boiled & mashed), Green Chilies - 2 (finely chopped), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Cumin Powder - 1 tsp, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tsp, Sugar - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Fresh Coriander - 2 tbsp (chopped), Oil - 1 tbsp  
     For Samosa Dough: All-Purpose Flour - 1 cup, Oil - 2 tbsp, Ajwain (Carom Seeds) - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - as needed
Instructions:
1. In a pan, heat 1 tbsp oil and sauté green chilies and ginger.  
    2. Add mashed suran, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric, red chili powder, sugar, and salt.  
    3. Stir well, cook for 5 minutes, and add lemon juice and fresh coriander. Let it cool.  
    4. For dough, mix flour, ajwain, salt, and 2 tbsp oil. Knead with water to form a stiff dough.  
    5. Divide dough into small balls, roll into thin discs, and cut in half.  
    6. Fold into a cone, fill with suran mixture, and seal edges with water.  
    7. Heat oil and deep fry samosas until golden brown.  
    8. Serve hot with green chutney and tamarind chutney.

Title: Surti Tapelu
Ingredients: Mutton (bone-in) - 500g, Ghee/Oil - 4 tbsp, Onions - 3 large (sliced), Tomatoes - 2 large (pureed), Green Chilies - 4 (slit), Ginger-Garlic Paste - 2 tbsp, Whole Spices (Cloves - 4, Black Cardamom - 1, Green Cardamom - 2, Cinnamon Stick - 1-inch, Bay Leaf - 1, Star Anise - 1), Cumin Seeds - 1 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tbsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1.5 tsp, Garam Masala - 1 tsp, Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Water - 2 cups, Salt - to taste, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee/oil in a tapelu or heavy-bottomed pot.  
    2. Add whole spices and cumin seeds, sauté until fragrant.  
    3. Add sliced onions and cook until golden brown.  
    4. Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, sauté for 2 minutes.  
    5. Add mutton pieces and sear on high heat for 5-7 minutes.  
    6. Lower heat, add yogurt, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt.  
    7. Cover and slow cook for 45-50 minutes until the mutton is tender.  
    8. Add pureed tomatoes and garam masala, simmer for another 10 minutes.  
    9. Adjust consistency with water, garnish with fresh coriander, and serve hot.

Title: Surti Crab Soup (Khekda Nu Ras)
Ingredients: Fresh Crabs - 500g (cleaned and cracked), Onion - 2 (finely chopped), Tomatoes - 2 (pureed), Ginger-Garlic Paste - 2 tbsp, Green Chilies - 3 (slit), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Black Pepper Powder - 1/2 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Fresh Coconut - 1/2 cup (grated), Coconut Milk - 1/2 cup, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Water - 3 cups, Salt - to taste, Jaggery - 1/2 tsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Ghee/Oil - 3 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee/oil in a deep pot, add cumin seeds and curry leaves, sauté until fragrant.  
    2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    3. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes.  
    4. Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.  
    5. Stir in fresh grated coconut and cook for 2 minutes.  
    6. Add crabs and mix well, letting them absorb the masalas for 5 minutes.  
    7. Pour in water, cover, and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes.  
    8. Add coconut milk, black pepper powder, tamarind pulp, and jaggery. Simmer for 5 more minutes.  
    9. Stir in garam masala, garnish with fresh coriander, and serve hot with bhakri or steamed rice.

Title: Surti Daal Valu Mutton
Ingredients: Mutton - 500g (bone-in), Toor Dal (Split Pigeon Peas) - 1 cup, Chana Dal - 1/2 cup, Onion - 2 (finely chopped), Tomatoes - 2 (pureed), Ginger-Garlic Paste - 2 tbsp, Green Chilies - 3 (slit), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1.5 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1 tsp, Mustard Seeds - 1 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Jaggery - 1 tsp, Water - 4 cups, Salt - to taste, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Ghee/Oil - 3 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak toor dal and chana dal for 30 minutes.  
    2. In a pressure cooker, heat ghee/oil and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.  
    3. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    4. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes.  
    5. Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.  
    6. Add mutton pieces and sear for 5 minutes.  
    7. Add soaked dal, mix well, and pour in 4 cups of water.  
    8. Pressure cook for 4-5 whistles or until mutton is tender.
