    9. Open the lid, add tamarind pulp, jaggery, and garam masala. Simmer for 5 minutes.  
    10. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with jeera rice or bhakri.

Title: Surti Papdi Ma Mutton (Mutton with Surti Papdi Beans)
Ingredients: Mutton - 500g (bone-in), Surti Papdi (Flat Beans) - 2 cups, Onion - 2 (finely chopped), Tomatoes - 2 (pureed), Ginger-Garlic Paste - 2 tbsp, Green Chilies - 3 (slit), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1.5 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1 tsp, Mustard Seeds - 1 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Jaggery - 1 tsp, Water - 3 cups, Salt - to taste, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Ghee/Oil - 3 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Wash and clean mutton pieces. Trim the ends of Surti papdi beans and chop into halves.  
    2. Heat ghee/oil in a pressure cooker, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves.  
    3. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    4. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 2 minutes.  
    5. Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.  
    6. Add mutton pieces and sear for 5 minutes.  
    7. Add Surti papdi, mix well, and pour in 3 cups of water.  
    8. Pressure cook for 4-5 whistles or until mutton is tender.  
    9. Open the lid, add tamarind pulp, jaggery, and garam masala. Simmer for 5 minutes.  
    10. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with bajra roti or rice.

Title: Surti Sev Bataka Nu Shaak
Ingredients: Potatoes - 3 (boiled & cubed), Sev - 1 cup, Tomatoes - 2 (finely chopped), Green Chilies - 2 (slit), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Sugar - 1 tsp, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 1.5 cups, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Let them crackle.  
    2. Add green chilies and ginger, sauté for a few seconds.  
    3. Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes turn soft.  
    4. Stir in boiled potatoes, sugar, tamarind pulp, and 1.5 cups of water. Simmer for 5 minutes.  
    5. Add garam masala and mix well.  
    6. Just before serving, top with sev and garnish with fresh coriander.  
    7. Serve hot with puris or rotis.

Title: Surti Kaju Karela Nu Shaak
Ingredients: Bitter Gourd (Karela) - 3 (sliced), Cashews - 1/2 cup (soaked), Onion - 1 (finely chopped), Tomatoes - 2 (pureed), Green Chilies - 2 (slit), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Jaggery - 2 tbsp, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 2 cups, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Oil - 3 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Sprinkle salt over bitter gourd slices and let them sit for 15 minutes to reduce bitterness. Rinse well.  
    2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them crackle.  
    3. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    4. Stir in ginger, green chilies, pureed tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.  
    5. Add bitter gourd slices and soaked cashews, mix well.  
    6. Pour in 2 cups of water, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until karela is tender.  
    7. Add jaggery, tamarind pulp, and garam masala. Cook for another 5 minutes.  
    8. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rotis or bajra rotla.

Title: Surti Kaju Masala
Ingredients: Cashews (Kaju) - 1 cup (soaked for 30 mins), Onion - 1 large (finely chopped), Tomatoes - 2 (pureed), Green Chilies - 2 (slit), Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Kasuri Methi - 1 tbsp (crushed), Fresh Cream - 2 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 1.5 cups, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Oil - 3 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Let them splutter.  
    2. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.  
    3. Stir in ginger-garlic paste and green chilies. Cook for a minute.  
    4. Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.  
    5. Add soaked cashews and mix well. Pour in 1.5 cups of water. Cover and simmer for 10-12 minutes.  
    6. Add garam masala, kasuri methi, and fresh cream. Stir well and cook for 2 more minutes.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan, roti, or jeera rice.

Title: Surti Gathiya Nu Shaak
Ingredients: Gathiya (thick variety) - 1 cup, Tomatoes - 2 (pureed), Green Chilies - 2 (slit), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Sugar - 1 tsp, Tamarind Pulp - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 2 cups, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Let them splutter.  
    2. Add slit green chilies and grated ginger. Sauté for a few seconds.  
    3. Stir in pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.  
    4. Pour in 2 cups of water and bring to a boil.  
    5. Add garam masala, sugar, and tamarind pulp. Stir well.  
    6. Add gathiya just before serving and mix gently to avoid breaking them.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti, puri, or thepla.

Title: Surti Gilora/Tindora Bataka Nu Shaak(Ivy Gourd & Potato Curry)
Ingredients: Gilora (Ivy Gourd) - 200g (sliced), Potatoes - 2 (cubed), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Jaggery - 1 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 1/2 cup, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan and add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Let them splutter.  
    2. Add chopped green chilies and grated ginger. Sauté for a few seconds.  
    3. Add sliced gilora and cubed potatoes. Mix well.  
    4. Stir in turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix everything and cook for 2-3 minutes.  
    5. Pour in 1/2 cup of water, cover, and let it cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes until the vegetables are tender.  
    6. Add garam masala, jaggery, and lemon juice. Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti, puri, or bhakri.

Title: Surti Kanda Batata Nu Shaak
Ingredients: Potatoes - 3 (cubed), Onions - 2 large (sliced), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Jaggery - 1 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Water - 1/4 cup, Fresh Coriander - for garnish, Oil - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.  
    2. Add curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a few seconds.  
    3. Add sliced onions and cook until they turn soft and slightly golden.  
    4. Add cubed potatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well.  
    5. Pour in 1/4 cup of water, cover, and let it cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes until potatoes are tender.  
    6. Add garam masala, jaggery, and lemon juice. Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti, puri, or dal-rice.

Title: Surti Bhinda Bataka Nu Shaak
Ingredients: Okra (Bhindi) - 200g (chopped), Potatoes - 2 (cubed), Mustard Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Cumin Seeds - 1/2 tsp, Curry Leaves - 8-10, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Ginger - 1 tsp (grated), Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Coriander Powder - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Asafoetida (Hing) - 1/4 tsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Salt - to taste, Oil - 3 tbsp, Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and hing. Let them splutter.  
    2. Add curry leaves, chopped green chilies, and grated ginger. Sauté for a few seconds.  
    3. Add cubed potatoes, turmeric powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well and cook covered for 5-7 minutes.  
    4. Add chopped bhindi and stir well. Cook uncovered on medium heat to avoid stickiness.  
    5. Stir occasionally until bhindi and potatoes are cooked and slightly crispy (about 10 minutes).  
    6. Add garam masala and lemon juice. Mix well and cook for another 2 minutes.  
    7. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with roti, puri, or dal-rice.

Title: Cheese Angoori
Ingredients: Paneer (Cottage Cheese) - 250g (grated), Cornflour - 2 tbsp, Salt - 1/2 tsp, Cardamom Powder - 1/4 tsp, Cashew Nuts - 10 (soaked), Almonds - 8 (soaked and peeled), Onion - 1 large (chopped), Tomato - 2 (pureed), Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tsp, Green Chilies - 2 (chopped), Fresh Cream - 3 tbsp, Milk - 1/2 cup, Butter - 2 tbsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Turmeric Powder - 1/2 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Sugar - 1 tsp, Saffron - a pinch (soaked in warm milk), Fresh Coriander - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Mix grated paneer, cornflour, salt, and cardamom powder. Knead into a soft dough and make small round balls (angoori).  
    2. Deep-fry or shallow-fry the balls until golden brown and keep aside.  
    3. Blend soaked cashews and almonds into a smooth paste.  
    4. Heat butter in a pan, sauté chopped onions until golden brown, then add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies.  
    5. Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until the oil separates.  
    6. Add cashew-almond paste, sugar, and garam masala. Cook for 2 minutes.  
    7. Pour in milk and saffron, stirring continuously. Simmer for 3-4 minutes.  
    8. Add fresh cream and mix well.  
    9. Finally, add the fried cheese balls and cook for another 2 minutes on low heat.  
    10. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan, roti, or jeera rice.

Title: Paneer Sizzler
Ingredients: Paneer (Cottage Cheese) - 200g (cut into cubes), Mixed Vegetables (Carrot, Beans, Bell Peppers) - 1 cup, Boiled Potatoes - 1 (sliced), Butter - 2 tbsp, Oil - 2 tbsp, Soy Sauce - 1 tbsp, Vinegar - 1 tsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Garlic - 1 tbsp (chopped), Tomato Ketchup - 2 tbsp, Cornflour - 1 tbsp (for sauce), Salt - to taste, Cabbage Leaves - for serving
Instructions:
1. Prepare the Marinade: Mix soy sauce, vinegar, red chili powder, black pepper, salt, and 1 tbsp oil. Coat paneer cubes and let it marinate for 15 minutes.  
    2. Sauté Vegetables: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add chopped garlic, sauté for a minute, then add mixed vegetables and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes. Keep aside.  
    3. Grill Paneer: Heat butter in a pan and grill marinated paneer until golden brown. Keep aside.  
    4. Prepare Sauce: In the same pan, add tomato ketchup, soy sauce, and cornflour mixed with water. Cook until thickened.  
    5. Assemble Sizzler:  
       - Heat a sizzling plate, grease with butter, and place cabbage leaves.  
       - Arrange grilled paneer, sautéed veggies, and boiled potatoes.  
       - Drizzle prepared sauce over everything.  
       - Add a cube of butter on top and serve hot with smoky effects!

Title: Chinese Sizzler (Noodles & Manchurian)
Ingredients:
For Noodles: Boiled Noodles - 2 cups, Capsicum - 1 (sliced), Carrot - 1 (julienned), Cabbage - 1/2 cup (shredded), Spring Onion - 1/4 cup, Garlic - 1 tbsp (chopped), Soy Sauce - 1 tbsp, Chili Sauce - 1 tsp, Vinegar - 1 tsp, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Oil - 2 tbsp.  
    For Manchurian: Grated Cabbage - 1 cup, Grated Carrot - 1/2 cup, All-purpose Flour - 2 tbsp, Cornflour - 2 tbsp, Soy Sauce - 1 tbsp, Salt - 1/2 tsp, Black Pepper - 1/2 tsp, Oil for frying.  
    For Sauce: Tomato Ketchup - 2 tbsp, Soy Sauce - 1 tbsp, Red Chili Sauce - 1 tsp, Vinegar - 1 tsp, Cornflour - 1 tbsp (dissolved in water), Salt - to taste.
Instructions:
1. Make Manchurian Balls: Mix cabbage, carrot, flour, cornflour, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Shape into small balls and deep-fry until golden brown.  
    2. Prepare Sauce: Heat oil, sauté garlic, add ketchup, soy sauce, chili sauce, vinegar, and cornflour mixture. Cook until thick. Add fried Manchurian balls and coat well.  
    3. Make Noodles: Heat oil, sauté garlic, add capsicum, carrot, and cabbage. Stir-fry for 2 mins. Add noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper, and mix well.  
    4. Assemble Sizzler: Heat a sizzling plate, grease with butter. Place a cabbage leaf. Arrange noodles and place Manchurian balls on top. Drizzle sauce over. Serve hot!

Title: Tandoori Veg Sizzler
Ingredients:
For Marinade: Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Ginger-Garlic Paste - 1 tbsp, Red Chili Powder - 1 tsp, Garam Masala - 1/2 tsp, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Mustard Oil - 1 tbsp.  
    For Veggies: Paneer - 200g (cubes), Bell Peppers - 1 cup (cubed), Onion - 1 (cubed), Cauliflower - 1/2 cup (florets), Baby Potatoes - 4 (boiled & peeled).  
    For Sizzler: Butter - 2 tbsp, Cabbage Leaves - for serving.
Instructions:
1. Marinate Veggies: Mix yogurt, spices, lemon juice, and mustard oil. Add paneer and vegetables. Marinate for 30 mins.  
    2. Grill Veggies: Heat a grill pan, brush with oil, and grill marinated vegetables until charred. Keep aside.  
    3. Assemble Sizzler: Heat a sizzling plate, grease with butter, place a cabbage leaf. Arrange grilled veggies and paneer. Drizzle melted butter and serve hot.

Title: Mexican Sizzler (Beans, Salsa & Rice)
Ingredients:
For Mexican Rice: Cooked Rice - 1 cup, Tomato Puree - 1/2 cup, Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Paprika - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Oil - 1 tbsp.  
    For Beans: Boiled Kidney Beans - 1 cup, Onion - 1 (chopped), Garlic - 1 tbsp (chopped), Cumin Powder - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Tomato Paste - 2 tbsp.  
    For Salsa: Tomato - 1 (chopped), Onion - 1/2 (chopped), Coriander - 1 tbsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Jalapeno - 1 (chopped).  
    For Sizzler: Butter - 2 tbsp, Cabbage Leaves - for serving.
Instructions:
1. Make Mexican Rice: Heat oil, sauté tomato puree, cumin, and paprika. Add cooked rice, salt, and mix well. Keep aside.  
    2. Prepare Beans: Heat oil, sauté onion and garlic. Add tomato paste, cumin powder, salt, and boiled beans. Cook for 5 minutes.  
    3. Make Salsa: Mix chopped tomatoes, onions, coriander, lemon juice, and jalapenos. Keep aside.  
    4. Assemble Sizzler: Heat a sizzling plate, grease with butter, place a cabbage leaf. Arrange Mexican rice, beans, and salsa. Serve hot!

Title: Virgin Mojito
Ingredients: Fresh Mint Leaves - 10-12, Lemon - 1 (sliced), Sugar - 1 tbsp, Club Soda - 200 ml, Ice Cubes - 5-6, Salt - a pinch
Instructions:
1. In a glass, muddle mint leaves, lemon slices, and sugar until flavors are released.  
    2. Add ice cubes and a pinch of salt.  
    3. Pour club soda over and stir gently.  
    4. Garnish with a mint sprig and serve chilled.

Title: Strawberry Lemonade
Ingredients: Fresh Strawberries - 1 cup (chopped), Lemon Juice - 1/4 cup, Sugar - 3 tbsp, Cold Water - 2 cups, Ice Cubes - as needed
Instructions:
1. Blend strawberries, lemon juice, and sugar until smooth.  
    2. Strain the mixture to remove seeds.  
    3. Pour into a pitcher, add cold water, and mix well.  
    4. Serve over ice and garnish with a lemon slice.

Title: Blue Lagoon Mocktail
Ingredients: Blue Curacao Syrup - 2 tbsp, Lemon Juice - 1 tbsp, Lemon-Lime Soda - 200 ml, Ice Cubes - as needed, Lemon Slice - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Fill a glass with ice cubes.  
    2. Add blue curacao syrup and lemon juice.  
    3. Pour lemon-lime soda over and stir gently.  
    4. Garnish with a lemon slice and serve chilled.

Title: Piña Colada Mocktail
Ingredients: Pineapple Juice - 1 cup, Coconut Milk - 1/2 cup, Ice Cubes - 5-6, Sugar - 1 tbsp (optional), Pineapple Slice - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Blend pineapple juice, coconut milk, sugar, and ice cubes until smooth.  
    2. Pour into a tall glass.  
    3. Garnish with a pineapple slice and serve chilled.

Title: Mango Banana Smoothie
Ingredients: Ripe Mango - 1 (chopped), Banana - 1 (sliced), Milk - 1 cup, Honey - 1 tbsp, Ice Cubes - as needed
Instructions:
1. Blend mango, banana, milk, honey, and ice cubes until smooth.  
    2. Pour into a glass.  
    3. Garnish with a mango slice and serve chilled.

Title: Berry Blast Smoothie
Ingredients: Mixed Berries (Strawberries, Blueberries, Raspberries) - 1 cup, Greek Yogurt - 1/2 cup, Honey - 1 tbsp, Milk - 1/2 cup, Ice Cubes - as needed
Instructions:
1. Blend mixed berries, Greek yogurt, honey, milk, and ice cubes until smooth.  
    2. Pour into a glass and serve chilled.

Title: Methiya Keri Athanu (Traditional Gujarati Fenugreek Mango Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 1 kg raw mangoes, cut into 1-inch cubes
• 100g fenugreek seeds (methi dana)
• 50g mustard seeds
• 25g fennel seeds
• 100g red chili powder
• 50g turmeric powder
• 150g salt
• 2 tbsp asafoetida (hing)
• 500ml mustard oil
• 25g cumin seeds
• 50g sesame seeds
Instructions:
1. Mango Preparation:
   - Wash and dry mangoes thoroughly
   - Cut into 1-inch cubes
   - Sun-dry for 2-3 hours
   - Mix with salt and let stand for 6 hours

2. Spice Preparation:
   - Dry roast fenugreek seeds until aromatic
   - Coarsely grind fenugreek, mustard, and fennel seeds
   - Mix with red chili powder, turmeric, and asafoetida

3. Oil Treatment:
   - Heat mustard oil to smoking point
   - Cool completely
   - Add roasted cumin and sesame seeds

4. Final Process:
   - Mix mangoes with spice mixture
   - Add oil mixture
   - Store in sterilized jar
   - Sun-dry for 5-7 days
   - Shake daily
Equipment: Glass jars, Sun-drying trays, Spice grinder

Title: Gujarati Chhundo (Sweet Mango Preserve)
Ingredients:
• 1 kg raw mangoes, grated
• 750g sugar
• 25g salt
• 25g red chili powder
• 15g turmeric powder
• 2 tbsp roasted cumin powder
• 1 tbsp black pepper powder
• 1/4 tsp asafoetida
Instructions:
1. Mango Preparation:
   - Peel and grate raw mangoes finely
   - Mix with salt
   - Let stand for 2 hours in sun

2. Mixing Process:
   - Add sugar to salted mangoes
   - Mix well and let stand overnight
   - Add all spices next morning
   - Mix thoroughly

3. Sun Processing:
   - Spread in clean glass container
   - Keep in strong sunlight for 7-8 days
   - Stir twice daily
   - Cover with clean cloth at night

4. Storage:
   - Once thickened, store in sterilized jars
   - Keep in cool, dry place

Title: Gol Keri Athanu (Gujarati Jaggery Mango Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 1 kg raw mangoes, chopped
• 500g jaggery (gol)
• 50g mustard seeds
• 25g fenugreek seeds
• 50g red chili powder
• 25g turmeric powder
• 100g salt
• 1 tbsp asafoetida
• 400ml mustard oil
• 25g cumin seeds
Instructions:
1. Initial Preparation:
   - Cut mangoes into medium pieces
   - Sun-dry for 2-3 hours
   - Mix with salt and set aside

2. Jaggery Syrup:
   - Grate jaggery finely
   - Mix with mango pieces
   - Let stand for 4 hours

3. Spice Mixture:
   - Roast and grind mustard and fenugreek seeds
   - Mix with other spices
   - Heat oil and cool completely

4. Final Process:
   - Combine mangoes, jaggery, spices
   - Add oil mixture
   - Store in sterilized jars
   - Sun-process for 4-5 days
Equipment: Glass jars, Spice grinder, Sun-drying trays

Title: Limbu nu Athanu (Gujarati Lemon Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 20 fresh lemons
• 150g salt
• 50g red chili powder
• 25g turmeric powder
• 50g mustard seeds, ground
• 2 tbsp asafoetida
• 400ml mustard oil
• 25g fenugreek seeds
• 1 tbsp black pepper powder
Instructions:
1. Lemon Preparation:
   - Wash and dry lemons thoroughly
   - Cut into eight pieces
   - Mix with salt
   - Sun-dry for 2 days

2. Spice Mixture:
   - Roast and grind mustard seeds
   - Mix all dry spices together
   - Heat oil to smoking point and cool

3. Pickling Process:
   - Mix lemons with spice mixture
   - Add cooled oil
   - Transfer to sterilized jar
   - Sun-process for 7 days
   - Shake daily

Title: Bharela Marcha nu Athanu (Stuffed Green Chili Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 500g large green chilies
• 100g mustard seeds
• 50g fenugreek seeds
• 25g cumin seeds
• 50g salt
• 25g turmeric powder
• 2 tbsp asafoetida
• 300ml mustard oil
• 25g fennel seeds
• 2 tbsp mango powder
Instructions:
1. Chili Preparation:
   - Wash and dry chilies
   - Make slit lengthwise
   - Remove seeds carefully
   - Sun-dry for 3-4 hours

2. Stuffing Mixture:
   - Roast all seeds separately
   - Grind to coarse powder
   - Mix with salt and spices

3. Stuffing Process:
   - Fill each chili with spice mixture
   - Heat oil and cool completely
   - Pack chilies in jar
   - Pour oil over chilies

4. Maturation:
   - Keep in sun for 4-5 days
   - Shake jar daily
   - Ready in 2 weeks
Equipment: Glass jars, Spice grinder, Sun-drying trays

Title: Amla nu Athanu (Gujarati Gooseberry Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 1 kg fresh amla (gooseberries)
• 100g salt
• 50g red chili powder
• 25g turmeric powder
• 50g mustard seeds
• 2 tbsp asafoetida
• 400ml mustard oil
• 25g fenugreek seeds
• 2 tbsp black salt
Instructions:
1. Amla Preparation:
   - Clean and dry amla thoroughly
   - Cut into quarters
   - Remove seeds
   - Sun-dry for 4-5 hours

2. Spice Mixture:
   - Roast and grind mustard and fenugreek
   - Mix all spices together
   - Heat oil to smoking point
   - Cool completely

3. Pickling Process:
   - Mix amla with spices
   - Add cooled oil
   - Transfer to sterilized jar
   - Sun-process for 5-6 days

4. Storage:
   - Keep in cool, dry place
   - Ready in 10 days
   - Shake jar occasionally
Equipment: Glass jars, Spice grinder, Sun-drying trays

Title: Gunda-Keri nu Athanu (Glueberry-Mango Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 500g gunda (glueberries)
• 500g raw mangoes
• 100g salt
• 50g red chili powder
• 25g turmeric powder
• 50g mustard seeds
• 25g fenugreek seeds
• 2 tbsp asafoetida
• 500ml mustard oil
• 2 tbsp carom seeds (ajwain)
Instructions:
1. Initial Preparation:
   - Clean and dry gunda and mangoes
   - Cut mangoes into 1-inch pieces
   - Make small slits in gunda
   - Mix with salt and sun-dry for 2 days

2. Spice Preparation:
   - Roast and grind mustard and fenugreek seeds
   - Mix all ground spices
   - Heat oil to smoking point and cool

3. Pickling Process:
   - Mix fruits with spice mixture
   - Add cooled oil
   - Transfer to sterilized jar
   - Sun-process for 7 days
   - Shake jar daily
Equipment: Glass jars, Spice grinder, Sun-drying trays

Title: Keri no Murabbo (Sweet Mango Preserve)
Ingredients:
• 1 kg firm raw mangoes
• 750g sugar
• 1 tsp cardamom powder
• 10-12 cloves
• 2 cinnamon sticks
• 1/4 tsp saffron strands
• 1 cup water
• Pinch of salt
Instructions:
1. Mango Preparation:
   - Peel and cut mangoes into thick slices
   - Soak in lime water for 30 minutes
   - Drain and pat dry

2. Sugar Syrup:
   - Boil water and sugar
   - Add spices
   - Cook until one-string consistency

3. Cooking Process:
   - Add mango pieces to syrup
   - Cook on low heat
   - Stir occasionally
   - Cook until mangoes are translucent
   - Add saffron at the end

4. Storage:
   - Cool completely
   - Store in sterilized jars
   - Keep in refrigerator

Title: Kathiyawadi Teekho Athanu (Spicy Kathiyawadi Pickle)
Ingredients:
• 1 kg raw mangoes
• 200g red chili powder
• 100g salt
• 50g turmeric powder
• 75g mustard seeds
• 3 tbsp asafoetida
• 500ml mustard oil
• 50g fenugreek seeds
• 25g cumin seeds
• 25g black pepper, whole
Instructions:
1. Mango Preparation:
   - Cut mangoes into small pieces
   - Mix with salt
   - Sun-dry for 2 days
   - Drain excess water

2. Spice Mixture:
   - Roast all seeds separately
   - Grind to coarse powder
   - Mix with red chili and turmeric
   - Heat oil to smoking point

3. Pickling Process:
   - Mix mangoes with spices
   - Add cooled oil
   - Store in ceramic jar
   - Sun-process for 10 days

4. Maturation:
   - Keep in cool place
   - Ready in 15 days
   - Extremely spicy pickle
Equipment: Ceramic jars, Spice grinder, Sun-drying trays

Title: Gujarati Mixed Sprouts Salad (Ankurit Kachumber)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups mixed sprouts (moong, moth, chickpea)
• 1 cucumber, finely chopped
• 2 tomatoes, finely chopped
• 1 onion, finely chopped
• 1 green chili, finely chopped
• 1/2 cup pomegranate seeds
• 1/4 cup fresh coconut, grated
• 2 tbsp lemon juice
• 1 tsp chaat masala
• 1/2 tsp cumin powder
• Salt to taste
• 2 tbsp fresh coriander, chopped
Instructions:
1. Sprouts Preparation:
   - Rinse sprouts thoroughly
   - Steam for 2-3 minutes (optional)
   - Let cool completely

2. Salad Assembly:
   - Mix all chopped vegetables
   - Add sprouts and pomegranate
   - Toss with coconut

3. Seasoning:
   - Add lemon juice
   - Sprinkle spices
   - Mix well
   - Garnish with coriander

4. Serving:
   - Serve immediately
   - Can be refrigerated for 2 hours

Title: Masala Moong Sprouts Salad
Ingredients:
• 3 cups moong sprouts
• 1 carrot, grated
• 1 bell pepper, finely chopped
• 2 tbsp peanuts, roasted
• 1 tsp ginger, grated
• 2 green chilies, finely chopped
• 2 tbsp olive oil
• 1 tsp mustard seeds
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• Curry leaves
• 1/2 tsp turmeric
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• Salt to taste
• Lemon juice to taste
Instructions:
1. Tempering:
   - Heat oil in pan
   - Add mustard seeds, cumin
   - Add curry leaves
   - Add ginger, chilies

2. Sprouts Preparation:
   - Add sprouts to tempering
   - Sauté for 2-3 minutes
   - Add turmeric, chili powder
   - Cook for 2 minutes

3. Final Assembly:
   - Add vegetables
   - Mix well
   - Add roasted peanuts
   - Season with salt, lemon

4. Serving:
   - Serve warm or cold
   - Garnish with coriander

Title: Sprouted Moth Bean Salad (Matki Sprouts)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups matki sprouts
• 1 onion, finely chopped
• 2 tomatoes, chopped
• 1/2 cup raw mango, grated
• 2 green chilies, chopped
• 1/4 cup fresh coconut, grated
• 2 tbsp coriander, chopped
• 1 tsp cumin powder
• 1/2 tsp black pepper
• 1 tbsp lemon juice
• Salt to taste
• 2 tbsp peanuts, crushed
Instructions:
1. Sprouts Preparation:
   - Steam matki sprouts lightly
   - Cool completely
   - Drain excess water

2. Mixing:
   - Combine all vegetables
   - Add sprouts
   - Mix in coconut, peanuts

3. Seasoning:
   - Add all spices
   - Toss with lemon juice
   - Adjust salt

4. Final Touch:
   - Garnish with coriander
   - Serve immediately

Title: Mediterranean Quinoa Power Salad
Ingredients:
• 2 cups cooked quinoa
• 1 cucumber, diced
• 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved
• 1 red onion, finely chopped
• 1 cup kalamata olives, pitted
• 200g feta cheese, crumbled
• 1/2 cup fresh parsley, chopped
• 1/4 cup fresh mint, chopped

Dressing:
• 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
• 2 tbsp lemon juice
• 1 tbsp red wine vinegar
• 2 cloves garlic, minced
• 1 tsp dried oregano
• Salt and pepper to taste
Instructions:
1. Quinoa Preparation:
   - Cook quinoa according to package
   - Let cool completely
   - Fluff with fork

2. Salad Assembly:
   - Mix cooled quinoa with vegetables
   - Add olives and herbs
   - Toss gently

3. Dressing:
   - Whisk all dressing ingredients
   - Pour over salad
   - Mix well

4. Finishing:
   - Top with feta cheese
   - Refrigerate 30 minutes before serving

Title: Cold Soba Noodle Salad with Sesame Dressing
Ingredients:
• 300g soba noodles
• 2 carrots, julienned
• 1 cucumber, julienned
• 200g edamame, shelled
• 2 cups red cabbage, shredded
• 4 green onions, sliced
• 1/4 cup sesame seeds, toasted

Dressing:
• 3 tbsp sesame oil
• 3 tbsp soy sauce
• 2 tbsp rice vinegar
• 1 tbsp honey
• 1 tbsp ginger, grated
• 1 clove garlic, minced
• 1 tsp chili oil (optional)
Instructions:
1. Noodle Preparation:
   - Cook soba noodles
   - Rinse under cold water
   - Toss with 1 tsp sesame oil

2. Vegetable Prep:
   - Prepare all vegetables
   - Blanch edamame
   - Toast sesame seeds

3. Dressing:
   - Mix all dressing ingredients
   - Adjust seasoning

4. Assembly:
   - Combine noodles and vegetables
   - Pour dressing
   - Sprinkle sesame seeds

Title: Mexican Street Corn Salad
Ingredients:
• 6 ears corn, kernels removed
• 1/4 cup mayonnaise
• 1/4 cup Mexican crema or sour cream
• 1/2 cup cotija cheese, crumbled
• 1 jalapeño, finely diced
• 1/3 cup red onion, finely chopped
• 1/4 cup cilantro, chopped
• 2 limes, juiced
• 1 tsp chili powder
• 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Corn Preparation:
   - Char corn kernels in skillet
   - Cool slightly

2. Dressing:
   - Mix mayo and crema
   - Add lime juice
   - Stir in spices

3. Assembly:
   - Combine corn with dressing
   - Add jalapeño and onion
   - Mix in cheese
   - Add cilantro

4. Serving:
   - Serve warm or room temperature
   - Garnish with extra cheese and chili powder

Title: Gujarati Masala Puri
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 1/2 cup semolina (sooji)
• 2 tsp red chili powder
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
• 1/2 tsp turmeric powder
• 2 tbsp oil for dough
• Salt to taste
• Oil for deep frying
• Water for kneading
Instructions:
1. Dough Preparation:
   - Mix flour, semolina, and all spices
   - Add 2 tbsp oil and mix well
   - Knead into tight dough using water
   - Cover and rest for 30 minutes

2. Rolling:
   - Divide dough into small portions
   - Roll each into 4-inch circles
   - Dust with dry flour while rolling

3. Frying:
   - Heat oil in deep pan
   - Fry puris on medium-high heat
   - Press gently while frying
   - Fry until golden brown

4. Storage:
   - Cool completely
   - Store in airtight container

Title: Traditional Shakkar Para
Ingredients:
• 2 cups all-purpose flour (maida)
• 1/2 cup semolina (sooji)
• 1/2 cup powdered sugar
• 1/4 cup ghee
• 1/4 cup milk
• 1 tsp cardamom powder
• Pinch of salt
• Oil for deep frying
• Extra sugar for coating
Instructions:
1. Dough Making:
   - Mix flour, semolina, and salt
   - Add ghee and mix until crumbly
   - Add cardamom powder
   - Knead with milk into firm dough
   - Rest for 20 minutes

2. Shaping:
   - Roll dough into thick sheet
   - Cut into diamond shapes
   - Keep size consistent

3. Frying:
   - Heat oil on medium heat
   - Fry until light golden
   - Drain on paper towels

4. Finishing:
   - Coat with powdered sugar while warm
   - Cool completely before storing

Title: Rava Maida Puri (Semolina-Flour Puri)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup semolina (rava)
• 1 cup all-purpose flour (maida)
• 2 tbsp oil for dough
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp black pepper powder
• 1/4 tsp asafoetida (hing)
• Salt to taste
• Water for kneading
• Oil for deep frying
Instructions:
1. Dough Preparation:
   - Mix rava and maida
   - Add spices and salt
   - Add oil and mix well
   - Knead into stiff dough
   - Cover and rest for 15 minutes

2. Shaping:
   - Divide into small portions
   - Roll into thin circles
   - Keep size uniform

3. Frying Process:
   - Heat oil until hot
   - Fry puris until puffed
   - Flip and cook both sides
   - Should be crispy and golden

4. Serving:
   - Serve hot with curry or chutney
   - Can be stored for 2-3 days

Title: Kesar Matho (Saffron Yogurt Dessert)
Ingredients: Full-fat curd - 500g, Sugar - 100g, Saffron strands - 1/2 tsp, Warm milk - 2 tbsp, Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp, Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp, Rose water - 1 tsp
Instructions:
1. Hang the curd in a muslin cloth for 3-4 hours to remove excess water.
2. Dissolve saffron in warm milk and let it sit for 10 minutes.
3. In a bowl, whisk the thickened curd with sugar, saffron milk, and cardamom powder until smooth.
4. Add rose water and mix well.
5. Garnish with chopped nuts and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Title: Mango Matho (Mango Yogurt Dessert)
Ingredients: Full-fat curd - 500g, Sugar - 100g, Mango pulp - 1 cup, Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp, Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp, Saffron strands - 1/4 tsp, Warm milk - 1 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Hang the curd in a muslin cloth for 3-4 hours to remove excess water.
2. Dissolve saffron in warm milk and let it sit for 10 minutes.
3. In a bowl, whisk the thickened curd with sugar, mango pulp, cardamom powder, and saffron milk until smooth.
4. Garnish with chopped nuts and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Title: Kaju Draksh Matho (Cashew Raisin Yogurt Dessert)
Ingredients: Full-fat curd - 500g, Sugar - 100g, Cashews (chopped) - 2 tbsp, Raisins - 2 tbsp, Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp, Saffron strands - 1/4 tsp, Warm milk - 1 tbsp, Chopped almonds - 1 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Hang the curd in a muslin cloth for 3-4 hours to remove excess water.
2. Dissolve saffron in warm milk and let it sit for 10 minutes.
3. In a bowl, whisk the thickened curd with sugar, cardamom powder, and saffron milk until smooth.
4. Add cashews and raisins, mixing well.
5. Garnish with chopped almonds and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

Title: Farsi Puri
Ingredients: All-purpose flour - 2 cups, Semolina - 1/4 cup, Black pepper - 1/2 tsp, Ajwain - 1 tsp, Salt - 1 tsp, Butter - 2 tbsp, Water - as needed, Oil - for frying
Instructions: 1. Mix flour, semolina, black pepper, ajwain, salt, and butter. 2. Add water and knead into a stiff dough. 3. Roll out puris and prick with a fork. 4. Deep fry until golden brown and crispy. 5. Store in an airtight container.

Title: Khakhra
Ingredients: Whole wheat flour - 2 cups, Salt - 1/2 tsp, Ajwain - 1/2 tsp, Oil - 2 tbsp, Water - as needed
Instructions: 1. Mix flour, salt, ajwain, and oil. 2. Add water and knead into a stiff dough. 3. Roll into thin discs. 4. Cook on a tawa, pressing until crisp. 5. Store in an airtight container.

Title: Mathiya
Ingredients: Mathiya flour - 2 cups, Besan - 1/2 cup, Sugar - 1 tbsp, Ajwain - 1 tsp, Red chili powder - 1 tsp, Hing - 1/4 tsp, Salt - 1 tsp, Water - as needed, Oil - for frying
Instructions: 1. Mix flour, besan, sugar, ajwain, red chili powder, hing, and salt. 2. Add water and knead into a medium-soft dough. 3. Roll out thin discs and deep fry until crispy. 4. Store in an airtight container.

Title: Chorafali
Ingredients: Besan - 1 cup, Urad dal flour - 1/2 cup, Baking soda - 1/4 tsp, Salt - 1 tsp, Water - as needed, Oil - for frying
Instructions: 1. Mix besan, urad dal flour, baking soda, and salt. 2. Add water and knead into a stiff dough. 3. Roll out thin and cut into strips. 4. Deep fry until crispy and sprinkle with red chili powder. 5. Store in an airtight container.

Title: Dhebra
Ingredients: Bajra flour - 1 cup, Wheat flour - 1/2 cup, Methi - 1/2 cup, Ajwain - 1/2 tsp, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Red chili powder - 1 tsp, Sesame seeds - 1 tsp, Salt - 1 tsp, Yogurt - 2 tbsp, Ginger-chili paste - 1 tsp, Oil - for kneading, Water - as needed, Oil/ghee - for frying
Instructions: 1. Mix all ingredients and knead a soft dough. 2. Rest for 10 mins and roll into thick discs. 3. Cook on a tawa with oil/ghee until golden brown. 4. Serve with curd or pickle.

Title: Paneer Chilla
Ingredients: Besan - 1 cup, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp, Ajwain - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Water - as needed, Oil - for batter, Paneer - 1/2 cup, Black pepper - 1/4 tsp, Chaat masala - 1/4 tsp, Green chili - 1, Coriander leaves - 1 tbsp
Instructions: 1. Make a smooth besan batter and rest for 10 mins. 2. Prepare paneer stuffing. 3. Heat a tawa, spread batter, and top with stuffing. 4. Cook until crispy and golden brown. 5. Serve with chutney.

Title: Kapuriya
Ingredients: Rice flour - 1 cup, Chana dal - 1/4 cup, Urad dal - 1/4 cup, Turmeric - 1/2 tsp, Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp, Ajwain - 1/2 tsp, Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp, Sesame seeds - 1 tsp, Hing - 1/2 tsp, Salt - to taste, Oil - 1 tbsp, Water - as needed
Instructions: 1. Grind soaked dals into a coarse paste. 2. Mix with rice flour, spices, and water to form dough. 3. Shape into cakes and steam for 15-20 mins. 4. Serve with chutney or shallow fry for crispiness.

Title: Faludoo (Surti Falooda)
Ingredients: Milk - 2 cups, Sugar - 3 tbsp, Rose syrup - 2 tbsp, Sabja seeds - 1 tbsp, Falooda sev - 1/4 cup, Vanilla ice cream - 2 scoops, Chopped nuts - 2 tbsp, Tutti frutti - 1 tbsp, Fresh fruits - 1/4 cup (optional)
Instructions: 1. Heat milk, add sugar, and cool it. 2. Boil falooda sev and soak sabja seeds. 3. In a glass, add rose syrup, sabja, and sev. 4. Pour chilled milk and top with ice cream, nuts, and fruits. 5. Serve chilled.

Title: Milk-Based Fruit Salad
Ingredients: Milk - 2 cups, Condensed milk - 2 tbsp, Sugar - 1 tbsp, Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp, Vanilla essence - 1/2 tsp, Banana - 1/2 cup, Apple - 1/2 cup, Mango - 1/2 cup, Grapes - 1/2 cup, Pomegranate - 1/4 cup, Dry fruits - 1/4 cup
Instructions: 1. Heat milk, add sugar and condensed milk, then chill. 2. Mix cardamom and vanilla essence. 3. Chop fruits and dry fruits. 4. Pour chilled milk over fruits and mix. 5. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Title: Surti Cocoa
Ingredients: Milk - 2 cups, Cocoa powder - 2 tbsp, Sugar - 2 tbsp, Instant coffee powder - 1/2 tsp (optional), Cinnamon powder - 1/4 tsp, Dark chocolate (grated) - 2 tbsp, Fresh cream - 2 tbsp, Vanilla essence - 1/2 tsp, Ice cubes - as needed, Choco chips - for garnish
Instructions: 1. Heat milk in a pan. 2. Add cocoa, sugar, coffee powder, and cinnamon while whisking. 3. Stir until smooth, then add grated dark chocolate and fresh cream. 4. Let it cool completely, then refrigerate for 2 hours. 5. Blend the chilled mixture for 30 seconds. 6. Pour over ice cubes, garnish with choco chips, and serve chilled.

Title: Stuffed Paneer Paratha
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 2 cups grated paneer
• 2 green chilies, finely chopped
• 1 inch ginger, grated
• 1/2 cup coriander leaves, chopped
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• Salt to taste
• Ghee for cooking
• Water for kneading
Instructions:
1. Dough Preparation:
   - Knead wheat flour with water
   - Make soft dough
   - Rest for 20 minutes

2. Filling:
   - Mix grated paneer with spices
   - Add herbs and seasonings
   - Mix well

3. Making Paratha:
   - Make small balls of dough
   - Roll into circles
   - Place filling in center
   - Seal edges and roll again
   - Cook on hot griddle
   - Apply ghee on both sides
   - Cook until golden brown

4. Serving:
   - Serve hot with curd or pickle
   - Best eaten fresh

Title: Cheesy Stuffed Paratha
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 2 cups grated cheese (mix of mozzarella and cheddar)
• 1 onion, finely chopped
• 2 green chilies, chopped
• 1 tsp black pepper
• 1 tsp oregano (optional)
• Salt to taste
• Butter for cooking
• Water for kneading
Instructions:
1. Dough Making:
   - Mix flour and salt
   - Knead into soft dough
   - Rest for 15 minutes

2. Cheese Filling:
   - Mix cheeses with onion
   - Add spices and herbs
   - Combine well

3. Assembly:
   - Make dough balls
   - Roll into circles
   - Add cheese mixture
   - Seal and roll gently
   - Cook on medium heat
   - Apply butter
   - Cook until cheese melts

4. Serving:
   - Cut into quarters
   - Serve with ketchup

Title: Mixed Vegetable Stuffed Paratha
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrot, peas, beans, cauliflower)
• 1 potato, boiled and mashed
• 2 green chilies
• 1 inch ginger
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp garam masala
• 1/2 tsp turmeric
• Salt to taste
• Oil for cooking
Instructions:
1. Dough:
   - Prepare soft dough
   - Rest for 30 minutes

2. Filling:
   - Finely chop all vegetables
   - Mix with mashed potato
   - Add spices and seasoning
   - Cook mixture slightly

3. Making Paratha:
   - Roll dough portions
   - Stuff with vegetable mix
   - Roll carefully
   - Cook on hot tawa
   - Apply oil
   - Cook until crispy

4. Storage:
   - Can be refrigerated
   - Reheat on tawa

Title: Cheeni Paratha (Sweet Stuffed Paratha)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 1 cup sugar
• 2 tbsp ghee
• 1/2 tsp cardamom powder
• Pinch of nutmeg
• Water for kneading
• Ghee for cooking
Instructions:
1. Dough:
   - Make soft dough
   - Rest for 20 minutes

2. Filling:
   - Powder sugar finely
   - Mix with cardamom
   - Add nutmeg

3. Making Paratha:
   - Roll small circles
   - Add sugar mixture
   - Seal edges
   - Roll gently
   - Cook on medium heat
   - Apply ghee

4. Important Notes:
   - Dont make too thin
   - Sugar should not leak
   - Serve warm

Title: Laccha Paratha (Layered Flatbread)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 4 tbsp ghee/oil
• Salt to taste
• Water for kneading
• Oil for cooking
• Ghee for layering
Instructions:
1. Dough Making:
   - Mix flour and salt
   - Add oil, knead soft dough
   - Rest for 30 minutes

2. Layering Process:
   - Roll dough thin
   - Apply ghee
   - Make pleats
   - Roll into spiral
   - Roll again gently

3. Cooking:
   - Cook on hot tawa
   - Apply oil
   - Press gently
   - Cook until crispy
   - Should be flaky

4. Serving:
   - Serve hot
   - Break into layers

Title: Mooli ka Paratha (Radish Stuffed Flatbread)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 2 cups grated radish
• 2 green chilies
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp carom seeds
• Red chili powder to taste
• Salt to taste
• Oil for cooking
• Fresh coriander
Instructions:
1. Radish Preparation:
   - Grate radish
   - Add salt and let sit
   - Squeeze out water
   - Mix with spices

2. Dough:
   - Make smooth dough
   - Rest for 15 minutes

3. Making Paratha:
   - Stuff dough with filling
   - Roll gently
   - Cook on hot tawa
   - Apply oil
   - Cook till crispy

4. Best Practices:
   - Remove excess moisture
   - Serve immediately

Title: Pyaz ka Paratha (Onion Stuffed Flatbread)
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 2 large onions, finely chopped
• 2-3 green chilies, chopped
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 cup coriander leaves
• 1 inch ginger, grated
• Salt to taste
• Oil for cooking
• Butter for serving
Instructions:
1. Dough Preparation:
   - Knead soft dough
   - Cover and rest

2. Filling:
   - Mix chopped onions with spices
   - Add herbs
   - Let sit for 10 minutes
   - Drain excess water

3. Assembly:
   - Make dough balls
   - Stuff with onion mixture
   - Roll carefully
   - Cook on medium heat
   - Apply oil on both sides

4. Serving:
   - Serve hot with butter
   - Pair with yogurt

Title: Gobi (Cauliflower) Stuffed Paratha
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 2 cups grated cauliflower
• 2 green chilies, finely chopped
• 1 inch ginger, grated
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• 1/2 tsp carom seeds (ajwain)
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• 1/2 tsp garam masala
• Salt to taste
• Ghee for cooking
• Fresh coriander leaves
Instructions:
1. Cauliflower Preparation:
   - Grate cauliflower finely
   - Mix with spices
   - Add chopped herbs
   - Season well

2. Dough:
   - Make soft dough with flour
   - Rest for 20 minutes
   - Divide into portions

3. Making Paratha:
   - Roll dough circles
   - Place filling
   - Seal edges
   - Roll gently
   - Cook on hot tawa
   - Apply ghee
   - Cook until golden spots appear

Title: Triple Cheese Stuffed Paratha
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 1/2 cup mozzarella, grated
• 1/2 cup cheddar, grated
• 1/4 cup processed cheese, grated
• 2 green chilies, finely chopped
• 1 tsp black pepper powder
• 1 tsp mixed herbs (optional)
• 1/2 tsp garlic powder
• Salt to taste
• Butter for cooking
• Water for kneading
Instructions:
1. Dough Preparation:
   - Make soft dough with flour
   - Rest for 20 minutes
   - Divide into portions

2. Cheese Mixture:
   - Mix all three cheeses
   - Add spices and herbs
   - Combine well

3. Making Paratha:
   - Roll dough circles
   - Place cheese mixture
   - Seal edges carefully
   - Roll gently
   - Cook on medium heat
   - Apply butter
   - Cook until cheese melts

4. Serving:
   - Serve hot with ketchup
   - Cut into triangles

Title: Pizza Paratha Fusion
Ingredients:
• 2 cups whole wheat flour
• 1 cup pizza sauce
• 1 cup mozzarella cheese
• 1/2 cup bell peppers, finely chopped
• 1/2 cup onions, finely chopped
• 1/4 cup corn kernels
• 1/4 cup olives, sliced
• 1 tsp oregano
• 1 tsp chili flakes
• 1 tsp garlic powder
• Salt to taste
• Oil for cooking
Instructions:
1. Base Preparation:
   - Make firm dough
   - Rest for 15 minutes
   - Divide into balls

2. Topping Mix:
   - Mix vegetables
   - Add seasonings
   - Keep cheese separate

3. Assembly:
   - Roll thick circle
   - Spread pizza sauce
   - Add vegetable mix
   - Top with cheese
   - Fold and seal edges
   - Roll gently

4. Cooking:
   - Cook on low heat
   - Cover while cooking
   - Flip carefully
   - Cook until golden
   - Cheese should melt

Title: Dahi Vada (Gujarati Style)
Ingredients:
• 1 cup urad dal
• 2 green chilies, finely chopped
• 1 inch ginger, grated
• 1/4 cup fresh coriander, chopped
• 1 tsp cumin seeds
• Pinch of asafoetida
• Salt to taste
• Oil for deep frying

For Yogurt Sauce:
• 3 cups thick yogurt
• 1 tsp roasted cumin powder
• 1 tsp black salt
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• Salt to taste

For Garnish:
• Tamarind chutney
• Green chutney
• Chaat masala
• Sev for topping
Instructions:
1. Vada Preparation:
   - Soak urad dal for 4 hours
   - Grind to smooth paste
   - Add spices and herbs
   - Beat mixture till fluffy
   - Shape into small balls
   - Deep fry till golden

2. Yogurt Mixture:
   - Whisk yogurt till smooth
   - Add all spices
   - Mix well

3. Assembly:
   - Soak fried vadas in water
   - Squeeze out excess water
   - Place in yogurt mixture
   - Chill for 30 minutes

4. Serving:
   - Top with chutneys
   - Sprinkle chaat masala
   - Garnish with sev

Title: Mumbai Style Sev Puri
Ingredients:
• 24 puris (crispy wheat discs)
• 2 potatoes, boiled and mashed
• 1 onion, finely chopped
• 2 tomatoes, finely chopped
• 1/2 cup moong sprouts
• 1/2 cup fine sev
• 1/4 cup dates-tamarind chutney
• 1/4 cup mint chutney
• 1 tsp chaat masala
• 1/2 tsp red chili powder
• 1/4 cup fresh coriander
• 1 lemon
• Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Preparation:
   - Boil and mash potatoes
   - Chop vegetables finely
   - Keep chutneys ready

2. Assembly:
   - Crack puris slightly
   - Add potato mixture
   - Top with onions, tomatoes
   - Add sprouts
   - Drizzle both chutneys
   - Add spice powders

3. Finishing:
   - Squeeze lemon juice
   - Top with sev
   - Garnish with coriander

4. Serving:
   - Serve immediately
   - Should be crispy
   - Best eaten fresh

Title: Crispy Papdi Chaat
Ingredients:
• 15-20 papdis (crispy wafers)
• 2 potatoes, boiled and cubed
• 1 cup boiled chickpeas
• 1 cup thick yogurt
• Green chutney
• Tamarind chutney
• 1/2 cup fine sev
• 1 tsp roasted cumin powder
• 1 tsp red chili powder
• Chaat masala
• Fresh coriander
• Pomegranate seeds for garnish
Instructions:
1. Yogurt Preparation:
   - Whisk yogurt until smooth
   - Add salt and cumin
   - Keep chilled

2. Assembly:
   - Arrange papdis on plate
   - Top with potatoes, chickpeas
   - Add whisked yogurt
   - Drizzle both chutneys
   - Sprinkle spice powders

3. Garnishing:
   - Top with sev
   - Add pomegranate seeds
   - Garnish with coriander

4. Serving:
   - Serve immediately
   - Should be cold and crispy

Title: Royal Raj Kachori
Ingredients:
• For Kachori Shell:
  - 2 cups all-purpose flour
  - 1/4 cup semolina (sooji)
  - Salt to taste
  - Oil for deep frying

• For Filling:
  - 1 cup sprouts
  - 1 cup boiled potatoes, cubed
  - 1/2 cup boiled chickpeas
  - 1 cup thick yogurt
  - 1/2 cup pomegranate seeds
  - 1 cup fine sev
  - 2 green chilies, finely chopped
  - 1 onion, finely chopped
  - 2 tbsp tamarind chutney
  - 2 tbsp mint chutney
  - 1 tsp chaat masala
  - 1 tsp roasted cumin powder
  - Fresh coriander leaves
  - 1/2 cup boondi
  - Salt to taste
Instructions:
1. Kachori Shell:
   - Mix flour, semolina, salt
   - Knead tight dough with water
   - Rest for 30 minutes
   - Roll into large circles
   - Deep fry while pressing center
   - Should puff up like a ball
   - Make hole once cooled

2. Filling Preparation:
   - Mix sprouts with spices
   - Whisk yogurt until smooth
   - Chop all vegetables finely
   - Keep chutneys ready

3. Assembly:
   - Fill base with sprouts, potatoes
   - Add chickpeas
   - Pour whisked yogurt
   - Add both chutneys
   - Sprinkle spice powders
   - Top with sev, boondi
   - Add pomegranate seeds

4. Final Garnish:
   - Sprinkle chaat masala
   - Add fresh coriander
   - Serve immediately
   - Must be eaten fresh
Equipment: Deep fryer, Rolling pin, Large mixing bowls

Title: Vagarelo Rotlo
Ingredients: Bajra Rotlo - 2 (crumbled); Oil - 2 tbsp; Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp; Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp; Green chilies - 2 (chopped); Garlic - 3 cloves (chopped); Onion - 1 small (chopped); Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp; Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp; Salt - to taste; Lemon juice - 1 tbsp; Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (chopped)
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter. 
2. Add chopped green chilies and garlic, sauté for a few seconds. 
3. Add chopped onions and cook until soft. 
4. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Mix well. 
5. Add crumbled bajra rotlo and mix properly. 
6. Sprinkle lemon juice and garnish with chopped coriander. 
7. Serve hot with curd or chutney.

Title: Mango Rabdi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Ripe mango pulp - 1/2 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Saffron strands - a few; Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and reduce it to half while stirring occasionally. 
2. Add sugar and mix well. 
3. Add cardamom powder and saffron, mix thoroughly. 
4. Let it cool to room temperature, then mix in the mango pulp. 
5. Garnish with chopped nuts and chill before serving.

Title: Sitafal Rabdi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Custard apple (Sitafal) pulp - 1/2 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and reduce it to half while stirring occasionally. 
2. Add sugar and mix well. 
3. Add cardamom powder and mix thoroughly. 
4. Let it cool, then mix in the sitafal pulp. 
5. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve chilled.

Title: Strawberry Rabdi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Fresh strawberry puree - 1/2 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and reduce it to half while stirring occasionally. 
2. Add sugar and mix well. 
3. Add cardamom powder and mix thoroughly. 
4. Let it cool, then mix in the strawberry puree. 
5. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve chilled.

Title: Angoor Rabdi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Small seedless grapes - 1/2 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and reduce it to half while stirring occasionally. 
2. Add sugar and mix well. 
3. Add cardamom powder and mix thoroughly. 
4. Let it cool, then add the seedless grapes. 
5. Garnish with chopped nuts and serve chilled.

Title: Coconut Barfi
Ingredients: Grated coconut - 2 cups; Sugar - 1 cup; Milk - 1/2 cup; Ghee - 1 tbsp; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped nuts - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee in a pan and roast the coconut lightly. 
2. Add sugar and milk, and cook until thick. 
3. Mix in cardamom powder and nuts. 
4. Spread on a greased plate and cut into pieces when set.

Title: Besan Barfi
Ingredients: Gram flour (besan) - 2 cups; Sugar - 1 cup; Ghee - 1 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped almonds - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Roast besan in ghee on low heat until golden brown. 
2. Prepare sugar syrup of one-string consistency. 
3. Mix the sugar syrup with the roasted besan. 
4. Pour into a greased tray, garnish with almonds, and cut when cool.

Title: Chocolate Barfi
Ingredients: Milk powder - 1 cup; Cocoa powder - 2 tbsp; Sugar - 1/2 cup; Ghee - 2 tbsp; Milk - 1/2 cup; Chopped nuts - 2 tbsp
Instructions: 1. Heat ghee and mix in milk powder, cocoa powder, and sugar. \n2. Add milk and cook until thick. \n3. Pour into a tray, let it set, and cut into pieces.

Title: Chicken Korma
Ingredients: Chicken - 500g; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Onion (sliced) - 2; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Cashews - 10; Poppy seeds - 1 tbsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Turmeric - 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Salt - to taste; Oil - 3 tbsp; Fresh cream - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Fry onions until golden brown, then grind into a paste with cashews and poppy seeds. 
2. Heat oil, add ginger-garlic paste and chicken, sauté. 
3. Add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. 
4. Stir in onion-cashew paste and yogurt, cook on low heat. 
5. Add garam masala and fresh cream, simmer until the chicken is tender. 
6. Serve hot with naan or rice.

Title: Mutton Korma
Ingredients: Mutton - 500g; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Onion (sliced) - 2; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Cashews - 10; Almonds - 10; Poppy seeds - 1 tbsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Turmeric - 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Salt - to taste; Oil - 3 tbsp; Fresh cream - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Fry onions until golden brown, then blend with cashews, almonds, and poppy seeds. 
2. Heat oil, add ginger-garlic paste and mutton, sauté well. 
3. Add turmeric, chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. 
4. Stir in the onion-nut paste and yogurt, cook on low heat. 
5. Add garam masala and fresh cream, simmer until the mutton is soft. 
6. Serve with naan or rice.

Title: Vegetable Korma
Ingredients: Potatoes (cubed) - 1; Carrots (chopped) - 1; Peas - 1/2 cup; Cauliflower florets - 1 cup; Onion (chopped) - 1; Tomato (chopped) - 1; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Cashews - 10; Poppy seeds - 1 tbsp; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Turmeric - 1/2 tsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Salt - to taste; Oil - 3 tbsp; Coconut milk - 1/2 cup
Instructions:
1. Heat oil, add onions, sauté until golden. 
2. Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and spices, cook until soft. 
3. Blend cashews and poppy seeds into a paste, add to the pan. 
4. Stir in yogurt, then add all the vegetables and mix well. 
5. Pour in coconut milk and cook until the vegetables are tender. 
6. Serve with roti or rice.

Title: Paneer Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice - 2 cups; Paneer (cubed) - 200g; Onion (thinly sliced) - 2 large; Tomato (chopped) - 1 large; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Green chilies (slit) - 2; Coriander leaves - 1/4 cup; Mint leaves - 1/4 cup; Whole spices (bay leaf - 1, cloves - 3, cinnamon stick - 1 inch, cardamom - 2, black peppercorns - 1/2 tsp); Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Biryani masala - 1 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Saffron strands - a few; Warm milk - 1/4 cup; Ghee - 3 tbsp; Oil - 2 tbsp; Water - 4 cups
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 
2. Shallow-fry paneer cubes in oil until golden and set aside. 
3. Heat ghee in a pan, fry whole spices until fragrant. 
4. Add onions and cook until golden. 
5. Add tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and cook until soft. 
6. Mix in chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, biryani masala, and salt. 
7. Add yogurt, cook for 2 minutes, then add paneer. 
8. In a separate pot, boil water, add salt and rice, and cook until 70% done. Drain. 
9. Layer rice over the paneer mixture, sprinkle saffron milk, mint, and coriander. 
10. Cover and cook on low flame (Dum) for 20 minutes. 
11. Serve hot with raita.

Title: Aloo Dum Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice - 2 cups; Baby potatoes - 10 (boiled & peeled); Onion (thinly sliced) - 2 large; Tomato (chopped) - 1 large; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Green chilies (slit) - 2; Coriander leaves - 1/4 cup; Mint leaves - 1/4 cup; Whole spices (bay leaf - 1, cloves - 3, cinnamon stick - 1 inch, cardamom - 2, black peppercorns - 1/2 tsp); Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Biryani masala - 1 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Saffron strands - a few; Warm milk - 1/4 cup; Ghee - 3 tbsp; Oil - 2 tbsp; Water - 4 cups
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 
2. Shallow-fry baby potatoes in oil until golden brown. 
3. Heat ghee in a pot, fry whole spices until fragrant. 
4. Add onions and cook until golden brown. 
5. Add tomatoes, ginger-garlic paste, and cook until soft. 
6. Mix in chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, biryani masala, and salt. 
7. Add yogurt and mix well. 
8. Stir in the fried potatoes and coat them in masala. 
9. In a separate pot, boil water, add salt and rice, and cook until 70% done. Drain. 
10. Layer rice over the potato mixture, sprinkle saffron milk, mint, and coriander. 
11. Cover and cook on Dum for 20 minutes. 
12. Serve hot with raita.

Title: Prawn Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice - 2 cups; Fresh prawns (cleaned) - 500g; Onion (sliced) - 3; Tomato (chopped) - 2; Ginger-garlic paste - 2 tbsp; Green chilies (chopped) - 3; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Biryani masala - 1 tbsp; Lemon juice - 1 tbsp; Mint leaves - 1/2 cup; Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup; Saffron strands - a few; Warm milk - 1/4 cup; Ghee - 3 tbsp; Oil - 3 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Water - 4 cups
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil and ghee, fry onions until golden brown. 
3. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and tomatoes, cook until soft. 
4. Add prawns, chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt, sauté for 5 minutes. 
5. Stir in yogurt, mint, coriander leaves, and lemon juice. 
6. In a separate pot, boil rice until 70% cooked, then drain. 
7. Layer the rice over the prawn mixture, drizzle saffron milk on top. 
8. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes (Dum cooking). 
9. Serve hot with raita and fried onions.

Title: Chicken Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice - 2 cups; Chicken (bone-in) - 500g; Onion (sliced) - 3; Tomatoes (chopped) - 2; Ginger-garlic paste - 2 tbsp; Green chilies (chopped) - 3; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Biryani masala - 1 tbsp; Lemon juice - 1 tbsp; Mint leaves - 1/2 cup; Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup; Saffron strands - a few; Warm milk - 1/4 cup; Ghee - 3 tbsp; Oil - 3 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Water - 4 cups
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil and ghee, fry onions until golden brown. 
3. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and tomatoes, cook until soft. 
4. Add chicken, chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, and salt, cook until tender. 
5. Stir in yogurt, mint, coriander leaves, and lemon juice. 
6. In a separate pot, boil rice until 70% cooked, then drain. 
7. Layer the rice over the chicken mixture, drizzle saffron milk on top. 
8. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes (Dum cooking). 
9. Serve hot with raita and boiled eggs.

Title: Vegetable Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice - 2 cups; Carrots (chopped) - 1/2 cup; Potatoes (cubed) - 1; Peas - 1/2 cup; Cauliflower florets - 1 cup; Onion (sliced) - 2; Tomato (chopped) - 1; Ginger-garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Green chilies (chopped) - 2; Yogurt - 1/2 cup; Biryani masala - 1 tbsp; Turmeric - 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Mint leaves - 1/2 cup; Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup; Saffron strands - a few; Warm milk - 1/4 cup; Ghee - 3 tbsp; Oil - 2 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Water - 4 cups
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil and ghee, fry onions until golden brown. 
3. Add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and tomatoes, cook until soft. 
4. Add all chopped vegetables, chili powder, turmeric, biryani masala, and salt, sauté. 
5. Stir in yogurt, mint, and coriander leaves. 
6. In a separate pot, boil rice until 70% cooked, then drain. 
7. Layer the rice over the vegetable mixture, drizzle saffron milk on top. 
8. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes (Dum cooking). 
9. Serve hot with raita and salad.

Title: Mutton Biryani
Ingredients: Basmati rice - 2.5 cups; Mutton (bone-in) - 750g; Onion (thinly sliced) - 3 large; Tomato (chopped) - 2 medium; Yogurt - 1 cup; Ginger-garlic paste - 2 tbsp; Green chilies (slit) - 3; Lemon juice - 2 tbsp; Coriander leaves - 1/2 cup; Mint leaves - 1/2 cup; Whole spices (bay leaf - 2, cloves - 4, cinnamon stick - 1 inch, cardamom - 3, star anise - 1, black peppercorns - 1/2 tsp); Red chili powder - 1.5 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1.5 tsp; Biryani masala - 2 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Saffron strands - a few; Warm milk - 1/4 cup; Ghee - 4 tbsp; Oil - 3 tbsp; Water - 5 cups
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak basmati rice for 30 minutes. 
2. Marinate the mutton with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric, coriander powder, garam masala, salt, and lemon juice. Keep it for at least 1 hour (overnight for better taste). 
3. Heat oil and ghee in a heavy-bottomed pot, fry whole spices for a few seconds until fragrant. 
4. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. 
5. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. 
6. Add marinated mutton, mix well, cover, and cook on low heat until tender (add water if needed). 
7. Boil water in a separate pot, add salt and soaked rice. Cook until 70% done, then drain. 
8. Layer the rice over the mutton mixture, sprinkle saffron milk, mint, and coriander leaves on top. 
9. Cover with a tight lid and cook on low flame (Dum cooking) for 25 minutes. 
10. Serve hot with raita and salad.

Title: Vindaloo Curry
Ingredients: Boneless meat (chicken/lamb/pork) - 500g; Onion (finely chopped) - 1 large; Tomato (pureed) - 2 medium; Garlic (minced) - 4 cloves; Ginger (grated) - 1 tbsp; White vinegar - 2 tbsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Cumin powder - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1 tsp; Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp; Dry red chilies - 2; Curry leaves - 6-8; Oil - 2 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Water - 1/2 cup; Fresh coriander (chopped) - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Marinate the meat with vinegar, red chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Let it rest for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, dry red chilies, and curry leaves. Let them splutter. 
3. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. 
4. Add garlic, ginger, and cook for a minute. 
5. Mix in tomato puree, coriander powder, cumin powder, and garam masala. Cook until the oil separates. 
6. Add marinated meat and stir well. Cook for 5-7 minutes until browned. 
7. Pour in water, cover, and simmer for 30-40 minutes until the meat is tender. 
8. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or naan.

Title: Gujarati Khichdi
Ingredients: Rice - 1 cup; Moong dal - 1/2 cup; Ghee - 2 tbsp; Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp; Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp; Curry leaves - 6-8; Green chilies (chopped) - 2; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Asafoetida - 1/4 tsp; Ginger (grated) - 1 tsp; Water - 4 cups; Salt - to taste; Fresh coriander (chopped) - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Wash rice and dal together and soak for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat ghee in a pressure cooker, add mustard seeds, cumin, curry leaves, green chilies, and asafoetida. 
3. Add turmeric and ginger, then mix in the drained rice and dal. 
4. Add water and salt, close the lid, and cook for 3-4 whistles. 
5. Let the pressure release naturally, then mix well and garnish with coriander. 
6. Serve hot with kadhi, pickles, or yogurt.

Title: Ven Pongal
Ingredients: Rice - 1 cup; Moong dal - 1/2 cup; Ghee - 2 tbsp; Black peppercorns - 1 tsp; Cumin seeds - 1 tsp; Curry leaves - 8-10; Ginger (grated) - 1 tsp; Cashew nuts - 8-10 (fried); Water - 4 cups; Salt - to taste
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak rice and dal for 30 minutes. 
2. Heat ghee, fry peppercorns, cumin, curry leaves, and ginger. 
3. Add rice, dal, salt, and water. Pressure cook for 3-4 whistles. 
4. Mix well and garnish with fried cashews. 
5. Serve with coconut chutney or sambar.

Title: Masala Khichdi
Ingredients: Rice - 1 cup; Moong dal - 1/2 cup; Ghee - 2 tbsp; Onion (chopped) - 1 medium; Tomato (chopped) - 1 large; Carrot (diced) - 1/2 cup; Peas - 1/4 cup; Green chilies (chopped) - 2; Cumin seeds - 1 tsp; Garam masala - 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Water - 4 cups; Salt - to taste
Instructions:
1. Heat ghee, sauté cumin, onions, and chilies. 
2. Add tomatoes, spices, and cook until soft. 
3. Mix in dal, rice, vegetables, salt, and water. Pressure cook for 3 whistles. 
4. Serve hot with curd or pickle.

Title: Malai Kulfi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Condensed milk - 1/2 cup; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped nuts (almonds, pistachios) - 2 tbsp; Saffron strands - a few
Instructions:
1. Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and reduce to half while stirring. 
2. Add sugar, condensed milk, cardamom, saffron, and mix well. 
3. Let it cool slightly, then pour into kulfi molds. 
4. Freeze for 6-8 hours or until set. 
5. Unmold and serve chilled.

Title: Mango Kulfi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Condensed milk - 1/2 cup; Ripe mango pulp - 1/2 cup; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Chopped nuts - 2 tbsp
Instructions:
1. Reduce milk in a pan by half, stirring continuously. 
2. Add sugar, condensed milk, cardamom, and mix well. 
3. Let it cool, then mix in the mango pulp. 
4. Pour into molds and freeze for 6-8 hours. 
5. Unmold and serve.

Title: Pista Kulfi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Condensed milk - 1/2 cup; Pistachios (ground) - 3 tbsp; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Saffron strands - a few
Instructions:
1. Heat milk and reduce to half. 
2. Add sugar, condensed milk, cardamom, saffron, and mix well. 
3. Stir in ground pistachios. 
4. Cool slightly, pour into molds, and freeze for 6-8 hours. 
5. Serve chilled.

Title: Kesar Badam Kulfi
Ingredients: Full cream milk - 1 liter; Sugar - 1/4 cup; Condensed milk - 1/2 cup; Almonds (ground) - 3 tbsp; Cardamom powder - 1/2 tsp; Saffron strands - a few
Instructions:
1. Heat milk and reduce to half. 
2. Add sugar, condensed milk, cardamom, and saffron. 
3. Stir in ground almonds. 
4. Pour into molds and freeze for 6-8 hours. 
5. Serve chilled.

Title: Kadhi Chawal
Ingredients:
For Kadhi:
Gram flour (besan) - 1/2 cup; Yogurt (sour) - 1 cup; Water - 3 cups; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp; Salt - to taste; Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp; Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp; Fenugreek seeds - 1/4 tsp; Asafoetida (hing) - a pinch; Curry leaves - 6-7; Green chilies (slit) - 2; Garlic (finely chopped) - 3 cloves; Ginger (grated) - 1 tsp; Oil or ghee - 2 tbsp

For Pakoras:
Gram flour (besan) - 1/2 cup; Onion (sliced) - 1/2; Spinach (chopped) - 1/4 cup; Carom seeds (ajwain) - 1/2 tsp; Baking soda - a pinch; Salt - to taste; Water - as needed; Oil - for frying

For Chawal (Rice):
Basmati rice - 1 cup; Water - 2 cups; Salt - to taste
Instructions:
1. Prepare Pakoras:
   - Mix gram flour, sliced onion, chopped spinach, carom seeds, salt, and baking soda. Add water gradually to make a thick batter.
   - Heat oil and deep-fry small portions of the batter until golden brown. Drain and set aside.

2. **Prepare Kadhi**:
   - In a bowl, whisk together gram flour, yogurt, water, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt until smooth.
   - Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin, fenugreek seeds, asafoetida, curry leaves, green chilies, ginger, and garlic. Sauté for a minute.
   - Pour in the yogurt-besan mixture, bring to a boil, and let it simmer on low heat for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
   - Add the fried pakoras to the kadhi and let them soak for 5 minutes.

3. **Prepare Rice**:
   - Wash and soak basmati rice for 15 minutes.
   - In a pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil, add salt, and cook rice until soft and fluffy.

4. **Serve**:
   - Serve hot kadhi with steamed basmati rice, garnished with coriander leaves and a drizzle of ghee.
ServingSize: 1 bowl kadhi + 1 bowl rice per serving
Equipment: Heavy-bottomed pan, Frying pan, Rice cooker

Title: Bhungra Bataka
Ingredients:
For Bataka (Potato Sabzi):
Baby potatoes - 500g; Oil - 3 tbsp; Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp; Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp; Asafoetida (hing) - a pinch; Green chilies (chopped) - 3; Garlic (chopped) - 1 tbsp; Curry leaves - 8-10; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Cumin powder - 1 tsp; Salt - to taste; Water - 1/2 cup; Coriander leaves (chopped) - for garnish

For Bhungra (Crispy Pipes/Snacks):
Ready-made Bhungra (gram flour-based pipes) - 200g

For Serving:
Spicy garlic chutney - as needed; Green chutney - as needed; Lemon wedges - for garnish
Instructions:
1. Prepare Bataka (Potato Sabzi):
   - Wash and boil baby potatoes until soft. Peel and keep them whole.
   - Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Let them crackle.
   - Add chopped green chilies, garlic, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
   - Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Mix well.
   - Pour in 1/2 cup water and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
   - Add boiled potatoes, coat them in the masala, and cook on low heat for 10 minutes.
   - Garnish with coriander leaves.

2. **Serving Bhungra Bataka:**
   - Arrange crispy Bhungra on a plate.
   - Serve hot Bataka (spicy potato sabzi) on the side.
   - Add spicy garlic chutney and green chutney as dips.
   - Garnish with lemon wedges for an authentic Kathiyawadi touch.

Title: Panchputiyu Shaak with Puri
Ingredients:
For Panchputiyu Sabji:-
Potatoes (cubed) - 1 cup; Brinjal (cubed) - 1 cup; Cluster beans (Gawar) - 1/2 cup; Surti papdi - 1/2 cup; Drumsticks - 1/2 cup; Green peas - 1/2 cup; Oil - 3 tbsp; Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp; Cumin seeds - 1/2 tsp; Asafoetida (Hing) - a pinch; Green chilies (chopped) - 2; Garlic paste - 1 tbsp; Ginger paste - 1 tbsp; Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp; Red chili powder - 1 tsp; Coriander powder - 1 tsp; Cumin powder - 1 tsp; Jaggery - 1 tbsp; Salt - to taste; Lemon juice - 1 tbsp; Fresh coriander (chopped) - for garnish\n\n
For Puri:\n
Whole wheat flour - 2 cups; Semolina (rava) - 2 tbsp; Salt - 1/2 tsp; Oil - 1 tbsp (for dough); Water - as needed; Oil - for deep frying
Instructions:
1. Prepare Panchputiyu Shaak:
   - Heat oil in a pan. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and asafoetida. Let them splutter.
   - Add chopped green chilies, garlic paste, and ginger paste. Sauté for a minute.
   - Add turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder. Mix well.
   - Add all the vegetables, salt, and jaggery. Mix everything thoroughly.
   - Add 1/2 cup water, cover the pan, and cook on low flame until vegetables are soft.
   - Finish with lemon juice and garnish with fresh coriander.\n\n
2. Prepare Puri:
   - In a mixing bowl, combine whole wheat flour, semolina, salt, and 1 tbsp oil.
   - Gradually add water and knead into a stiff dough.
   - Divide into small balls and roll into small discs.
   - Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the puris until golden brown.
   - Drain excess oil on paper towels.
3. Serving:
   - Serve hot Panchputiyu Shaak with crispy, puffed puris.
   - Accompany with pickles and buttermilk for an authentic Gujarati meal.

Title: Moong Dal Chilla with Stuffed Paneer Filling
Ingredients:
For Chilla:  
    - 1 cup yellow moong dal (split & skinned green gram)  
    - 1/2 inch ginger, chopped  
    - 1 green chili, chopped  
    - 1/2 tsp cumin seeds  
    - 1/4 tsp turmeric powder  
    - 1/2 tsp salt  
    - 1/4 cup water (for grinding)  
    - 1/4 cup finely chopped coriander leaves  
    - 1 tbsp rice flour (optional, for crispiness)  
    - 2 tbsp oil (for cooking)  

    For Stuffing:  
    - 1/2 cup paneer, crumbled  
    - 1/4 cup onion, finely chopped  
    - 1/4 cup capsicum, finely chopped  
    - 1/4 tsp black pepper powder  
    - 1/2 tsp chaat masala  
    - 1/4 tsp salt  
    - 1 tbsp coriander leaves, chopped  
    - 1 tsp lemon juice
Instructions:
1. Soak & Blend Dal: Soak moong dal in water for 4 hours. Drain and blend with ginger, green chili, cumin seeds, and water to form a smooth batter.  
    2. Prepare Batter: Transfer to a bowl, add turmeric powder, salt, coriander, and rice flour (optional). Mix well and let it rest for 10 minutes.  
    3. Prepare Stuffing: In a bowl, mix crumbled paneer, onions, capsicum, black pepper, chaat masala, salt, coriander, and lemon juice. Set aside.  
    4. Cook Chilla: Heat a tawa, grease with oil, and pour a ladleful of batter. Spread into a circular shape. Cook on medium flame for 2 minutes.  
    5. Add Stuffing & Fold:Spread the paneer mixture over the chilla. Fold in half and press gently. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until golden brown.  
    6. Serve Hot: Serve with green chutney or yogurt. Enjoy!

Title: Rava Pudla
Ingredients:
1 cup Semolina, 
½ cup Yogurt,
 ½ cup Water,
 ½ cup Chopped Vegetables (onion, capsicum, tomato, carrot), 
1 tsp Ginger-Garlic Paste,
 1-2 Green Chilies, 
¼ tsp Turmeric,
 ½ tsp Cumin Seeds, 
½ tsp Red Chili Powder,
 ½ tsp Salt, 
½ tsp Eno/Baking Soda,
 1 tbsp Coriander Leaves, 
1 tsp Lemon Juice, 
2 tbsp Oil
Instructions:
1.Prepare the batter: In a bowl, mix semolina, yogurt, and water. Let it rest for 10 minutes so the semolina absorbs the liquid.
	 2.Add spices & veggies: Add chopped vegetables, ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, turmeric, cumin seeds, red chili powder, salt, and lemon juice. Mix well.
	 3.Make the batter fluffy: Just before making the pudla, add Eno (or baking soda) and mix lightly.
     4.Cook the pudla: Heat a pan, grease it with a little oil, and pour a ladle of batter. Spread it evenly.
     5.Flip & cook: Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes, then flip and cook the other side until golden brown.
     6.Serve hot: Serve with chutney or ketchup.

Title: Sabudana Khichdi (Regular)
Ingredients:
Sabudana (tapioca pearls) - 1 cup,
 Water - 1/2 cup (for soaking),  
Peanuts - 1/4 cup (roasted & coarsely ground), 
Green chilies - 2 (finely chopped),  
Potatoes - 1 medium (boiled & diced), 
Onion - 1 medium (chopped),  
Ghee/Oil - 2 tbsp, 
Cumin seeds - 1 tsp, 
Mustard seeds - 1/2 tsp,  
Curry leaves - 6-8, 
Turmeric powder - 1/2 tsp, 
Red chili powder - 1/2 tsp,  
Salt - as per taste, 
Lemon juice - 1 tbsp,
 Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (chopped)
Instructions:
1. Wash sabudana under running water until the water runs clear.  
2. Soak the sabudana in just enough water to cover them (about 1/2 cup) for 4-6 hours or overnight.  
3. After soaking, fluff the sabudana with a fork to separate the pearls.  
4. Heat ghee/oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.  
5. Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.  
6. Add chopped green chilies, curry leaves, and boiled potatoes. Stir well.  
7. Add turmeric powder and red chili powder, and mix.  
8. Add the soaked sabudana, salt, and roasted peanut powder.  
9. Cook on low flame, stirring occasionally, until sabudana turns translucent (about 5-7 minutes).  
10. Turn off the heat and add lemon juice and chopped coriander leaves.  
11. Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

Title: Sabudana Tikki (Vrat-Friendly)
Ingredients:
1 cup sabudana (tapioca pearls),
2 medium potatoes (boiled and mashed),
2 tbsp roasted peanuts (crushed),
1 green chili (finely chopped),
1/2 tsp cumin seeds,
2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves,
1/2 tsp rock salt (sendha namak),
1/2 tsp black pepper powder,
1 tsp lemon juice,
1/2 tsp grated ginger,
1 tbsp arrowroot flour (or singhara atta for binding),
Oil or ghee for shallow frying
Instructions:
1. Rinse sabudana thoroughly and soak it in water for 4-5 hours or overnight. Drain excess water.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine soaked sabudana, mashed potatoes, crushed peanuts, chopped green chili, cumin seeds, coriander leaves, rock salt, black pepper powder, lemon juice, and grated ginger.
3. Add arrowroot flour and mix everything well to form a dough.
4. Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into small flat tikkis.
5. Heat a pan with oil or ghee and shallow-fry the tikkis on medium flame until golden brown on both sides.
6. Remove and place them on a paper towel to absorb excess oil.
7. Serve hot with vrat-friendly coconut chutney or yogurt.

Title: Podi Idli
Ingredients:
For Idli: 1 cup Idli Rice,
	½ cup Urad Dal, 
	¼ teaspoon Fenugreek Seeds,
	Salt(according to taste), 
       Water, 
	Oil.  
     For Tempering & Coating:
         2 tbsp Ghee,
	 1 tsp Mustard Seeds,
	 1 tsp Urad Dal, 
	 1 tsp Chana Dal, 
	 2 Dry Red Chilies,  
     8-10 Curry Leaves,
	 ¼ tsp Asafoetida,
	 ¼ tsp Turmeric,
	 3 tbsp Idli Podi,
	 ½ tsp Salt, 
	 2 tsp Water, 
	 12 Mini Idlis.
Instructions:
1. Wash and soak idli rice for 6 hours, urad dal & fenugreek seeds for 4 hours.  
     2. Grind urad dal to a smooth batter and rice to a coarse paste. Mix, add salt, and ferment overnight.  
     3. Grease idli molds, pour batter, and steam for 10-12 minutes. Let cool and unmold.  
     4. Heat ghee, add mustard seeds, urad dal, chana dal, dry red chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida, and turmeric powder.  
     5. Add idli podi and salt, sprinkle water, and mix well.  
     6. Add steamed idlis, toss until well coated, and serve hot with coconut chutney.

Title: Honey Chili Lotus Stem
Ingredients:
• 200g lotus stem (sliced thinly)  ,
  • 2 tbsp cornflour  ,
  • 2 tbsp all-purpose flour,  
  • 1/2 tsp salt  ,
  • 1/2 tsp black pepper powder,  
  • 1/2 tsp red chili powder  ,
  • 1/4 cup water (or as needed for batter),  
  • Oil for frying  ,

  **For Sauce:**  
  • 1 tbsp oil  ,
  • 1 tbsp finely chopped garlic  ,
  • 1 tbsp finely chopped ginger  ,
  • 2 tbsp chopped spring onions  ,
  • 1 tbsp red chili sauce  ,
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce  ,
  • 1 tbsp vinegar  ,
  • 1 tbsp tomato ketchup  ,
  • 1 tbsp honey  ,
  • 1/2 tsp sesame seeds  ,
  • 1/4 tsp black pepper powder , 
  • 1/4 tsp salt (adjust to taste),
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Lotus Stem:**  
     - Wash and peel the lotus stem. Slice it thinly into rounds.  
     - Boil the slices in water for 5-7 minutes until slightly tender. Drain and let them dry.  

  2. **Prepare the Batter:**  
     - In a mixing bowl, add cornflour, all-purpose flour, salt, black pepper powder, and red chili powder.  
     - Add water gradually and mix to form a smooth, thick batter.  

  3. **Fry the Lotus Stem:**  
     - Heat oil in a pan for deep frying.  
     - Dip the lotus stem slices in the batter and fry them in hot oil until golden and crispy.  
     - Remove and drain on a paper towel.  

  4. **Prepare the Sauce:**  
     - Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Add chopped garlic and ginger. Sauté for a few seconds.  
     - Add chopped spring onions and stir-fry for a minute.  
     - Add red chili sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, tomato ketchup, honey, sesame seeds, black pepper powder, and salt.  
     - Stir well and let the sauce cook for a minute until slightly thickened.  

  5. **Combine & Serve:**  
     - Add the fried lotus stem slices to the sauce and toss well until they are well coated.  
     - Garnish with more spring onions and sesame seeds.  
     - Serve hot as a snack or appetizer.

Title: Honey Chilli Potato
Ingredients:
• 3 medium potatoes (cut into thin fingers)  ,
   • 3 tbsp cornflour  ,
   • 2 tbsp all-purpose flour (maida)  ,
   • ½ tsp salt  ,
   • ½ tsp black pepper powder  ,
   • Water (as required, for batter)  ,
   • Oil (for deep frying)  ,
   • 1 tbsp sesame seeds (for garnish)  ,
   • 2 tbsp spring onions (chopped, for garnish)  ,


   **For Sauce:- **  
   • 2 tbsp oil  ,
