   • 1 tbsp finely chopped garlic  ,
   • 1 tbsp finely chopped ginger  ,
   • 1 small onion (sliced)  ,
   • 1 small capsicum (sliced)  ,
   • 1 tbsp soy sauce  ,
   • 1 tbsp red chilli sauce  ,
   • 1 tbsp tomato ketchup  ,
   • 1 tbsp honey  ,
   • ½ tsp vinegar  ,
   • ½ tsp red chilli flakes  ,
   • ½ tsp salt (adjust to taste)  ,
   • ½ tsp black pepper powder  ,
   • 1 tbsp cornflour mixed in 2 tbsp water (slurry)  ,
   • 2 tbsp water (if needed),
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Potatoes:**  
      • Peel and cut potatoes into thin fingers. Wash them in cold water to remove excess starch.  
      • Boil water in a pan, add a pinch of salt, and blanch the potato fingers for 3-4 minutes. Drain and let them dry.  

  2. **Coat and Fry the Potatoes:**  
      • In a bowl, mix cornflour, all-purpose flour, salt, and black pepper. Add a little water to make a thick batter.  
      • Coat the potato fingers evenly in the batter.  
      • Heat oil in a deep pan and fry the potatoes in batches until golden and crispy.  
      • Remove and drain on paper towels. For extra crispiness, refry them once for a few seconds.  

  3. **Prepare the Sauce:**  
      • Heat oil in a pan, add chopped garlic and ginger, and sauté for a few seconds.  
      • Add sliced onions and capsicum. Stir-fry on high flame for a minute.  
      • Add soy sauce, red chilli sauce, tomato ketchup, honey, vinegar, red chilli flakes, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.  
      • Add cornflour slurry and stir until the sauce thickens.  

  4. **Combine Everything:**  
      • Toss the crispy fried potatoes into the sauce and coat them well.  
      • Cook for a minute until everything is well combined.  

  5. **Garnish and Serve:**  
      • Sprinkle sesame seeds and chopped spring onions on top.  
      • Serve hot and enjoy!

Title: Rava Dosa
Ingredients:
• 200g Semolina (Rava/Sooji),  
   • 50g Rice flour  ,
   • 50g All-purpose flour (Maida)  ,
   • ½ tsp Cumin seeds  ,
   • ½ tsp Black pepper (crushed) , 
   • 1 Green chili (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1 tsp Ginger (grated)  ,
   • 1 tbsp Coriander leaves (chopped) , 
   • 1 Onion (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1 sprig Curry leaves (chopped)  ,
   • ½ tsp Salt (adjust to taste)  ,
   • 500ml Water (adjust for consistency) , 
   • 1 tbsp Yogurt (optional, for slight tanginess) , 
   • 1 tbsp Oil or Ghee (for cooking each dosa)
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine semolina, rice flour, and all-purpose flour.  
   2. Add cumin seeds, crushed black pepper, chopped green chili, grated ginger, chopped onion, coriander leaves, and curry leaves.  
   3. Add salt and mix well.  
   4. Gradually add water to the dry ingredients, stirring continuously to make a thin, runny batter. Let it rest for 15–20 minutes.  
   5. Heat a non-stick or cast-iron dosa tawa on medium-high heat.  
   6. Lightly grease the tawa with oil or ghee.  
   7. Stir the batter (as the semolina settles at the bottom) and pour a ladleful onto the tawa from a height, allowing holes to form naturally.  
   8. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges and cook on medium flame until crispy and golden.  
   9. No need to flip; remove from the pan once the edges lift slightly.  
   10. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.
Equipment: Mixing bowl, Whisk, Non-stick or Cast-iron Tawa, Ladle

Title: Onion Rava Dosa
Ingredients:
• 200g Semolina (Rava/Sooji) , 
   • 50g Rice flour  ,
   • 50g All-purpose flour (Maida) , 
   • ½ tsp Cumin seeds  ,
   • ½ tsp Black pepper (crushed)  ,
   • 1 Green chili (finely chopped) , 
   • 1 tsp Ginger (grated)  ,
   • 2 Onions (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1 tbsp Coriander leaves (chopped) , 
   • 1 sprig Curry leaves (chopped)  ,
   • ½ tsp Salt (adjust to taste)  ,
   • 500ml Water (adjust for consistency) , 
   • 1 tbsp Yogurt (optional, for slight tanginess),  
   • 1 tbsp Oil or Ghee (for cooking each dosa)
Instructions:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine semolina, rice flour, and all-purpose flour.  
   2. Add cumin seeds, crushed black pepper, chopped green chili, grated ginger, chopped onions, coriander leaves, and curry leaves.  
   3. Add salt and mix well.  
   4. Gradually add water, stirring continuously to make a thin batter. Let it rest for 15–20 minutes.  
   5. Heat a non-stick or cast-iron dosa tawa on medium-high heat.  
   6. Lightly grease the tawa with oil or ghee.  
   7. Stir the batter well and pour a ladleful onto the tawa from a height, ensuring a lace-like texture.  
   8. Sprinkle some additional chopped onions on top for extra flavor.  
   9. Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges and cook until crispy and golden.  
   10. Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.
Equipment: Mixing bowl, Whisk, Non-stick or Cast-iron Tawa, Ladle

Title: Tandoori Momos
Ingredients:
• 200g Paneer (cubed)  ,
   • 1 cup Cabbage (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1/2 cup Carrot (grated)  ,
   • 1/2 cup Capsicum (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1/2 cup Onion (finely chopped) , 
   • 1/2 tsp Salt  ,
   • 1/2 tsp Black Pepper Powder  ,
   • 1/2 tsp Red Chili Powder  ,
   • 1/2 tsp Garam Masala , 
   • 1 tbsp Ginger-Garlic Paste  ,
   • 1 tbsp Coriander Leaves (finely chopped)  ,
   • 1 cup All-Purpose Flour (Maida)  ,
   • 1/4 cup Water (for kneading dough) , 
   • 1 tbsp Oil  ,
   • 1 tbsp Yogurt (for marination)  ,
   • 1 tbsp Tandoori Masala , 
   • 1 tbsp Lemon Juice , 
   • 1 tbsp Mustard Oil , 
   • 1/4 tsp Turmeric Powder  ,
   • 1 tbsp Butter (for grilling)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Dough**  
      • In a mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour and a pinch of salt.  
      • Add water gradually and knead into a smooth dough.  
      • Cover and let it rest for 20 minutes.  

   2. **Prepare the Filling**  
      • Heat oil in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste.  
      • Add onions and sauté until translucent.  
      • Add capsicum, carrots, and cabbage. Stir-fry for 2 minutes.  
      • Add salt, black pepper, garam masala, and mix well.  
      • Turn off the heat, add chopped coriander leaves, and let the mixture cool.  

   3. **Shape the Momos**  
      • Divide the dough into small portions and roll into thin circles.  
      • Place 1 tbsp of filling in the center of each circle.  
      • Fold and pleat the edges to seal the momos.  

   4. **Steam the Momos**  
      • Steam the momos in a greased steamer for 10-12 minutes or until they turn glossy.  

   5. **Prepare Tandoori Marination**  
      • In a bowl, mix yogurt, tandoori masala, turmeric, mustard oil, lemon juice, and red chili powder.  
      • Add the steamed momos and coat them well in the marinade.  
      • Let them marinate for 15-20 minutes.  

   6. **Grill the Momos**  
      • Heat a pan with butter or use a tandoor/grill.  
      • Place marinated momos and grill them until they get a charred, smoky texture.  
      • Flip occasionally to ensure even grilling.  

   7. **Serving**  
      • Serve hot with mint chutney and mayonnaise. Enjoy your delicious Tandoori Momos!

Title: Sindhi Kadhi
Ingredients:
• 2 tbsp Oil  ,
   • 1 tsp Mustard Seeds  ,
   • 1 tsp Cumin Seeds,  
   • 1/2 tsp Fenugreek Seeds (Methi Dana) , 
   • 1/2 tsp Asafoetida (Hing) , 
   • 1 tbsp Gram Flour (Besan) , 
   • 3-4 Dry Red Chilies,  
   • 10-12 Curry Leaves  ,
   • 1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder  ,
   • 1 tbsp Red Chili Powder , 
   • 1 tbsp Coriander Powder  ,
   • 4 cups Water  ,
   • 1 cup Tamarind Pulp,  
   • 1 tsp Jaggery (optional, for slight sweetness)  ,
   • Salt to taste  ,
   • 200g Potatoes (cubed)  ,
   • 100g Drumsticks (cut into 2-inch pieces)  ,
   • 150g Okra (Bhindi) – trimmed and cut into halves,,  
   • 100g Carrots (sliced)  ,
   • 100g Cluster Beans (Guvar)  ,
   • 100g Cauliflower (small florets)  ,
   • 100g Pumpkin (cubed)  ,
   • 2 tbsp Coriander Leaves (chopped, for garnish)
Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan on medium flame.  
   2. Add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, fenugreek seeds, and asafoetida. Let them splutter.  
   3. Add dry red chilies and curry leaves. Sauté for a few seconds.  
   4. Add gram flour (besan) and roast it on low flame until it turns golden brown and aromatic.  
   5. Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Mix well.  
   6. Slowly pour in 4 cups of water while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.  
   7. Add tamarind pulp, jaggery (if using), and salt. Stir well.  
   8. Add potatoes, drumsticks, carrots, cluster beans, cauliflower, pumpkin, and okra.  
   9. Let the kadhi simmer on medium-low heat for 25-30 minutes until vegetables are cooked.  
   10. Stir occasionally and adjust consistency by adding water if needed.  
   11. Once done, garnish with chopped coriander leaves.  
   12. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Title: Paneer Shawarma
Ingredients:
• 200g Paneer (cubed)  ,
    • 1/2 cup Hung Curd (thick yogurt)  ,
    • 1 tbsp Lemon Juice  ,
    • 1 tbsp Ginger-Garlic Paste  ,
    • 1 tbsp Shawarma Spice Mix , 
    • 1/2 tsp Red Chili Powder , 
    • 1/2 tsp Turmeric Powder , 
    • 1/2 tsp Cumin Powder , 
    • 1/2 tsp Coriander Powder  ,
    • 1 tbsp Olive Oil (for marination)  ,
    • 1 tbsp Butter (for cooking)  ,
    • 1/2 tsp Salt (adjust as per taste)  ,
    • 1/2 tsp Black Pepper Powder  ,
    • 1 Onion (sliced)  ,
    • 1 Tomato (sliced)  ,
    • 1/2 cup Cabbage (shredded)  ,
    • 2 Pita Breads or Lebanese Wraps , 
    • 2 tbsp Garlic Sauce (Toum)  ,
    • 1 tbsp Mayonnaise  ,
    • 1 tbsp Pickled Cucumbers (optional)
Instructions:
1. **Prepare the Marinade:**  
       - In a bowl, mix hung curd, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, shawarma spice mix, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.  
       - Add paneer cubes and coat well. Cover and let it marinate for at least **1 hour** (preferably overnight for best flavor).  

    2. **Cooking the Paneer:**  
       - Heat butter in a pan over **medium heat**.  
       - Add marinated paneer and cook until golden brown and slightly crispy. Stir occasionally for even cooking.  

    3. **Prepare the Wrap:**  
       - Warm the pita bread or Lebanese wrap on a tawa or skillet.  
       - Spread a layer of garlic sauce (Toum) and mayonnaise.  

    4. **Assemble the Shawarma:**  
       - Add cooked paneer on top of the sauce.  
       - Place sliced onions, tomatoes, shredded cabbage, and pickled cucumbers.  
       - Roll the wrap tightly, securing the filling inside.  

    5. **Final Touch:**  
       - Heat the wrapped shawarma on a tawa or grill for **1-2 minutes** to make it crisp.  
       - Cut into halves and serve hot with extra garlic sauce or hummus.
